285rS6UjBUVjZ46GfqFvQA.text: My husband and I wanted somewhere to eat right on the Vegas strip that would be good quality. We stopped at the place and it didn't disappoint. We had a WONDERFUL waitress. I hate I can't remember name but she has curly hair. She made our experience great. It was like she was reading our kids. The food was really good. The chicken I added in my pasta was a little bland but over all the dish was great. We ordered white bean hummus as our appetizer and it was the best hummus I've ever had. For our dinner plates I ordered a pasta dish and added chicken and my husband ordered the other pasta dish that had bacon and he added shrimp. Our wonderful waitress put together a fantastic wine concoction for me after hearing what I liked and it was great! I had 2 glasses. We would definitely recommend and go back when we're in Vegas.

yiSLVBSS3LTcrOvCXYFJWQ.text: I recommend making a reservation, this place is really popular regardless of when you  go. The food is good, the feel is way better. Its trendy and great for large or small groups.  Can't wait to come back and try their dinner menu.

h7Tu7ymV10OxdUcPnUUMiw.text: Absolutely loved this place ! Amazing customer service . My boyfriend and I went for Valentine's Day and we got to sit outside and enjoy the beautiful bellagio fountains ! I loved it the food was spectacular !!

22EnBxczoFnB8OneM5p2Jw.text: This place is amazing! The food was fantastic and the service was even better. Sean and Shannon were our waiters and they killed it. Super attentive and nice. We had bottomless mimosas and Shannon came around often to refill. He even gave us to go cups at the end! We were in Vegas for a bachelorette party and Sean made the bride-to-be feel so special.   Hexx is a lot of fun and super lively. The music is pumping and people are having a great time. Definitely check it out and tell Sean and Shannon we say hi :)

ZpVHHoaSGRFEVTPomlTo5w.text: Great breakfast and awesome customer service. The hostess went out of her way to find the cost of the GIANT Moet bottle of champagne in the front window for my curious young children.   $1,800 by the way!  Our waiter, Sean, was outstanding. When they couldn't find crayons to go with our kids' menus, Sean actually offered to go to the CVS and buy them some!  He explained the menu, brought the food fast, and kept our drinks filled. His assistant, Patrick, was equally as helpful. Will definitely come back!

XfS0BRRyge3lJ_cmqd4jBg.text: We went there for lunch & asked to sit outside. We were told by a hostess that the wait would be 25 minutes (even though we were the only party waiting & there were empty small tables outside). My wife then asked another hostess who told her that it would be 15 minutes.  Within 6-7 minutes we were seated at a table on the side of the porch (while the one in the middle was left unoccupied). Do they selectively pick certain patrons for the better seats? Both the server & the food, however, were excellent.  It was relaxing to people-watch while enjoying your food.  Unfortunately, not all the servers & hostesses exhibit a friendly attitude.

ggoy_9Fn_DtyFDAUtgSh9g.text: This was my first time at Hexx. I had the turkey club with bottomless mimosas. Our server was Tracee and she was the best. I didn't get to see the bottom of my mimosa glass because I was getting refills so quickly. We sat in the outdoor section where there was a cool mist spraying that had nice cooling effect as it was over a hundred degrees while we ate. Although the temperature was high we were totally comfortable.  Another special thank you to Tracee who was so nice and gave us great service. If you go to Hexx, try sit in Tracee's section and get on those bottomless mimosas.

GJtQlnRqZJeYj6D3jMEPTQ.text: Great breakfast place with a nice selection of bloody Mary's.   It's pricey but so is everything Vegas.

2HtjvjOsw4oSNYsTOCuzkQ.text: In Vegas looking for a breakfast spot that wasn't a buffet. Ended up finding Hexx on Yelp. One of the reviews mentioned he used a groupon. $30 gets you $50. I checked groupon and it was still on there!  So i arrived to Hexx.. right on the strip. Nice patio and super clean on the inside. I sat inside because it was hot.   The service was pretty good. My cup of water was never empty and the food didn't take too long  The cinnaroll waffle was really good. Just a tiny bit too sweet but still enjoyable.   The breakfast pizza was really fresh and good. Came with scrambled eggs and different kinds of meat  The french toast was "ehh" it wasn't too flavorful. Taste more like regular bread with syrup. But the fresh berries added a kick to it.   Overall I think Hexx had great food. I feel like you get your money worth. The restaurant itself is nice and tje service is good. Not to mention a great deal with the groupon they offer

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast and berries Cinnaroll waffle And breakfast pizza

cV60iS1Uhz4JjcoQGBpyqQ.text: Good Food and Location  I recently had brunch at HEXX.  I was pleasantly surprised by the place, the food and the service. All three were top notch.  The place is very large and on a Saturday morning it was super busy.  Although it was a big noisy, I liked the vibe of the crowd.  We sat at a table that was half in and half outside. Perfect for June.  The server was friendly and attentive.  You must try their fruit plate. It has a large variety of fruit. It was enough for 3 of us to start.  Next, I had steak and eggs. The steak was a petit New York strip. And was cooked perfectly, as were the eggs. The potatoes: delicious, along with a house-made English muffins which was super fluffy.  Other highlight, a actual stack of pancakes- it has been awhile since I have seen a tall stack of pancakes.   Their brunch cocktails should not be missed. They even have fun group drinks, that are ladled out at the table from a copper swan or disco ball.  I am looking forward to my next visit! Do make a reservation at peak times.  .

TjAdABnobS3LOa1onhQG8g.text: Perfect brunch spot for any occasion! They have $24 all you can drink mimosas until 2! Sitting outside offers the view of the Belagio water fountain shows every 15 minutes as well as fans and misters to keep you cool! The drinks were amazing! If you have a group, I highly recommend the disco ball punch or the $36 Bloody Mary! I love the chicken blt but the spinach and artichoke dip was delicious as well as the salads!!

vN8mp1FsL8K1kR-rMlwHrA.text: OMFG!! This place is amazing! Me and my boyfriend went here for dinner for the 1st time and from start to end everything was great! The host, our busser Justin Mahar and our server Dan Dixon were all great. Justin was always made sure our table was clear and our waters filled especially on a 112 degree weather. Dan knew everything on the menu, we took his recommendations for appetizers, entrees and desserts; we were not disappointed at all. For apps we ordered the fried calamari and poke, entree my boyfriend ordered the scallops and I ordered the salmon and both entrees just melted in your mouth. We really took our time indulging on it. And for dessert we had the smores semifreddo and the special which was a banana foster their way.   With the banana foster I did enjoy it but not as much as the smores semifreddo just because the bun on the plate was dense, if it was something lighter like a puff pastry I would enjoy it more.   Overall I would definitely visit again. And since dinner was amazing I wonder what their brunch is like. Also ask for Dan and Justin to serve you, pretty funny duo!

3IP4WoECNeLAQ0L1ZaMf7Q.text: We decided to eat a snack here because it was across from the Bellagio Fountains.  We sat outside and had a perfect view.  We ordered a pizza and garlic bread. The food was amazing.  I wish we would have gone for a whole meal instead of a snack.  I really enjoyed the atmosphere.  The service was more like an upscale restaurant.  There was someone constantly filling up my water glass and picking up the small pieces of trash, like the empty sweetener packet and straw wrapper, from my table.  In the same way it had a relaxed feeling.  I was dressed comfortable and casual, as we were walking around the strip prior to this.  I didn't feel underdressed.  Along with the fountains going off, it made a perfect Vegas night. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

4wNQU0QtodVIQbBGAC1SsA.text: I ordered a Groupon for 33$ for 50$ worth of food at Hexx kitchen. This is one of the restaurants "you don't judge a book by its cover". From the outside it seemed like an average restaurant located near the Paris hotel and the beer park. Going in -the layout, seating were perfect. There was a terrace with heaters but it was too cold to sit outside in Dec.  Food: my friend and I ordered a bunch of appetizers to share instead of a main meal- tapas style.  White bean hummus (3/5) was served a little chilled with pieces of naan like bread-it complimented well with the roasted cauliflower (3/5) that had curry styled spices; the baked spinach dip (3/5) was really nice that came with bagel chips; macaroni and cheese (2/5) a white cheddar based Mac -it lacked salt, but was perfectly cooked; lobster creamed corn (5/5) was by far my most favourite dish- the spice level was perfect with a generous amount of lobster.   For dessert : cake and shake (5/5) this dessert was so pretty! cream cheese mouse with a chocolate milkshake that comes in a cute souvenir mixer. I couldn't finish it- because I was so stuffed. My friend had a vegan based chocolate pudding that she enjoyed.   We has to pack most of our food to go, with so many leftovers!  A big shout out to Moon for his incredible service. He even made sure I has no ice in my water each time. The attention for detail put me in awe and is really what highlights his excellent customer service!   Thank you Hexx Kitchen for a wonderful dining experience!

6JJsUXJhg8oJANLQRP_KLQ.text: Honestly I really really wanted to love this place and it did start out great but it slowly went downhill. I probably should have read some of the signs when we first arrived. We went to brunch probably around 9 so we were definitely ahead of the usual brunch crowd yet there was a line out front to see the hostess table. I truly didn't understand why because I saw maybe 8 tables with people. Once I got closer I saw that there were 2 woman at the hostess table and one of them wasn't doing a thing. The one would walk others to their table and this woman would just stand there staring off into space without even acknowledging the next person. It was also strange that everyone before me got seated which was at most 3 tables and I was told it would be a 15 minute wait. Wait for what exactly? I see tons of tables open.   Of course I went with the eggs benedict for brunch. It's pretty much a no brainer that I order that if it's offered. It was by far one of the best eggs benny's I've ever had. It wasn't served on your traditional English muffin, it was served over scalloped potatoes. They were so cheesy and delicious I was sad when I cleared my plate. Full transparency that dish is the only reason I'm even giving this place a 2 star rating. I had also ordered a Bloody Mary with my meal which didn't come till after my food arrived and after I asked about it. Usually not a huge deal for me but given all the other service issues it was just annoying in this case.   So why the 1 star rating without the eggs benedict factored into the equation you ask? Because the service continued to go down hill and just disappoint me. Both my friend and I are huge yelpers and we take a lot of time to write reviews, check in, post photos, etc. We both checked in and asked about the free dessert offer. Even though we had already clearly communicated at the start of the meal that we wanted separate checks we were told it was 1 per table. Had I been someone who rarely even goes on yelp I probably wouldn't have cared but I put a lot of hours into yelp. We are the girls that write not just bad but awesome reviews as well. So I think it was pretty stupid to tell us we had to pick who gets a dessert or share. We are the people getting the word out for you. Sure it may not be great in this case but if you ran a better establishment it could have been a free advertisement for you essentially. And to clarify this review is by no means my way of getting back at them for it either.   By the time I got my dessert we had already asked our waiter for our separate checks 2 times at this point. After the 2nd ask he finally brought a check. One combined check. So we had to ask yet again for a separate check. It was honestly irritating that I even had to ask in the first place. No one should ever assume people are paying together. You should always ask if it's together or separate. I don't care what is more convenient for you. I've worked with food before and I always asked the customer before ringing it up. When the "separate" checks arrived it was really just 1 slip with it separated out. So we had to then tell him which card was who's so he could charge our cards correctly.  Honestly no one should have had to deal with the crap we dealt with at this restaurant. While the dish was amazing I don't think I could deal with the service simply to eat it again.

oUcAnzdjUAx-GySJjTBAUg.text: Loved the setting. We were on date, and I couldn't have asked for a better environment. We watched the strip and the water fountains at the Bellagio while having some great good. The serving sizes were decent, the service was excellent, and the food was delicious.

101yDDYrNUPhDW8puKVBNQ.text: We had an early dinner (5:40-ish) on a Friday. This location is great as it's right at the base of the mini-Eiffel Tower and directly across from the Bellagio's water fountains. The service was good and our food was delicious. The filet mignon was one of the better steaks we've had out in quite a while. It's rather expensive though and didn't come with a side item. Shrimp limone was very good with plenty of shrimp (I was pleasantly surprised). Great bar menu and wine list. A nice meal.

Cdp54pPADb2ytrGVa4oYRA.text: ________________________ \                                              / /   -:: OVERALL RATING ::-   \ \                                              / /     5.0/5.0 :: Venue               \ \     4.0/5.0 :: Service              / /     4.5/5.0 :: Ambiance          \ \     4.0/5.0 :: Food                 / /_______________________\  -:::- VENUE/AMBIANCE  -:::-   Hexx is 30,000-square-foot restaurant situated conveniently in the heart of the Las Vegas strip at the Paris hotel with a magnificent view of the Bellagio fountains. Lots of spacious indoor, outdoor & bar seating. The bar does feature a row of high-top communal tables. Hexx has a very open, lively, relaxing & comfortable atmosphere that makes one dining experience that much more pleasurable. It is a spot for all occasions and any type of dining too (breakfast, lunch, dinner, late-night dining & desserts) for they are open 24 hours!  -:::- SERVICE  -:::-   Both my lunch visits here has been very enjoyable for the servers were very courteous & personable. They were attentive to our needs. But I wish the hostess could be a bit more inviting & friendlier. The encounter I had with the gal working there, was a little stand-offish (she wasn't rude or anything, but just wasn't so approachable) -- on both separate occasion when I visited.   -:::-  FOOD / MENU  -:::-  We purchased a Groupon deal and it was great catch! The menu does  lean toward an upscale-ish feel but yet it's approachable. For what we have tried the food served is fresh and came out in a timely manner. I would definitely return for it is a very walk-able destination on the strip & food here is satisfying.   Jumbo Lump Crab Cake   [4.0/5.0] Jambalaya                         [4.0/5.0] 8oz Filet Mignon                [4.0/5.0] 8oz Rip Cap                       [4.0/5.0] 14oz Ribeye                       [4.0/5.0]  Charred Asparagus            [4.0/5.0] Purple Haze Pitcher           [4.0/5.0]  -:::-  NOTES -:::-  1) Restrooms are looking inside the Paris hotel towards the back entrance of the restaurant & bar.

Would recommend this place to friends. Really liked the service here our waiter Apolo was great would return on our next Vegas trip.

aivL2SG95Z2iRNRW8tvfMA.text: I wanted to say I enjoyed this spot but unfortunately I must say otherwise. I rarely come to Vegas and had noticed this spot on one of my last visits and found a Groupon. First off, we made reservations and were seated close to our time, and luckily for a decent seat outside on the patio. We ordered their steak and eggs, corn beef hash and also one coffee. Now, overall the ambiance was relaxing and nice for a brunch date. Food was decent but I would say I expected better. I would rate a 3/5 for the food. Service was slowwwww and I understand it was the holiday but even so, checking up on water considering it was 105 degree weather and also bc we were outdoors would have been nice.   Then comes the part that's a bit annoying. Now we had a Groupon that couldn't be honored because of the holidays. I noticed on the Groupon it blocked the big mother's/fathers/Easter/Christmas/new year but I didn't notice for 7/4. That being said, we were first told we had to hit exactly $50 to use it. Well, that doesn't make sense because I already paid for the Groupon if I used less it wouldn't make a difference them except for the fact they want you to go over to pay some. At that point we we told The waiter we would pay for a chocolate bar to go over to be able to use it.  Then the manager comes by, first saying his whole reasoning as to why he couldn't honor it. I was Hoping for some management help; considering we explained we were from out of town and leaving and didn't have time to come back the next day to use it as we could have had we stayed longer. Well he says to give him a minute (more like another 10m which wouldn't have been so bad except We were out in the sun, without water, slightly grouchy)   Well he comes back and says he can give us the value $30 of what I paid, but we have to pay the difference. But he asks me To see my Groupon to redeem it. Soooo; wait you can or can't redeem it?? No, he could redeem it he just wouldn't honor it due to it being holiday day. So he would give me the $30 value... but in all honestly, between paying my $30 and the $20 we went over to use our max Groupon. We paid $50 so we had no savings, no other specials for mediocre food and service. I was quite disappointed that he didn't just honor it or in all honesty told us he couldn't do anything and suggest we save it or return it to Groupon for Groupon bucks.   I have done business w Groupon before. So on top of what they made off of us $20, they still received their cut from our Groupon coupon. So either way I felt a little peeved about the whole situation.   It seemed very shady when they still were able to redeem but not honor. Because they will still get paid, and took it but just charged us extra. In all honesty it would have been a better deal to give it to a friend as a gift.   So, probably never going to Come back here bc the service was slow, food was mediocre, management was kind of poor. Left a bad taste in our mouths.

wDrjuJGdPYAjxsvBuo5Cvw.text: Terrible food, burnt edges on the tacos combined with mild seasoning. Would recommend they have their chef taste what they are putting out.   Wretched service with our waitress having been inattentive and showing no signs of care/customer service skills. Had initially walked in on a slower day saying my pregnant wife was feeling sick and needed water. It took five minutes to get said water on a non-busy day/time. This was made very clear towards the end of our dining experience when we stood to leave and the waitress immediately went to go collect the tip (walked over to our table within 20 seconds or so.)   That being said, the live music was fantastic, with a clear resonating sound. The host was also great, being very considerate of my wife.   Date of dinning: 4/16/19 Time: 9pm or so Waitress: Shorter African American woman, with curly black hair. Thinner build. Would recommend coaching on how to do her job, even how to smile and say hello would be a good start.

0FU1ZiGY4TZbSs9uUlDfbQ.text: Randomly stopped in for Brunch at this restaurant, the staff were awesome. Very nice and attentive and also friendly. The food was great, meat omelet was delicious and so filling I could not finish it! The only thing I didn't like was the pancakes, it's hard to mess up pancakes but they were rather thick and the bourbon syrup had too much of a bourbon Aftertaste. All else was amazing!

w70x-_fkLv-ftKBrEm1-Cg.text: This is by far hands down my favorite breakfast place in Vegas. My friend and I literally sat down to eat someplace else this morning and I threw a little baby tantrum because I wanted to come here...again!  I loveee the HEXX Benedict (hopefully that's what it is on the menu) I don't eat meat though so I sub spinach. I'm totally a potato girl so even though it comes on top of some delicious scalloped potatoes, I have to get a side of the even more delicious breakfast potatoes-along with a toasted butter croissant because omg *mouth waters* it's sooo good! I could seriously keep going on about this place but the inner fat girl inside of me is getting mad because now we want this yummy meal..again but it's too late lol.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loveeeee how open the dining space is! It&#39;s like you&#39;re sitting on the patio without sitting on the patio! So cute!

1fb2YxO55ikgLj6NeLheHg.text: Well, came on Sunday night and was slow inside. Thought service would better since it's slow, but NO. We waiting almost 20 mins for server to pick up our bill!   Food, overpriced with average quality. Maybe you got the view, but that's all! Price is close to Hell's kitchen but Hell's has much better quality and service.   Not a bad place for people don't know the area. But if you have been to Vegas couple times, then it will be a mistake to dine here because there are so many good restaurant out three with much better service and quality!

au8uYLbniPfhN7JP1VXd8A.text: Had fun and pleasant time here for breakfast. Get a seat outdoors as close to strip as possible for the sun and people watching. Started with bloody's and endless mimosas. The servers were great especially Antonio who made it fun with his timely refills with the mimosas. Chicken and waffles was awesome and my steak/eggs with potatoes cooked just right to order. Definately going back!

-_70NAP1K0vFOJhOYgYEWw.text: Delicious! We went for brunch and I wish we would have had the opportunity to go back for dinner. The carrot cake pancakes were so good! If the icing is too much for you, the pancake itself was great with just syrup. Love that they offer bottomless mimosas as well :)

sn0H02hQBRJL-YIEnl14nA.text: Great spot! Food was amazing, service even better! Our server was busy as hell. However he still kept his composure and treated each guest amazing. Kudos to him!! We chose the breakfast pizza and the chilaquiles. They were great!! I thought they would be spicy but they were just right! Definitely will come back!

8wEXHR9Gj-BhkW6vRLvhuQ.text: I came here on a Saturday afternoon for brunch. It was around 12pm and we luckily only had to wait about 10 minutes before we were seated. We were able to snag outdoor seating too! The waitress brought water out to us immediately and took our drink orders. I ordered a hot green tea, it comes out with its own little pot which was very convenient so I could refill my own teacup.   For my entree, I ordered the Gravlax Benedict, which comes with house made gravlax (raw salmon in salt, sugar and dill seasoning), english muffin, hollandaise, red onion and potatoes. The salmon was well seasoned, the egg was perfectly poached and the side of potatoes were amazing. The potatoes had a nice crispy burn to the skin, but not overdone where the potatoes were dried out. I was very happy with my order and I left very full. It was just the right amount of food, I didn't feel disgustingly stuffed. At $17, it was a little pricey, but it was a nice brunch with great service so I would say worth the price.  The restaurant is walking distance from the Planet Hollywood Hotel. They have a bottomless mimosas special for $23 that would be a great pregame before going out to party in Vegas :) HEXX was always packed every time I walked by it and I can understand why, I would definitely recommend this spot, especially for brunch :)

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gravlax Benedict

Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Omelet

22WIXTfmJGJpO3IIZqo6ew.text: Pretty bad experience overall! Their eggs Benedict is like flying the frontier airlines, you gotta specify and pay extra for the muffin and pay extra for each vegetable you want to add. Also don't make the mistake of asking for water without ice, apparently they fly all the way to California to get it, so you won't get water for a while.  The patio seating on the other hand is very beautiful and oversees the Bellagio fountains.

Xyk05odQvl36kLbpE16FiQ.text: Chose this place based on other reviews.  Had a wonderful experience!! Great service.. very friendly, attentive, helpful and always present. Food was amazing! I had the chilaquiles. They are apparently a customer favorite and I am glad I tried them!!  My friend had the ham and cheese croissant sandwich and added scrambled eggs to the sandwich. The croissant was flaky and delicious and the ham was very tasty! I would definitely return!

8kZrENpLyCW9H9oHnAnrXQ.text: Tracy is the best server ever. She made the entire experience enjoyable and our bottomless mimosas full!

JgjD8MmVxn43kwhabqmvQA.text: We came here for brunch and made a reservation online. turns out that if you want to sit outside, your reservation time is not accurate. We had to wait an additional 20 minutes to sit outside, with no option to request outside seating when reserving online, and sat at the indoor bar while waiting for our table. While at the bar we ordered a "Farmers market" bloody Mary and a morango cairpirinha (each$16). The farmers market bloody Mary was extremely tasty and comes highly recommended. However, the caipirinha should only be ordered if you enjoy cachaca and a very strong drink; we did not find it particularly enjoyable as it was not very well muddled.  When we finally did get a table, we ordered one order of bottomless mimosas  ($23)as well as the "Hexx Benedict" ($16) "and the "Hexx Burger" ($18). The bottomless mimosas go until 2 pm Monday to Sunday.  The Hexx Benedict were rather bland and under seasoned, although well cooked. The hollandaise was also perfectly done, although also bland. The portion size was small for the price, especially compared to the Hexx burger. We requested the Hexx burger medium rare, and found it to be cooked exactly to order as well as perfectly seasoned. Overall, we would reorder to the Hexx burger over the Hexx benedict, both for taste and portion size.  As far as the atmosphere, this is a great place to have brunch. You have a great view of the Bellagio fountains if you sit outside. The music selection was electric; a  mix of 90's and 00's pop hits and throwbacks from the 80's. The music sound volume wasn't overly distracting and provided a nice background and atmosphere.   This is a great place to go if you want a great brunch view overlooking the strip and reasonable pricing, although the pricing matches the food quality and requires advanced reservations as well as additional wait time if you want to sit outside.

bQmhj-r1JhXQQUPbjv_Nkg.text: Great brunch! Our server Tracy was fast and attentive and we loved the bottomless mimosas! Also try the sticky bun with cream cheese frosting. OMG.

-51gI9nuFcskuF9b_hT8JA.text: Girls trip to Vegas. Food=delicious. Waitress=great. View=beautiful. Cockroaches crawling across our feet=disgusting. Manager, Christian = childish, rude, unapologetic, more disgusting than the roaches. Witnessed the whole ordeal of people screaming, gagging, trying to stomp on them and after running my friend's credit card says NOTHING about the incident. Nothing. Not even an I'm sorry which would have sufficed. After complaining to him he LAUGHED. His female counterpart said to call security because we complained and warned the other patrons. 5 or 6 security showed up for 3 WOMEN just pointing out the rudeness. Do not give this establishment your business.

cQRog1Ue6MnwE_iLP_XhyQ.text: Great food! Good prices. We were able to make a last second reservation on OpenTable on a Saturday during Brunch. We arrived and saw a few open seats on the patio and asked if we could sit there and they were able to get us the perfect people watching spot against the rail. We could see the Bellagio fountains as well! Even with the brisk wind chill the heaters out on the patio were perfect. The bottomless mimosas were great! The waitress even changed my single mimosa to a bottomless mimosa without a fuss when I changed my mind at the last minute. I would definitely recommend this place!

nD5wGvRkv_N4v8fzAKTyIQ.text: HEXX BENEDICT are a must!   The potatoes and sauce on that plate are absolutely amazing.   My bf got the protein omelet and it was a great plate for someone who wants some eggs, potatoes, English bread (butter and jam provided)   They offer bottomless mimosas for $23.  I ordered the Bloody Mary but wasn't a huge fan.   Customer service 10/10, as soon as the drinks got close to finishing, they would refill.   Wait time wasn't too bad (20 min)

lTOh23fEDJCS2UK0a-YWXQ.text: This was our first night in Vegas and the first restaurant we had dinner at. It set the bar high!  We had six and were seated in less than 10 minutes. We had the kids with one of them being picky. They accommodated us easily. The service was very good and the food was excellent. I got the lobster gnocchi and it was delicious. All the dishes looked great. The dessert was awesome, a peanut butter and chocolate mouse with wine jelly and candies peanuts on top!  It was a lot and it was great. The kids got 15% off at the candy store (attached) with our receipt.    The prices were good for the quality. I didn't think much about it then. It as we continue to eat out in Las Vegas it was actually a good value for good quality.   Would definitely go again and even my 13 said he would go often.

4gz1pBp0T1V2xUmgn5x4ew.text: This is my new favorite breakfast place in Vegas!  Every single item on their menu is absolutely delicious!   I'm still working on trying them all, but I definitely have some favorites picked out already.  You can't visit without trying their carrot cake pancakes.  A close second is their cinnamon roll waffles.  If you have less of a sweet tooth, their breakfast pizza is made with a really delicious dough, and it is really filling.  This, hands down, beats any buffet in town.  You'll spend less and will still leave completely stuffed.    I already can't wait to go back again.  On a side note, I didn't try their bloody mary, but we saw one at a neighboring table.  It was the most impressive looking bloody mary I've ever seen.

-Fl6C2e9mZpsKHsint_vBg.text: First and foremost, Tracee is the name of the server we had and she is amazing. She kept the bottomless mimosas coming, there was a great DJ and she rapped over his music and didn't miss a beat getting us our food either. It's crazy but went for brunch and it was my favorite part of my first trip to Vegas

DDbr2lrlyhmvkhAqdilXoQ.text: We came across Hexx because it was right next to the hotel we were staying at. The restaurant has a cool Miami vibe to it with plenty of outdoor seating in front of the Paris hotel. Fortunately, the wait was not long for an outdoor seat during weekend brunch. If you choose to sit indoors the windows open up to bring the outdoors inside as well. The ambiance was very casual chic.  Bottomless mimosas were $23 and there was a good selection of brunch items from sweet and savory items such as French toast to benedicts and omelettes. I opted for the veggie omelet. It has spinach, mushrooms, and peppers. There was a good amount of veggies cooked with the egg; however, I wish my omelette was more hot and not room temperature. The side dish of home potatoes was tasty and the seasoning was light. I also tried the Gravlax benedict, and the salmon was fresh. The muffin was not too heavy and they offered strawberry jam on the side which was also fresh.  We were very impressed with how quickly our order came out and the service was good. Our waitress was attentive and friendly. If you request bottled water, a Fiji water bottle comes out with no cap. For some reason they do not let you leave with the cap? I thought that was strange because if you paid for the bottle you should be able to bring it with you.

y2-jrxL9fW51-FWkQXPGmQ.text: I took a recent vacation to Vegas and wanted to do brunch for the first time. I did a lot of Yelp research on brunch places with bottomless mimosas and Hexx stood out above the rest. They did not disappoint we sat outside in which it was a gorgeous day to eat brunch outside people watching on the strip. The service was incredible and the staff was amazing. We loved the mimosas, they're parfait and both breakfast entrees we ordered. The eggs Benedict and farm fresh eggs were amazing. Highly recommend Hexx if you're looking for brunch place.

4ilJ8fGuTS6eKJdK5Xq5FA.text: We loved being able to sit on the strip!  We had great service!  Our complaint was when we ordered the wedge it was the smallest 2 balls of  iceberg lettuce you have ever seen!  The bacon was maybe an oz, onions and Tom so bad!  We drink 1 beer, 1 ice tea and had 2 wedges and a shrimp cocktail, price of ticket was $65.00, with a $20 tip was an $80 meal, very disappointed!

Gr_Bfx7hQTSaaqL0936QIw.text: We really enjoyed our breakfast at HEXX on the patio overlooking the Bellagio fountains. We arrived early enough (around 9 am) on a Saturday and snagged a great table. The menu has lots of options for gluten-free and vegetarian guests. We tried a sticky bun and shared it among four of us due to the sheer size and richness. The bottomless mimosas were a great value and our waitress never let the glasses go less than half full (or half empty). The fruit platter included more exotic fruit choices and delicious muffins. Our server was super accommodating, easy going and friendly. We recommended HEXX to everyone else in our group that missed breakfast! Also - they will give you a plastic cup to take your final mimosa!

PypkQqXbbQwTh168Rg-tNg.text: Killer brunch walked right in off the strip.. Bloody Mary (red snapper) was excellent and that coming from someone who has been a bartender for the better part of a decade. it was made with bacon infused gin and the celery salt rim made the cocktail just right. I got eggs Benedict on a bed of scalloped potatoes. Was very good but not noteworthy. My girlfriend had bottomless mimosas for only 23 bucks and surf and turf sliders she was raving about. They looked scrumptious! The reason I simply had to review the restaurant was the excellent friendly service from Sean. Really solid brunch right across the street from the Bellagio.

The drinks here are amazing and the surf and turf sliders were great, but if you go to the strip often you know the service here usually sucks. Apollo was our server and he was just so personable and attentive and made this visit over the top great. I love a great server and he was amazing.

Jn2yGFvumpftW8hqq_4X5w.text: First, I need to note that the hours posted on Yelp for this place are wrong. I rushed over to make it before they closed, without changing into my stylish night digs and made it there before the posted midnight close- only to learn they were open to 6AM! Anyhow, I was able to get a nice seat outside on the street (kind of elevated). This is inside the Paris resort on the Strip. I ordered a hot chocolate (it was chilly) and two desserts; one to go and one to eat immediately.  When the  chocolate came, it was lukewarm, at best, but it was so tasty that I drank it. When I asked for a second, and noted that the first one was cold, I received a small pot of it. Still no dessert and three cups of chocolate later. When I at last saw my waiter who seemed to disappear, I inquired and it finally came out. I tried the roasted pear panna cotta and got sticky mango rolls to go. The panna cotta was divine! There were cubes of shortbread on top and two biscuit like strips. There were even crumbles of pistachio.  I ate the mango rolls for breakfast and they were amazing, too! They were sprinkled with black sesame seeds and had sweet pieces of mango. The treat was just the right amount of sweet. The bill came and I was actually charged for two chocolates ( I guess I shouldn't have drank the cold one). Whatever, I was hot chocolate wasted and didn't care!

a9Dv5w4Acb0BsZWO4qcCiw.text: Probably one of my favorite places to eat on the Strip. There is an incredible view of the bellagio fountains and the food is incredible. My favorite has to be the carpaccio that they serve. It's absolutely incredible! The chef and bartenders are also very talented. Love Chef Carlos and Chef Miranda!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocktail at Alexa&#39;s

jhzjwdllGQwcW8ZxZIcN3w.text: Came here for brunch after Mon Ami Gaby estimated a 45 minute wait for brunch in the middle of December. Anyway, we were seated at Hexx right away near the back entrance. At first I wasnt thrilled because I wanted to be seated outside, but the inside is so pretty and well lit. The furniture and decor is very fun and inviting.   We ordered french toast, some kind of egg white protein omelette plate and a breakfast hash. My iced coffee glass was constantly being refilled and we were checked on by our server often. Even though we came here on a whim, it wont be the last time we visit! I would like to come back to try their lunch or dinner menus as well.

BuvJ5eohlu2Cw3YNsRkcxQ.text: My friend and I came here after a quick lunch to grab some dessert (because you really can't complete any meal without dessert). I had high hopes for this place when I saw their menu but unfortunately it fell flat for the most part. We ordered the cookies n cream mousse and the sticky bun. Cookies n cream mousse- believe in the hype with their house-made chocolate. Oh, it is so good. Not too cloying and a generous portion as well. Now the sticky bun...just no. The cream on top of it was great but the bun itself was just hard bread that was not warm or toasted. Ironically I thought the sticky bun would be better since it's pretty difficult to mess up but I guess not.  However, I'm certain that any chocolate dessert here would be A1 just based off of the cookies n cream mousse.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cookies n Cream Mousse- yes, Sticky Bun- no

oxJd7uP2Abqt14pBcHGyqA.text: Absolutely perfect spot for brunch! Plane landed at 730 am we had been up since 2am Vegas time so it easily felt like lunch time but.. it was only 9am. So we decided to grab some food and bottomless mimosas while our room was being prepared and we got seated within 10-15 mins!  We shared a pecan sticky roll to start. So amazing! definitely recommend you start with that! I went with the Meat Omelette I was really impressed with the portion size! Whole omelette, potatoes, and an English muffin! Potatoes have a nice crisp to them and the omelette is loaded with 4 meats (bacon, sausage, chicken and pork).   You absolutely have to get the bottomless mimosas! I mean you're in Vegas why not?? Started feeling really good after just a few and you get them for 2 hours!

I finally remembered to get a picture of my food before I plowed through it. Everything is always cooked perfectly and the service is always on point. I don't know how they make their potatoes but I'm in love with them! I can't wait until my next visit.

-3AFEbknpXcbcSSLu6DEWA.text: I always stick with Mon Ami Gabi but opted for a different brunch joint this time around. Hexx didn't disappoint my intuition to venture somewhere new.   My recommendation to my Yelp colleagues - request to sit on the patio deck overlooking the Strip and people watch with your mimosas.  Food: Breakfast Pizza: I was craving something carb-loaded from a full day at the day club. The first half of the pizza was great - hot, soft pizza crust with the breakfast usual (sausage, bacon, cheese and eggs). Halfway through I was over it as the pizza got cold and chewy.   Steak and Eggs: This is the breakfast of champions if you're hungover and hungry. The Angus NY steak was of sizeable proportions, eggs-however-you-like-it and English muffins. Not too fatty and not well seasoned for a brunch plate.  4 stars for the ambience, location, and crowd. I'll have to pick another item other than the breakfast pizza next time.

bNUSFr82R100YrxleFIE2A.text: -"Go big or go home" is the quote that came to mind when I received my GIANT QUINOA BURGER from HEXX kitchen (pictured in the bottom of the photo). Super delicious but barely able to fit into my mouth - my friends had to cut it up into little pieces to try it without messing up their lipstick. However, I wouldn't change a single thing. It was absolutely delicious and filling and I didn't feel like I needed another meal for a few hours. The fries it came with were perfectly crisp and paired really well. The food my friends got are named in the picture, but special shout-out to the pumpkin waffles. They are more filling than you'd expect and a perfect level of sweet. Price: **** Service: **** Food: *****

Food is great of course , we tried the chilaquiles, sliders, carrot cake pancakes and the most important BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS.   Thanks again Apolo & Tolu!!!

CCiuM6U2rmfXjPPlcYrVkQ.text: Just ok.  The location and atmosphere is good but the place is pretty pretentious.  We went for lunch on a week day and the place was slammed.... however that's probably becuase everything took so long. People were waiting for food and drink for a very long time. The servers did not have any sense of urgency at all. The food was decent... one of us had breakfast and the other had the crab cake... the breakfast was forgettable but the crab cake might be worth a trip back.  It had lots of crab and was the right amount of denseness.   I'd be willing to try it again.

ZkK37qWnzPjRS23-12WLcQ.text: Carrot cake pancakes and triple sampler sangria... The way to go for brunch!  Sangria's were the red, the white and the bubbly. Bubby was a bit too sweet.  Pancakes were great and more than enough for 2 people. My fiance had the corn beef hash and the surf n turf sliders which were just alright.  Mine was excellent and I think we'd both return to try new stuff. Service was great. Sat outside. Arrived around 12:30 on a Thursday and was seated within 5 minutes.

Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sangria sampler: Bubbly White Red $18 Excellent!

IjWKISh91N9fiTlf0WbuVg.text: Had reservations here for brunch. Location is fabulous and right on the strip so you can people watch. Service was really good. I definitely recommend the bottomless mimosas for $24 because that's a good value for Vegas. Now when it came to food some we loved and some not so much. The carrot cake pancakes were unreal but the corn beef hash was not only tiny but also filled with carrots and other ingredients instead of corned beef. And of course we were in Vegas in the strip so the prices are a little inflated but typical of the area. They also had some really good Bloody Marys but beware that the Ultimate is 36 bucks. We really liked the French toast and fresh fruit as well.

WOs7Uz4yN_VGVbLV5dunGg.text: Everything we ordered was delicious and the service was outstanding (Mike). Steaks perfectly cooked. Mushroom side was slightly charred, just the right amount. We tried this restaurant on a Groupon deal but would definitely come back deal or not.

H84B27uEOfTwSCHQLvzG1A.text: Came in after seeing this place on the food network. When we came in the 3 hosts looked pretty clueless about checking us in and finding a table. Seating flat out sucks... the tables are tiny... I mean really tiny. We had 3 in our party and could barely fit. We were completely crammed in. Also they had one of the patio doors propped open and the cold air was blowing at me and it was freezing.  As for the food... delicious. Definately 5 star. I had the shrimp cocktail appetizer and a new york steak. Deserts are phenominal too! Be prepared to shell out $$$ our bill was almost $300.   The waitress was very nice and always there to help us.

7VZMA0XC5kSgys2kFTRr5Q.text: Get outside seating if you can and go for a reservation! You can see the Bellagio fountains across the street and it's great for people watching.   Brunch was lovely and their desk for endless mimosas looks to be great! The spinach dip was so creamy and lovely to share. The eggs Benedict is different but a nice twist on the classic. It's over scalloped potatoes instead of an English muffin, so worth it! This is a little lighter of a dish than I thought, which was perfect for me.   The fried chicken and waffles was very savory and rich. If you're wanting a heavier style meal I suggest getting that. Every server was quick, helpful, and we never had to wait long for anything.   Lovely place for a good bite to eat.

c97KXkUp1nT1ebQBOCIHPA.text: Love it here!! It was awesome, great food. Bottomless mimosas and a great view of the strip and the fountains at the Bellagio. But best of all was our server, Tracee she was so awesome, my mimosa was never empty! :) thanks Tracee we will definitely be back!!

0kYm7pHjiMe_UFPJZEiw3A.text: This was our second time dining here in the past year. We shared 3 appetizers, the overcooked bacon, shrimp, and smothered fries. Yum!!!! Steven was our server. He was very nice and provided great service. It was nice to sit on the patio and enjoy the Belagio fountain.

egmVGaaQEaeTAahMMGA17Q.text: This restaurant sits right on the strip. When I first walk in the people were nice and accommodating. I went a night and wanted to sit outside so I could people watch and watch the fountains at Bellagio. The food, drinks, service and atmosphere was first class. The prices are a lil high but hey its vegas. I definitely recommend. The desserts looked great but I didn't have any room left to try them.

vZKFzORI301Yo_BXsC8hqw.text: Walking down the street at las Vegas Strip i saw this amazing Bloody Mary DRINK- it was a must to see and to taste - walk in to the bar and  Bar tender Victor with a great beard and smile said Hello- offers a Bloody Mary and I had to say yessssss- he prepares it - he works hard at it--- and the this amazing carefully crafted big jar is presented as a birth of an amazing drink- I got not paid to say this- "THIii  MOST AMAZING BLOODY MARY I EVER HAD" THANKS VICTOR AND HEXX FOR A WONDERFULL DRINK

TpXrNQj0QpFVk39AxCd6Hg.text: Fantastic service (shout out to Josh and Thomas!), truly bottomless mimosas, and delicious food - try the home fries nomnom. So glad my group picked Hexx for our last brunch in Vegas! Will definitely return for future trips

F8Vqqtugyw9uG4Rkxf30TQ.text: Loved the French toast & bottomless mimosa. Wasn't a bad wait & a good outside seating

5cEvBjxCw7GHntvYe9Kp2g.text: This place was amazing.Taylor are waiter was the bomb she took very good care of us. She smile and joked with us. She made sure everyone's Bottomless mimosas stayed full. The food was also amazing will return when in Vegas.

FUwy1xROiv9M_AxgEMkM1g.text: Went to Hexx for breakfast because of the previous Yelp reviews! Went and it was amazing!!! Taylor our server was amazing!!! We had a big party for my brother in laws 50th and she didn't break a sweat!!! Love her! Request Taylor anytime you go...she's amazing!!!!!! Funny, friendly and great service!!!!

JHrlbzepU2cJbUJpXEwZAA.text: Great service! Recommend for a decent breakfast/brunch. Ate here at 12:30 on a Friday and got seated right away. Food arrived quickly. I had the veggie omelet, which was packed with veggies-def didn't skimp. But, it desperately needed some salt, and was a little overcooked. The home potatoes were awesome! And yummy english muffin. My hubby had the cinnaroll waffle, which wasn't overly sweet and was delicious. He had a side of bacon that was overcooked. The people next to us got the chicken and waffles and said they were fabulous. Overall,  good.

gqXjjIjCm9WjM_v5D3UUCQ.text: The food is delicious! The menu is simple but the flavor is big. Definitely I will be returning when I'm in town.

UvmMDuQ1Vaagpai2brYh0g.text: I went there for my birthday treat after work and I expect tea and dessert to be amazing.But we were waiting for tea 20 minutes and for dessert 30 minutes and after all dessert was absolutely nothing.It was too sweet and tiramisu was to watery and over frozen.After all we were waiting to take our card back for another 30 minutes.Complimentary chocolate was good as always.

t-YgKgC7XhspluTy6FYLOw.text: Fantastic. All employees were nice and friendly. Ambiance is classy and sophisticated. Very good beverage selection. Reasonably priced. And the fried chicken is to die for. Keep up the good work HEXX.

xr0R5vxwGHIdG6FmWLHfFA.text: Jessica A was our server. Outstanding personality. So much so I tried to hire her! Calamari was fresh and perfect. Hexx burger one of the best on the strip. Right across from the fountains of Bellagio!

RoHJJkyMaBEj-ZSbTUGk4A.text: Fantastic place for brunch! Bottomless mimosas and great food. We had Tracee for our server and she rocked. Make sure to ask for her! So helpful and funny and always made sure our drinks were full!

fdwR7dPuRv5u8khWX1W8jw.text: We tried HEXX on a weekday afternoon hoping to avoid the crowds, which we did. My husband and I both had the Hexx burger, which was really good. He ordered his medium (their default) and I ordered mine well done. Both burgers were cooked exact and even my well done version was moist and flavorful.  The white chocolate bun was a nice sweet touch to the salty (but not overly so) burger. The fries were good but nothing to write home about. I didn't care for the sweet and spicy pickles on the side, but my husband enjoyed them. Our daughter ordered the Mac and cheese with bacon bread crumbs, but got Mac and cheese with bread crumbs. It's too bad the bacon was missing because Mac and cheese wasn't good, and at least bacon would somewhat cover up the very bland and gritty (like the roux wasn't cooked properly) dish. Now, our daughter *is* four, but she is the least picky child ever, and regularly tries and eats things most kids won't.  If she doesn't like the Mac and cheese, there's something wrong with it.  I tried it just to make sure and while I wouldn't call it inedible I *would* call it a complete rip-off, considering it's $8. Skip the Mac and cheese. Dessert was fantastic. We ordered the chocolate cheesecake with popcorn on top and it didn't stand a chance.  The chocolate samples with spell cards were cute, but you REALLY have to be a chocolate purist to enjoy the samples. This is the real deal, so don't go here expecting Hershey, or even Godiva. It's a very pure chocolate. Even the milk chocolate tastes like dark chocolate. Service was satisfactory but not exemplary.  We didn't get offered the dessert menu (which is strange considering that's kind of its thing) and had to ask when the check was brought instead. I don't think we were being rushed out, though. Overall, 4-stars because the burger was really good, but this was probably a one-time visit to the establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boring Mac and cheese. Skip it.
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty Hexx Burger!

YaWUhBjpwfUkuFRI8x-9Lw.text: I will give this restaurant a two for the service and the feng shui. Unfortunately, the food tastes worse than most of the buffets around Vegas. The Eggs tasted like they had been cooked a 8am and served to us at 11:30am. We got the "over cooked bacon" at it was cold and probably cooked along with the eggs at 8am. The French toast and pancakes where okay. Nothing special! Only way we come back is for the bottomless mimosas.

TGUumU-WYLXgcb33NVi6Ow.text: Mushroom pizza was delicious. The carbonara pasta was tasty. Service was good. Beautiful room. Fantastic patio if you can get a table!

Nf0vgqOt24ZCdkb2FTlezA.text: Great place. Great mushroom pizza. Great drinks. Hope you get Julie as your waitress and you'll have a great experience.

ZkaMlr_VXkv6PTUrKp7DkA.text: After a long night of working I decided to explore the strip for some food. I herd about Hexx, all good things. The waitress was very nice and attentive. We started off with the Crab cakes and the Hummus bruschetta. Absolutely amazing!!! Probably the best part about the whole meal. My friend had the Jambalaya and I had the Shrimp Scampi. They both decent. For the price I would except better but we were on The Strip so it's understandable.

_tPSgrCJmKmhd7Un6m4R4A.text: Got in at 10 AM on a holiday weekend and got seated at the outdoor patio right away, Mon ami Gabi, our usual first choice , was an unknown wait time, so it worked out really well.   Had the $20 bottomless Mimosa's and Juliet, our waitress, was attentive and kept them filled. Had the classic burger and it was cooked perfectly.   Ordered  the chips and dip, which probably wouldn't do again, but it was fun to order something different.   They have a fun menu, and not terribly prices for Vegas

X6YqpPYM90DbwrNp44RG9w.text: Our family loved this place.  We stopped in here for brunch on the day we were leaving. The service was great and the food was even better.  The restaurant is beautifully decorated and has a pleasant outdoor dining area with shade. Our only regret was not noticing it sooner!

GHoairl10OEf6zWJwzSGRw.text: Great option for brunch! You really can't beat the location as it is in the heart of The Strip. My friend and I made HEXX our last meal in Vegas and we had no regrets. If you choose to dine outside you'll have a lovely view of the Bellagio and the Bellagio fountains but if you dine inside - the interior is decorated so stylishly and chic that you won't be missing out on much if you choose inside over outside. Instead of sitting in a normal dining chair, I sat in a cute, sophisticated-looking couch that made me feel quite posh. I ordered the carrot cake pancakes because where else can you get carrot cake pancakes? They were surprisingly delicious and not overly sweet. Most of the sweetness you get from the cream cheese frosting and the syrup. Oddly enough, the cream cheese frosting and the syrup compliment each other pretty well. The pancakes are HUGE and fluffy - also maintained its moistness from all the carrots. You get a stack of 4 per order but honestly...I was done after 2. While it was good, you get tired of eating the same thing over and over. My friend ordered the brioche french toast with berries and gave it a 7/10.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brioche French toast + berries
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake pancakes

ur3nZ1TG0HXwhsIT9fh-wQ.text: Excellent menu with enough variety to satisfy any guest, but not overwhelming.  Great seating available outside, and the service was decent, considering it was Sunday brunch.  We arrived just before 930am, and thats when the line started to get really long.  So get there somewhat early.  I ordered the farmers market bloody mary (ask for the bloody mary menu) and also ordered the chilaquiles and they were delicious, topped with an egg and guacamole.  Possibly a heavy meal for brunch, but great flavors nonetheless.

ZhBdyQDCydMfMut1wceVnw.text: The sticky bun and French toast was amazing. Their house potatoes were also very yummy. We had bottomless mimosas and our glasses were never empty, our server Carl was the best! Will be coming back again and again.

QgUL6H53K5LHfG2ad3LajA.text: We came here by accident after another location was giving us a 1 hour wait for breakfast. Ended up having to wait 30 mins for a table. Unfortunately had to do outer seating on a very hot day. But had the best chilaquiles of my life. Also ordered the calamari as an appetizer which I found on the crunchier side. If you like crunchy it's the choice for you and sauce that came with it was light and flavorful. We also got the french toast which was great!

vHAT0kBHY58tHMON-bseaw.text: Hexx is a must stop every time I visit vegas.  Fast and friendly service at the bar on Saturday the bar tender assured us she'd be back on Sunday and so were we. We ordered steak and eggs, chicken and waffles, corned beef and eggs and the two eggs breakfast. We are very found of the waffles here and. Last time I ordered the cinnamon waffles and those were amazing. If I'm the person reading this and I'm in Vegas I'm stopping in here right now before I finish this post.

pKy7_f6Vu4A5LqDmcUJYGQ.text: Due to the Travel Zoo voucher.... this is one of our favorites, BUT I can say that would not be the same if it was not for the discount received from that.     Positives:  They have very good drinks and the food is awesome.  I have not tried anything I have not liked on the menu.  But, overpriced at that.    I have had the short ribs, scallops, veal, fish for entrees all were excellent.    My favorite was the Veal Milanese!  I have had the Brussel sprouts and loved them the first time, didn't love them the second time, so there were some inconsistencies.  The app of garlic bread was excellent.  Spinach Dip, excellent.  We had the ceviche and that is the only item I likely would not get again  They have a good selection of house-made drinks     Negatives:  It is more cumbersome finding the check-in desk, even after eating here 3 times, I always forget, you have to walk thru the restaurant to get to the check-in desk.  The other thing is, last time I was there they seated us relatively close to an open door and it was FREEZING.  Even our waitress had to put in her jacket, which takes away from the enjoyment and the vibe.   They should have at minimum offered to move us, or something.  It was not just obvious to us, even though we did comment on it and asked if the doors could be shut.  Even after getting 45% off from the Travel zoo deal, I ended up still having a bill of $300 for 4 of us.(after tip)  Which means, this meal was a $550 meal for 4 people.   We will only be back IF we get a deal.  It just was not worth $135+ per person. I think it would have maybe been worth $75/pp.

wa2VzFx6FSXqEoB0MRfp0A.text: Came here for brunch...purchase a $50 dollar Groupon with 24 dollars (it was originally for $30 dollar got it with 20% discount)...ordered a carrot cake pancakes/ steaks and eggs/ Hexx Benedicts  My favorite item is carrot cake pancakes..it is so moist/soft..could taste shredded carrots as part of the pancakes..it is just so GOOD..the ingredients are so real...i could taste the walnuts, carrot textures, and the spices...highly recommend this dish  steak and eggs is great too..the steaks are well seasoned...it is good....we asked for medium rare initially..but when it came out...the steak was too rare...we had to ask our waitress to cook it a little bit longer....  the Benedicts is good...the portion is kinda small...just one Benedict. ..the benedict is well seasoned..the scalloped potato is very soft and kinda blended in with the sauce..  Overall, I really enjoy eating at this place...it is pricey compare to most brunch places i have been at..but very reasonable price relatively to the brunch price on the street...

tmgkEM89qev7XbB53NCVbw.text: This place was a gem to find. I visited Vegas for my birthday and ate here for my birthday breakfast. From the decor to the food, it was all good. I sat on the patio and was able to people watch and see a clear view of the Strip. I highly recommend checking this place out.

nXTFh0i-Hi8y7My0COOcoQ.text: Thanong was super sweet and patient with us. We came as a group for my bachelorette and he definitely took care of us!   The food was amazing. Customer service was great! Definitely would come back and recommendn

z82EcPgevRNiOJZJLTnleA.text: What a pleasant breakfast! The farm fresh eggs with chicken sausage and golden potatoes were a good choice for a first meal in Vegas. It was Saturday morning Labor Day weekend and our total wait time for a table was THREE minutes. The HEXX team was on it. Kalene, our server was lovely and attentive. They have a killer jam for their English Muffins. I wish I could eat a breakfast like this every day.

dZhQzsC-PTWSR-uOLneCAQ.text: Our server Steven, Ivan, and Ramon were SO phenomenal!!! They were so friendly and personable. Definitely made our experience at this amazing restaurant even better!! Highly recommend coming here I'd you are in Vegas!! Thank guys for making our last day here so awesome!! Love from your MN gals!

epSI28we6W-vV7jyi6yV2g.text: Shout out to Gwen for such a gracious server.  After a long night out on the town good breakfast is always welcomed.  From light to hearty, you'll find your tastes & preferences available.  For me, today was a light iced green (so refreshing!) and a nice steak & egg combo with smashed Yukon potatoes and English muffin.  Steak was cooked perfect and seasoned well. Who needs ketchup when it's already perfectly delicious.  The English muffin warm & soft to tear a part and dip it into raspberry jelly.   The smashed potatoes were a delightful surprise. It was crusty & crunchy and yet simply smooth and soft inside.   This was a plate of fun and delicious contrast.   I also enjoyed a great conversation with my waitress who is a local and it really made my experience even better.  It was a nice breezy morning but the food was the attraction - hopefully, you'll think so too.  :)

S8dNDs-8ByFAWU0h1T6QqQ.text: I came here for the bottomless brunch, Vanessa and Abe took such good care of us!!! Literally the nicest waiters I have ever had in my entire life!! The brunch deal is great if you're looking for breakfast and a pregame, this is the place!! Very affordable and the mimosas get you drunk quick!!! I definitely recommend it here!!

97E4256LJ4UkbdUf6PwTMw.text: "Cute place!" As my girlfriend would describe it. I'm not going to lie, it was a nice looking restaurant/bar. Located right on the strip of Vegas, and right across the Bellagio so you can get food and a water show. We stopped by after doing a little bit of gambling in the Paris Hotel/casino. Service was friendly and attentive, for the most part.   For drinks, I wanted the barrel-aged cocktail (their version of the classic old fashioned) but was shunned because they ran out? So I ordered Hexx Fusion. It was good but didn't blow me away. Kind of a rendition of a whiskey sour but with rum. To add insult to injury, the lady got the Roman Bloody Mary, but our server failed to mention that they were out of pickled veggies and spicy vodka. Instead, he just brought out a substitute and didn't mention anything until she said something and then he said they ran out of both the spicy vodka and pickled veggies. Bummer. He did bring out some more hot/mary sauce to enhance the drink...  For food, we shared the Seafood on Ice plateau. Perfect amount of food to split between the two of us. Our version (I say this because I notice the menu changes) came with a split of king crab leg (yummy), shrimp ceviche (yummy), tuna poke, scallop salad, 2 lobster tails and about 4 jumbo shrimp. Everything tasted fresh and was delicious. The weakest link had to be the scallops. Although good, the cream sauce it was in wasn't too appealing to us but I devoured the scallops anyway! (I left behind the sauce). I peaked at other patrons orders out of curiosity and the food looked tasty.   Overall, a nice visit and a well put together restaurant with nice decor and friendly, attentive service. Other than "running" out of certain liquors/cocktails, I'd recommend this place.

jKi1ScApMCC6qRNPLkfsTQ.text: birthday brunch here was such a delight! especially if you a are looking for a place with a view and in the middle of the strip! I made reservations 2 days before-for sat morning, and they were able to accommodate my party of 8! (saturdays are super busy try to make a reservation) the table they got us was great, we were seated right away, waitress was awesome tons of food options to chose from and drink options, food was delicious, of course had the bottomless mimosas. food came out quick, the only thing that sucked was bathrooms were outside in paris and lines were long! everyone in my party ordered something different and everything was super good, I especially like how perfect the chicken turned out! tons of cute drink options, and because it was my birthday they gave me a complimentary cake/ice cream treat at the end.

ay18dNkDOT63fQuqj0oCpg.text: Ambiance was great. Right on the strip with great views! Food was mediocre. I had the meat omelette and it was extremely bland. English muffin wasn't toasted.. it tasted like they just took it out of the package. Potatoes had no flavor... I'm glad they bring your Salt and ketchup. Experience was SAVED By the bottomless mimosas and great service. I would say the food wasn't worth the money. The rest of the experience was good.

vvs_Ha-kRNCEp2eo7z2m6w.text: One of the best meals I've had in a long time.  Here with my wife and cocktails were on point.  She had the short rib and was fall apart tender.  I had the Shrimp Limone and it was fabulous.  Our server Michael was as good as it gets.  An excellent experience from beginning to end.

6iu2kvLYNHrl1AJc7mphKg.text: The food was good not great, the service was fine! *** If you are not a gambler at the casino do not expect to get the sits overlooking the strip. Its reserved for their special guests even if there is plenty available they will not sit a random guest by the strip! FYI

3p2HMQERC0_6ujs2VNjMXQ.text: Located on the Strip, underneath Paris' Eiffel Tower.  Very popular brunch place, especially on the weekends so try to make a reservation beforehand.  Lots of seating available, try to snatch one in the outdoor patio because it has a great view of the Bellagio Fountains.  Hexx Benedict:  Instead of an English muffin, they use scallop potatoes as their base which I thought was a great idea.  Only 1 serving instead of 2 but it was surprisingly filling nonetheless.  I enjoyed their hollandaise sauce. Farm Fresh Eggs:  Very filling entree with eggs, bacon, home fries, & English muffin.  All good! Strawberry Cocktail:  Very taste & strong.  Did I mention that it is open 24/7?!

mICJmVaQwGKf1CtB-tANug.text: Everything was good until I got a bite of black hair in my burger. I brought it to the servers attention who sent the manager, Christian, over who basically made me feel insulted for even bringing it to his attention. He immediately asked me if I was sure if it's not mine, I know my hair and I wouldn't purposely add my own which is basically what I felt he was insinuating. He told m he'd take my extra side off the bill, you know bc that was the issue. All in all I won't be returning, for as expensive and it's location I would've expected better customer service.

GRdlwp7VYpF5SxpBsItT5Q.text: Such a great place for brunch! Had to wait a while for a table but we had a large group and it was a Sunday.  The food was quality and very tasty, definitely worth the wait! Our server Tracee was the best! So enthusiastic and attentive!  Overall can't go wrong with this place!

ceVLNqq-5UF1XRDnS7dkTQ.text: We had a lovely breakfast at this place outside. The food was delicious and the staff was even better! Marife was the sweetest! Would 10/10 reccomend

QCJ-GR2gD6bnj_x6XzygYQ.text: Great bottomless Mimosa brunch on Sunday.  The food quality was fantastic, there were 6 of us and we all enjoyed our meals. Tracee, our waitress, made the meal even better with her prompt service and fun attitude.  It's our new, favorite breakfast spot in Vegas! Thanks Tracee.

TzceacCLQwVTK3CrtODfDw.text: Had apps and dessert both were great. Our server, Sean, was amazing. Made us feel like we were his only table. Great location with patio to people watch right on the Strip!

uUfjp6tyzR8mmXls2sGBNA.text: The $36 cocktails are big enough to share and they are awesome! The waiter we had was slow and seemed like he really hated his job. We had to ask a hostess if we even had a waiter. Ask for a patio seat! You can see the bellagio water show from the patio. Food wasn't that great or worth the money. The online menu needs some updating.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The drinks are awesome!

GtWY2GE9sx1AsE3pOkovjg.text: OMG! This place is amazing! Our waiters, Tolu and Bobby were wonderful! They got us what we wanted and even brought us free chocolate samples! Their food was spectacular and everything was nicely plated! I can't wait to go again!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i9T47vI0qmnzyC6C4WQl2A.text: This comes super late, as my husband and I visited last year. However, this place was so amazing, I just have to give them their much deserved props! Denise helped us twice last year and she was beyond amazing! Yes we went twice, because it was that awesome:) We were impressed by how friendly and attentive she was with all of our requests. Her manager made a few recommendations regarding drinks and we loved all of them! We are visiting the first week of June and we will be asking for Denise again! Really hope shes still here:) See you soon HEXX!!!

DOF945cmh4lbIhBEc6W5sg.text: Hexx is a brilliant spot for breakfast/brunch, the menu is varied so there's plenty to choose from and the food tastes great.  We are here twice for brunch and once for evening meal.  The spot is fantastic and the service and food top its next door neighbour (Mon Ami Gabi) in my opinion.  The brunch was definitely better than the evening meal in terms of value for money but the food and service were equally as good.

jXb5pESpFozHJ-FExQgFLQ.text: We went to look for a nice place for brunch and ended up here. Didn't have to wait for a patio seating. Had a pretty view of the bellagio fountain. Ordered the rib eye steak and egg. Scrumptious! We would love to come eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cAKBxqgUdSdaiJFLjS5c0A.text: Jody and Mike provided incredible service! Ask for them if you come to Hexx. We will definitely be back to see them soon!

Ok83U-6vhvAruklmpzCWAA.text: I was out with a girlfriend & wondered into Hexx for a drink to relax watch the Bellagio fountains from the patio. A courteous and attentive server Johnny Love. I don't know if that's his real name but he turned us on to the hypnotizing Strawberry cocktail which was amazing Broccolini as a healthy starter then talked us into sharing Short Ribs that just melted in our mouths. We didn't want any dessert but he talked us into sharing the Ecuadorian Brownie, so glad he did. We were so please with his service and will definitely be back.

ojTBuhMOp_pforHtC_cSAw.text: I have never been a fan of the breakfast options that Vegas offers, but this was an absolute exception. A friend and I ordered bottomless mimosas, which they extended a whole hour for us so we could enjoy since it was originally supposed to end soon. Our server, Johanna, was constantly checking in to our table and making sure our drinks were always full. The food was beautifully prepared and wonderfully portioned for the price. Even after our check had been paid she still came and waited our table with no change in the quality of the service. This is a place I highly recommend, and one that I plan on coming back to in the near future.

2HlyQD8z6KeS-0seNVB94g.text: Checking in for our reservation was easy and got seated right away. Chilaquiles were good. Mimosas were great and our waitress Tracee was even greater! Will definitely be back.

ICWtCIWvyxlL-OOZpqiEmA.text: I really liked the Candyland Factory store and restaurant, so I was really disappointed to see this replaced it.  The store seems to be the same except Candyland was better.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u1uGIQlsqX1yZiN7oXqqWg.text: We just finished brunch on a Sunday afternoon. Bottomless mimosas for $23 and the best Brioche French Toast. Found seating at the bar and were taken care of immediately, nice ambiance. This is a solid choice.

u2VaL0h-8E_7gb3XDhNMDA.text: Completely bad service!!! We got seated and they took our orders but didn't bring our drinks until after 4 tables that were seated 36 minutes after us received their drinks. Then they still brought their food 3 minutes after we received our drinks. We still waited 30 minutes and they didn't bring our food and they continued to serve other people. We were forced to walk out since we brought this issue to the managers attention and she gave us an attitude about how we still had to wait.

5NvKCE16b11DU8P2m2BafQ.text: My friends and I were really looking forward to trying out there Chilaquiles and Chicken and waffles and other tasty meals offered here, unfortunately an hour had passed after the server had taken our order and we STILL did not have no food out for any of us. Their excuse was because we were a group of 9, but there were 3-4 tables with groups of four people that arrived 30 min after us and all of them had their drinks and food! We are outraged and had such a disappointing experience

RhZYxP1Vi3uwJldcRAzlBQ.text: First arrived the service was very poor almost ignored. But we moved inside and our happy hour experience was much better. It has a very cool City vibe doesn't feel like Vegas.

UqRX9jwcy4tLVikFN7fWJw.text: We are in town from Dallas and we loved  this restaurant! We had Sean and Bobby as servers. They were amazing! The food was great but the service was even better! We highly recommend this restaurant! Sean refilled our glasses even when we had a few sips gone!

PXCg_ZB6J1htVX_Ht-WMwA.text: Tracee was so bomb! Her service and personality really shined. She really serviced us to our every need. The food was delicious but the mimosas were extra special.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I9ZQJzb8Psh0uHlcy860FQ.text: Whenever we go to Vegas, we make a stop at Hexx because the food is really good, and they have bottomless minosas.  However, our last stop to Hexx over this weekend was amazing.  Our waiter, Tracy, made our visit exceptional.  She was like a hype-woman and provided that Vegas experience that you expect when you go to a restaurant in Vegas.  We were initially seated at a table directly in the sun without shade, and she spoke to the manager to make sure that we were moved inside, despite the unpleasant hostess. She kept our mimosa glasses filled to the rim and made sure that we were all having a great time.  Tracy was entertaining, genuine, and provided all the services we needed. She went to infinity and beyond!  Thank you Tracy!  This place gets really busy, so make a reservation.

NTiMr7Q5AU59e0k6G8un2A.text: 4.7% CNF CHARGE ON ALL CHECKS in addition to tax. They can't even explain what it is for.  Appetizer and entree was delicious. Banana cream pie was horrible. Graham cracker crust was hard and the pudding part was difficult to find.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. CNF (Concession fee) on all checks -- 4.7% on all checks for nothing!!!

e4ZbWUsiSed23BM2Kz9GPQ.text: Very busy so we ate at the bar.  Had bottomless mimosas that were good.  My husband had the hash and loved it.  I had the hexx Benedict.  It was good.  However when they say smoked meat that's  what they mean.   Good food there is enough to leave you feeling full.

W88YzPMwIw9Sn6aCz8gv9A.text: We went on a weekday for dinner. We were pleasantly surprised by the excellent service, and delicious food. The prices are reasonable too. So I would definitely revisit and would recommend it.

mkbdzkR_w-8e4RT5AQGjAw.text: Awesome spot right on the strip opposite the Belaggio, so you have a great seat for the water show while you dine. I had the Jambalaya and it was probably the best I've had (full disclosure: I'm not from Louisiana and I've never had anyone's mom's Jambalaya). My wife had the Sea Bass, about which she agreed with the server who described it as "cooked to perfection." Speaking of which, Allexia was great. Her recommendations were on point and she was courteous, timely, and professional.  Definitely a recommended spot for a nice dinner and we will be back next time we're in Vegas.

iDoubtWEa4PZGNo4v0y7vg.text: We went here to celebrate a birthday and our food was absolutely delicious!!! There was not a single dish that we were not gushing over. The number 1 word tossed around throughout our meal was FLAVOR. The flavors were just spectacular and we noticed after our meal that the tables lacked seasoning and condiments, which we know means you don't need them! I mean even down to the French fries! They were truffle or garlic and came with this incredible mayo. Delicious. My friends dad, who has a degree in culinary, was raving about the veal he ordered. The buffalo calamari was delicious as well. I wish I could've tried more!   The only downside I had was that menu was limited. The sandwiches and burgers were only offered at lunch and I was hoping to order the veggie burger. So for somebody who doesn't eat meat and can't have too much dairy I felt somewhat limited which is why I chose calamari and French fries. But it tasted delicious and filled me up so it wasn't a complete let down.   Thank you so much for your service HEXX!

DSHKSzjdB5IALcUigOPGIw.text: Bought a dinner package with the Jersey Boys tickets, so dined here with my parents for the first night in Vegas. Not bad! The food was decent, the service was nice (our server Kevin was really welcoming and patient), and our overall experience was great. We tried everything in the dinner package. My favorite was the grilled salmon. Oh and the soup was nice too! The burger had a great flavor but a little too salty. And the salad was plain.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted tomato bisque
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple salad (butter lettuce, Snow White cheddar, candied cocoa nibs, chive, white balsamic vinaigrette)
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic burger (Kobe beef, aged Wisconsin cheddar, peppered bacon, 1000 island dressing, sesame bun)

DwwfrbWHChfc1yh6a-K3CQ.text: We ate here for breakfast one day and they had numerous items that could be made gluten free. I would definitely recommend; if you sit out on the patio you can even people watch while you eat!

2RCPt1i_HyP59kZtdG660g.text: The food here was incredible! Our drinks were spot on as well as our food. My boyfriend got the jambalaya and there was PLENTY of shrimp, sausage and chicken.
