It was so full of flavor it was crazy! I had the lobster roll, and in the past I haven't really been a fan of lobster at all but I decided to give this a go. It was soft, juicy, and absolutely perfect. Now I know why people love lobster! And the panna cotta dessert? Forget about it! It's a must have! Everything they did, they did RIGHT! The food is 100% worth the price. You can taste the quality! Our waitress Stephanie was such a delight as well. So sweet and nice. Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jambalaya and lobster roll! Delicious!

Ky71nR8el_DCPOWopfAfvg.text: Great place to grab a bite! Highly recommend the halibut, Brussel sprouts and s'mores dessert!

x8hZElkUd_Olii31zi_FjA.text: The best chicken and waffles my husband and I have ever had!  I wish I ordered them instead of him because I kept sneaking bites of his food :P  The waffles have pieces of bacon in the batter and the syrup has bourbon.  Bacon and bourbon...how could you go wrong?!  If I ever go back to Vegas this will be my first stop for breakfast.   I ordered the steak and eggs which was really good too.  The only reason I didn't give this restaurant 5 stars is because I ordered my steak medium rare and it wasn't pink at all.  I never send food back but for the price of the steak I want it cooked properly.  When our waiter brought out my second steak is was much better.  Also the breakfast potatoes were perfectly crisp and my eggs were perfectly poached.   This restaurant just opened last week so there are minor quirks but I suggest you give it a chance.  Don't forget to order the amazing chicken and waffles :)

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Eggs
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffles

qouDXFCBnJwGO0tten8MKw.text: Fun fun place,  the potion drinks are the best !! Great for social media pics and they taste great. The Hexx Benedict tasted perfect with scalloped potatoes instead of the traditional English muffin,  great twist and now that's my favorite style for Benedict!

6QcBAZ0yeop3-ICIk_S4LA.text: Just came for my bach party!!! Hostess was prompt. Service was great. Taylor & Stephanie were amazing!! The food... oh. My. The breakfast pizzas and the chilaquiles were so freaking good!!!! The lunch is just as good! Must go!

wNnzuy8aaFsy9Dshgzr6LA.text: Food was good fast and flavorful! We grabbed a late snack. They had a $10 all day breakfast deal was good

7s-omlmKkF9fDDvXx0KmCQ.text: went out on a date with hubby last night and I've always wanted to try this place out. Our server Kevin gave great service and made our stay pleasant. Love the jambalaya and the calamari. Enjoyed our dinner with the nice Bellagio fountain view. will b back for dessert next time!

mfH8MrX9tuGZJS_twjOAAA.text: Nice location. I ordered the carbonara. I've had better and more filling in Detroit at a good Italian place.  Service was ok.  Outside seating is an ok view of strip.  I don't suggest.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rq773Rhv7oO4FMsRP52m1A.text: Omg is all I really want to say......I'm not really a steak eater but I decided to get what everyone was ordering! The portions are huge and so worth the price!  The potatoes were so good. The parmesan cheese added the extra blessing! Eggs were so fresh tasting especially since I do not add salt or pepper!   All 4 of us rated this the best place to eat for breakfast during our 3 day stay!

Fpv0IhwdKwNGtdkDYE_JKw.text: Awesome food!!  We had a wonderful experience here.. be sure to get a potion my husband and I love these!

ORy3ZewDcfYrV9TMFAW6XQ.text: In case you didn't know already, this location used to be Sugar Factory. It is however still running along the same concept of Sugar Factory, but instead of candy it looks like its gearing more towards a chocolate theme. The entire restaurant accents brown and white colors, and also has it's own store with candy and chocolates.   I ordered their signature burger which comes with a white chocolate bun, but its not covered in chocolate, it's a very subtle flavor, however i myself do not like sweet and salty together so i was not very fond of the burger. My friends had a chicken paella, and a grilled cheese sandwich with turkey in the middle. The paella was good, the turkey grilled cheese sandwich was good too but the bread was really hard and difficult to bite. We also got some mac n cheese bites. They were good but the marinara sauce it was served with was cold.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese sandwich
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried mac n cheese
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-cTVcw2-tweF7owf0ue9_A.text: The Cinnaroll waffle is out of this world, decadent and filling! Now, I'm not crazy about waffles, but this is a must try! Everything about this waffle is just great, texture, flavor, and it exceeded all expectations. Vanessa, our hostess was attentive and on cue for our every request. Great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottomless mimosas

SKwz_AALioqy3ixzHLTeZA.text: Great bottomless and fantastic service. Get either the protein power breakfast (potatoes are very crispy) or the carrot cake pancakes

2vqO3Wea--ToyY7kwJZosg.text: Incredible! I've brunch quite a bit & I have never had an experience like this. Tracey, Tai & all of the staff took care of us and made sure our mimosas never reached the BOTTOM. Such a great experience and I can't wait to come back!

bxEhAqpVOv1uzoy4A6rSbg.text: Went here for dessert got red velvet and peanut butter cheesecake all delicious but still overpriced

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good dessert place at the Strip which  to live Jazz music

hWQa8VIFcLaMsc_1_urF1w.text: WOW!!! Rachel and Antonio took care of me and my bachelorette party! The food was to DIE for! We had staff starting karaoke with us which made the experience SO FUN! I will come back here forever. Every time I come to VEGAS!!! Thank you HEXXX!!!!! #OhHEXXXXYahhhhhh

w43hzzn1jcm01CoIk6RZFA.text: The service was outstanding; I appreciated the staff members, who were clearly well trained, and must be treated well enough to be content with their work. Kudos to them, and the management.  The food was somewhat disappointing - not terrible, but not great either. I had roasted Brussels sprouts, which were fine, and calamari, which was brought to the table just warm (deep-fried foods should always be piping hot), and dressed in an overwhelming sauce - not the subtle sort of flavoring or careful preparation I hoped for.   Additionally, it was very loud in the dining room. Our server stated that it was due to all the windows being closed. The view of the fountains is a nice feature of the place. Perhaps it is a place to visit in the summer.   Finally, I question the $$ rating - it at least borders on, if not qualifies for, $$$.

8rUxiaQ-Eux5jPQXwaXfEg.text: Service was great. I loved the location. The restaurant was beautiful but I expected better food for the price. The Wagyu steak was average and the halibut was pretty flavorless. The kids grilled cheese tasted like it was made with processed kraft cheese squares. I kids chicken was good and so were the mashed potatoes. I really wanted to Love this place but Hexx did not live up to my expectations.

E4pD3G5V4xRzsPtkJEwT-Q.text: Their cheese and meat platter was very tasty! It paired nicely with the bubbly, too!  I was a bit disappointed with the size of their appetizers, but it didn't disappoint my tastebuds!   Their servers seemed to be a bit frazzled from the dinner rush, but overall it was a good dining experience.   Great place for a date night!

nYiX7EIhzsCfSB8kO0qZhw.text: Went to Hexx last night on a Travelzoo deal of 3 course meal & drink for 2 for $95. Great deal , so I thought. We ordered as the deal allowed & only added a side of risotto(extra $10). Well let me say the food was good but didn't like the cocktails(Hexx fusion & Raspberry fizz) both tasted awful. If I could describe they had a candle like taste. We ordered  garlic bread, spinach dip, New York strip, rib eye, and 2 cheesecakes. All was included in TZ deal and only addl item was risotto, $10. Well when the billed came out it was for $40. I was like wtf. Called the mgr over and he started explaining they discounted the TZ deal but the balance was still due, stating gratuity. Politely told him to remove the addl charges & gratuity is to my discretion. Then he stated the extra charges were taxes & some other fees. Needless to say I had him remove most the of charges and felt like he was not honoring the deal properly. I will NOT go back  because felt the mgr was being dishonest

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peanut butter cheesecake
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY strip and risotto
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apps...spinach dip and garlic bread

8nBC3l8T1z1jsqmlg0Z3uw.text: Good atmosphere and view from the patio. Wide selection of bloody Mary's was noteworthy. Portions are very small and hostess could be more friendly.

LvBVOx1g4lSWP7pcG0r1_w.text: Great brunch spot to people-watch as you sip bottomless mimosas or one of their fully-loaded bloodys! Other highlights:  - The home fries are crispy, delicious bites of red potato heaven. I think they are deep fried?? Not greasy but have that crispy crust like a french fry. - Protein omelet - perfect remedy food for those long, lavish Las Vegas nights.  - Score a seat outside to dine under the Eiffel Tower and watch the Bellagio fountains - Interesting menu items with chocolate accents.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WhxN7OcS_YfvvLdvlM_Lpw.text: Ok Food... horrible service. Waited an hour to get egg whites and bacon. Not coming here again when in Vegas. There are other places around that are better tasting.

ttIFgxEWWHEBi87CpkXacA.text: This is a place on the strip that you actually get your money's worth, especially with bottomless mimosas. Great service, great food, great experience. Johanna took great care of us both times we came on our trip and I would 100% recommend it to anyone coming to town.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wqC7nhZaQzGPK4Swr_unEA.text: I visit Las Vegas for work at least once a month and used to thoroughly enjoy this restaurant for brunch often. Today, my girlfriend and I were discriminated against at this establishment and aggressively condemned for having a service animal. She is a medically retired marine and has paperwork for her service animal. Her service animal is also a three pound small dog who by no means was growling, barking, or otherwise causing a disturbance. She is trained to remain silent and assist when needed. Ari Stotland, the restaurant manager, handled the situation poorly. He approached us saying that having the dog laying next to her owner at our personal dining table was not accepted. We politely explained that under the ADA, it is unlawful to discriminate against people with disabilities and their registered service animals. He became verbally aggressive, repeating that we had to leave. We will be filing a claim against HEXX and the incompetent manager. Never returning.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

si4-6wuf5yyRBibObNMRVA.text: I love Hexx kitchen and bar. They have great service and amazing food. I enjoyed the all you can drink mimosas on the middle of the strip. The food is fresh and has a lot of flavor. You can watch the Bellagio fountains while you eat as well. The chocolate bars are amazing and unique. I would definitely recommend Hexx the next time you're in Las Vegas.

yUyuVkQuLN9K4ucG5fzXYQ.text: Couldn't decide where to eat last meal in Vegas, and decided to give Hexx a try. I was not expecting much but boy was I wrong! Ordered crab cakes (mostly crab meat) , salmon (crispy outside and very moist inside) and a infused cocktail with rum, pineapple and brown sugar .... everything was Fire!! Food was better than most the 5 star restaurants we have eaten at in Vegas, and still not too busy yet as the word is still not out about this secret Gem........ Good for us  We sat at the bar and the two bar tenders were fantastic as well, thank you Jarred ad Eric for the Great service and recommendations we will defiantly make this a must stop every trip in Vegas!!

fhX6FJF0NAD_w9PJIc14EQ.text: Great place.  Wonderful food and even better service. STEVEN and Ryan were amazing. The brunch really hit the spot. Be sure to order something that you can put jam on!

tlCOob7ZSoO37jBUM9yvlg.text: Went on a Saturday morning, place was full of people. Our wait for 3 people was about 30 mins but they do offer to text you when your table is ready! You can make reservations ahead of time and there is also the option to wait at the bars within (although those are crowded too). We were seated to the left of the check in counter and was probably by far the BEST seating in the spot. At first, you think its going to be a very fancy brunch spot due to the set up, decor and the people in the front are very dressed up with prime make up. We then start noticing alot of the waiters/bussers are in jeans and band t shirts. The area we were seated at a live DJ who kept the energy high the entire 2 hours we were there - not only would he shout out the bachlorette parties, birthdays... he'd also shout out those that it wasnt their bday and were just there for a good time! Room ranged from kids to older families and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. The bottomless mimosas for $24!! Their giant bloody mary for $25 comes with crab legs! WHAT. Our waiter and busser, APOLLO and ERIK, were the best! Super friendly, chatty and very quick with refilling our mimosas. TRACEY had the entire room dancing, singing and doing the wave. She was great too!   The price was high but 100% worth the experience. Sit in the room with the DJ!! If you love to people watch, there's lots going on.  Right across from the Bellagio fountains, you can even hear them start.  I've definitely told everyone about this spot and i've only been home for 2 days. You'll see me there again!

IUBuRnW2_hseppt81zJJ_A.text: This place is awesome.  Recommend the eggs Benedict, the French toast and the breakfast croissant.  Check out the Groupon packages.

CKRJy4OS2SIkUxelupJNgQ.text: The food is very good!!!  But most importantly the service is Ah-maxing.  Jan is the bomb!!!!  I will ALWAYS visit HEXX when in Vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5cyCSDMoIy9e0QFjO0rmXQ.text: In Vegas with the girls and sat off to find breakfast.  Almost walked by this slice of fantastic.   DON'T pass up this gem.... what a great experience and decor was so relaxing.   Sat inside with the patio doors opened, a gentle breeze lightly brushing inside, we immediately got greeted, by who we named the best of the best staff, Rachael!   She was spot on and had us giggling during our incredible meal.    What a pleasure to meet such an enthusiastic person who loves her job which is proven in the service she extended.    We will be back!!

_Forvuw7fyLchg-ycpe96w.text: Stopped in today since it was newer. The place was nearly empty, but we were told it was a 10 minute wait. Ridiculous! Walked to one of the many nearby places to eat. No wait.

0QifzI72kAiIEptnxLkdBg.text: Our service was impeccable (loved Tracy!). Food was excellent and reasonably priced.  The interior is gorgeous. It's a restaurant that you would go back to again and again if it was close to home.

6pQJNOywIMYeaQbCsRTWRw.text: We went in today a little before 1.  When we walked up to the hosts, they had 4 hosts standing there.  Only 1 greeted us and why she was talking to us she kept on cleaning the counter and didn't look up to talk to us.  We sat down, I understand that they are super busy, but our server never came over for over ten minutes.  Finally another employee came over and filled our waters and then we waited another 10 minutes and still no server came over.   We finally got up and walked out because there is no way I am going to pay 20$ for a burger and not get at least decent service.  I have no idea how long we would have waited if we stayed.  They need to put more servers on or at least make those hosts help the servers out.   Maybe it was a bad day but I won't be trying my luck here again.  Too many other places to eat on the strip that we would get better service at.

67EsoKfvv1xExYI-OJ1tjw.text: Hexx, I was giving you 3 stars but as I write this it's changed to 2. Why? Because your food is good but your help/service is horrendous. We came here twice. The first day there was no issue sitting 4 of us and the waitress was prompt and helpful. Despite the flubs along the way (omelet was completely incorrect, silverware dropped on feet, etc...) the issues were corrected immediately. Day 2, we (2 of us) arrived early and asked for a table for 6. "No problem" the girl says. "We'll seat you right away" she says. Then, instead of seating us so we can order some Bloody Mary's while we wait for the other 4 that are on their way, she says we have to wait till everyone is present. I say they went to Starbucks real quick and she says "no outside drinks". WTF? I'm thinking, should we even come here? The rest of my party shows up about 10min later and the girl says "I can seat you once they finish their coffees". How ridiculous. She wasn't even polite or courteous about it. She was really quite bitchy! So you've been holding a table for 6 for 15min meanwhile you've inconvenienced me by having me stand in a god damn lobby waiting like punishment for not having all 6 with me right away. Then when they show you make us wait longer because somehow Starbucks is shunned by your establishment. You're kidding me... you could have made a 4 drink profit by sitting us and letting us wait comfortably. Instead we stood and waited and then my friends had to throw away their Starbucks just to be seated to eat. Not only did your shitty hostesses attitude suck (she was short, unfriendly, curt, not accommodating or courteous), frankly so do you! Im not interested in coming back here for a 3rd try, despite the fact the food was good. Good service can trump mediocre food, never the other way around.

Qf5ny6GN58qRCiNbvsMNjQ.text: Julio was the best server! Very attentive and quick to respond when needed.  Food was delicious and it was great sightseeing from the patio.  Bottomless mimosas for $20 on weekends.  Totally worth it!

-eSPu-bMpsnZEhmMf0YhvA.text: Went last year a couple times when it was the sugar factory loved it . Today on the other hand as Hexx we will not be back. Waited 45 minutes for breakfast at a time when the place was half full. When we did get our eggs they were raw. Sad hope they get there act together

VnLuTOwfWaFMAhfBdHKFjg.text: i was very impressed by hexx! we went for an early breakfast & got seated out on the patio. our servers were great, our meal was delicious, & the atmosphere was very comfortable. the potatoes & english muffin that came with our meals were excellent as were the entrees. tasted very fresh.

yUlRB9yl0rXI2p5vt1Ldyw.text: best chicken a day waffles I've ever had, not like I'm a connoisseur of chicken and waffles or anything. all I know is I wish I had it right now, for the 2nd day in a row. yummm! it gets four stars for service though it was about 5am or 6am...

QVlufbeSj_G6gTLYjIv5nA.text: HORRIBLE customer service. The greeters were extremely rude and unwelcoming, giving me dirty looks when I asked a question. I decided to still try this place out despite them, due to the simple fact that I LOVE the sugar factory. Well, I was disappointed because this place does not compare to the sugar factory in any aspects.  After being seated my waitress set menus on the table and walked away before greeting us. She then grabbed our wine glasses (before asking if we wanted any wine) and replaced them with small water glasses. At this point she still did not say anything to us. Serval minutes later she finally approached us and asked if we were ready to order and never offered us drinks. Throughout the entire meal she wanted very little to do with us. She would set down our food while turning her head and leaving before we could talk.  The menu is much smaller, less variety, and their dessert menu is very poor. The food is overpriced, I could barely get anyone to give me service, talk to me, or even look at me for that matter. The view of the water show is gorgeous, but not worth it. The interior is also a failed attempt to look classy; mismatched furniture and decor. I also sat in a wicker chair, more proof that this place is a failed 5-star attempt. I do not plan on returning.

aphzlQkdOYmPJIh7djnQiw.text: Hands down one of the best brunches I've had in my entire life. And we like to think we are branching pros. TracEE (be certain to know it's double Es) is pure trouble. The mimosas are $20 for bottomless and it's the only time I can say she could fill them faster than I could think. Could be because I was tipsy. Could be because she was so fast. Could be because she is a mimosa ninja. All I can say is go. You won't be sad you did.

VFHKHm-zij8mwq4HTUASCw.text: We had gone for lunch and the food was decent, so after seeing a groupon, decided to try it for dinner. Big thumbs down. I'm really not sure how this place is going to survive charging what they do. We had a glass of wine, a beer, Caesar salad, spinach dip, and a burger and it was $110. Way, way overpriced for slightly upscale bar food. If you can, at least sit outside so you can watch the fountains at the Bellagio.

tyoDF88OFPLxh33Xj0QRLw.text: Great find! We were super impressed with the service.  Parish (the nice man outside) explained the menu to us and convinced us to go in and we're so glad we did! Very high quality food for a moderate price.  The broccolini appetizer is a must; we also got the filet and NY strip which were both cooked perfectly and very yummy.  We sat at the bar to get 2 for 1 peach cocktails that were so good, in a pint glass, and only $10 for two! Molly our bartender was also very kind to us.  Would recommend for anyone looking for a fancy dinner that won't empty your wallet.

DJCmV52-7b8yJ9zqSTCneQ.text: Our first experience here was for lunch and it was good so we returned for breakfast. Service was very slow which I can attribute to the fact that the restaurant was busier. They pride themselves on serving Peet's coffee which is great but do need to do a better job of brewing it. As a coffee lover, I was disappointed by the strongly bitter coffee, which I had to add more cream to just to dilute the bitterness.

ebutmsAtJ9bjRrbzEj-6CA.text: I've been there twice now the first time was when it had first opened slow service friendly staff decent food you get chocolate at the end with your bill (it was terrible tasting) we had even ordered dessert since it's what the place was known for it wasn't very good (the second time we went we noticed the dessert menu was totally changed) second time around we get seated in a tiny table outside in 90 degree weather with load traffic jams beside us we sat there for about 30 min waiting for out waitress almost was about to just leave when she finally came around we asked to be moved inside there were people smoking and it was too hot to be on the patio they let us move inside but the table was still basically outside literally right in between in and out even though the dining room was almost completely empty we waited about 30 more minutes for water we placed out orders at the same time then waited a good 45 minutes for food it tasted fine the portions were small we left hungry after paying over $100 for a 2 meals I obviously wouldn't recommend this place go next door to Paris way better food and service

Y1NJZcit6IsLv_x-rkmP0A.text: Tracee was amazing!!! Best breakfast ever. The bottomless mimosas was a fabulous idea. Shared the chilaquiles and apple pancakes and it was heaven. Tracee made our day!

MAubBje6_Rgef1LK95T85g.text: Went to hexx for breakfest and was dissapointed.  The service was mediocre the table next to us received multiple menues with specials and so forth, while our waitress didnt offer anything.  I waiting for a grapefruit juice for a good 20 minutes before i asked where it was.  For the price i recommend the paris restaurant outside as it had better service and overall food.

_1j4_UcnOLV1AK5p-3TQQw.text: I have to begin with the fact that I was never impressed with Sugar Factory (3 stars).  Hearing that Hexx has the same owners I would think it was as good as SF.  Unfortunately I was really disappointed with my visit.  I ordered the soft pretzels, club salad, and a diet soda running me $34 plus tip.  The pretzels were tough on the end, like leather.  Aunt Annie's has better.  The salad which said had turkey must have been turkey broth.  At least the croutons tasted better than the pretzels except there were tons of them.  The amount of croutons was overwhelming and dominated the serving.  The service was 4 stars good, but what I ate for the price easily knocks my rating down.  Maybe some of their other dishes are better or maybe they have more kinks to work out.  Either way I feel there are far better dining options around.

ym8x2aoGGiz82N099xHoZQ.text: Hexx's menu looked appetizing   We were blown away with how good the food and service was.  We started our night with crispy brocollini.  My wife had the roasted tomato bisque a side of mushroom and a glass of Etude pinot noir by Carneros.  I had the 10 Oz NY steak with roasted asparagus and mashed potatoes.  Everything was cooked to perfection.  The bisque was full of flavor and just perfect on this brisk evening.   Mushroom were very tasty a great compliment to the bisque.   My NY Steak was full of flavor and just melted in my mouth.   Asparagus was great.  Mashed potatoes were light fluffy and delicious.   Desert was the perfect ending to the meal.  I had the signature carrot cake (Rafael suggestion) and my wife had the Aztec sundae. Carrot cake was moist cream cheese frosting fresh pineapple topping and a scoop of vanilla to add that creamy goodness to this decadent dish.   Aztec Cake is Venezuelan chocolate cake with white and spicy dark chocolate syrup   I only wish I had taken pictures.  Trust me come here and you won't be disappointed

_Jt2nsPlSX9IFPCPflU72w.text: Was there with a large group and everyone of us felt that our steaks and sides had an excessive amount of salt, in fact most folks didn't finish their plates.

GKwZ8I8w93rxhDpb5sb3iA.text: Wow, what horrible service.  Sat down at 10:50 and didn't get our food until 11:30.  Coffee was lukewarm and I got up myself twice to fill my wife and I's cups.  The saving grace is the location on the strip.  You pay for the ambiance with high food prices and below par service.

rk_D7o3969oOjtobOg9mZg.text: I really wanna give this place 1 or 2 stars but they may not actually deserve it... but we bought two steaks, their most expensive ones, and they were terrible. Really bad in every way a premium steakhouse can be. Everything else was perfect, service, cocktails, sides... perfect. But all that is supposed to set up the main attraction, right? Over cooked, tasteless, and dry steaks, both the NY Strip and the Filet Mignon. If pressed, go with the Filet, but these are not quality cuts, properly aged, properly seasoned, or properly cooked. Why ask for a temperature if it's not coming out that way. Sure, they offered to replace it, but that sets the timing off for the meal. Maybe it's my fault as their are more expensive steakhouses in this property and all the adjacent ones, but $40 should still buy a decent steak, even in Vegas. The cocktails were great, both the Desert Smash and the custom Gin and Tonic. Also, the spinach dip, House made pita they substituted at our request, the mashed potatoes and roasted cauliflower were awesome and better than expected. Just don't get the steak.

hpwGA3TNH3ZPxC7QoU360w.text: I had shared a pepperoni pizza with my husband and had tropical tea.  Also we had guacamole w chips.  It was good. environment was great, if u sit outside its not really hot bec they have blowers blowing cool air.  Our waitress was very nice.  We watch people walk by and u can see the water show across the street.   I think the place is a lil over priced but good.

8tBC1iAF5p57e4MHl07FoQ.text: Extremely slow, inattentive service. Took an hour to handle a simple brunch order on a weekday despite the place being only half full.  Our server didn't stop by to explain the slow service, and I suspect it was because several of the members of my party were non-English speakers.  Food was decent but overpriced, and not worth the wait.

JhIplKWo1qbFP8YiDfL45A.text: Go here if you want to sit outside and see the Bellagio Fountains, AND if you want to spend a lot of money on a mediocre meal. The service was so-so -- it was very busy when we were there, and I expect it is always busy because of the proximity to the Bellagio fountain.  We had a decent table inside, and the servers were whizzing by us, hurrying to tables with meals as if their marching orders were to turn tables over as quickly as possible. We started with martinis, $16 each and not even close to a full martini glass. Remove the pick and 3 giant olives, and the alcohol level drops significantly. We asked whether they serve bread basket or similar, and server said she could bring garlic bread for a price. I can't remember if it was $3 or $5, but whatever, it was too much. You know how old bread can be really fine crumbly, almost powdery when bitten?  It was that. Two small pieces of room temperature garlic bread served on a small plate that really should have been free. My husband then ordered the Jambalaya for $28, which was very good and a surprisingly large portion (much more than we expected). Beware, it is extremely spicy!  There is no accompaniment, no crackers or bread to tame the spice, unless you order the terrible garlic bread as a side.   I ordered the Sea Bass with Couscous for $38. It was prepared well, but was a very tiny portion of fish on a very tiny spoonful of couscous. I'm not one to want large dinner portions, but this looked slightly larger than what I would expect as an appetizer dish.   Our impression of the Hexx is that it is all about making as much money as possible as quickly as possible. People want to watch the Bellagio fountains while dining, and that's the draw. Once inside, patrons are rushed through a very expensive meal so the table can be cleared for the next diners and the next, and so on.

-AYXJla_RpYmP0YdNhScaw.text: First things first. Kevin, our server, was a great all around fun guy. Social, energetic, and quick. Joked with him through our entire meal. Good guy and would ask for him upon request next time (if I decided to return).  My food was good but not great. I had the Hexx burger which included American cheese, fried onions, bacon, lettuce, tomato, white chocolate bun. My main YELP photo is actually of the burger. It was flavorful beef and the burger all together wasn't too shabby but the lettuce was literally one of those wedges of lettuce. The chunk was so large I thought Vegas would soon be going through a lettuce famine. I guess it may be considered "cool" when creating the menu but no one past, present, or future needs or wants that much lettuce on any type of sandwich.  With so many options on the Strip I wouldn't return as the only memorable thing is that damn lettuce.

Cj1w8gjtgOFydbd5A-exKg.text: I can't give this 5 stars only because I need to more food lol. Other than that this place was phenomenal. The staff were very friendly and our waitress was awesome as well Maryfae! Great personality. We were sat down, served our drinks and were offered a special they had going on and I loved how passionate she sounded because it made my mouth water lol. We got our appetizer and ordered two delicious burgers. I haven't eaten good burgers like those in ages, and I eat a lot of burgers ( I love burgers). If you are in Vegas this place is open 24/7 give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hexx Burger,sweet buns, all the way. Also with a side of yummy fries and sweet fresh pickles.
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Classic Burger. Side of fries and sweet fresh pickles. Very delish. Hexx go to Texas lol.
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our alcoholic drinks! Right-Long Island iced tea (strong) left Hypnotizing something lol it is strawberry. Really good.

pl1wsRGHo8cNldvI75gkhA.text: We had a wonderful brunch at Hexx. Our server Tracee kept the mimosas flowing for us! We will definitely come back and ask for her. She made the experience worthwhile :)

t_u4qPLR_A844OCHuhdzeg.text: Came here on a Friday morning for the mimosas. The chilaquiles were amazing and our server Melissa was very attentive and had some great recommendations for our weekend in Vegas! Would definitely come here again! Great food and even better service!

CwVn21ntSYTlSvr2vZPF-Q.text: Great lunch spot with the best service by Sean. Thanks for the great Tortilla Soup, will be back next time I'm in Vegas!

Dizxr7LofjcI5g9_gZ7ofg.text: Birthday brunch for my fiance was great!! The food was absolutely amazing and our server was nice. We order bottomless mimosas and our server made sure we always had a full glass to grab. To me it's the best brunch spot in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles &amp; Protein omelet

OJkp4wgyXPZG_TQfW6EElQ.text: Great service from Sean! Wonderful food with a twist on common favorites...corn beef hash was great

GsiiNiKX61_rS-JkbK62fQ.text: Disappointing...High prices and ok food make this a hard sell.  We stopped here for a late night meal after catching a show.   The atmosphere is like that of a club with loud club music, but not loud enough you can't have a conversation. The decoration, white and beige, is very modern and appealing.  Service was slow, and the server, while nice enough, want really friendly or welcoming.  The items seemed pricy for their descriptions and I opted to just have a snack, ordering the pretzels. They were good, with a mustard-cheese sauce that went great with them. You get three of them for $6, and they were basic pretzels. My wife had the bolognese, and it was a bit odd-tasting. Not really bad, but unlike any bolognese I've had in the past, in a disappointing way. Uppon requesting parmesan for the bolognese, the server referred us to a small cup of white powder that had been dropped off on our table sometime before without any comment.  My wife was in the mood for an Apple pie and she was pleasantly surprised. My dessert, the mille crepe cake, was just ok. The chocolate and berry sauce were good, but there wasn't enough for the portion.

XHr5V7E_DAuRP017zxWrkQ.text: My friends and I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!! Bottomless mimosas are a definite! Tracy was our waitress and she was the best waitress we have ever had. She kept the mimosas coming and had us laughing the entire meal! Totally recommend

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friends and I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!!

P3yn20jdQ6bvXatpMQLcKw.text: Note:  There is a 6% resort fee added to your bill.  Hexx was a strange restaurant.  I liked it, but it was very bizarre.  The music at the place was extremely loud. It didn't really fit the restaurant.  The food was great and the desert was even better.  The wine selection and variety was great.  Bottles started at around $50.  They offer gimmicky drinks with dry ice.  So at one table, there is a couple dressed up eating meals with wine.  At the next table at a bunch of people eating burgers and drinking dry ice cocktails.  It made for a bizarre mix.

SvQcaLF3Xui5X9Kw9sEzhA.text: It was my friends birthday and we wanted to go somewhere nice for dinner. Decided to check out HEXX. The atmosphere and setting was nice. Hostess sat us down and we looked over our menus. I wasn't too impressed with their selections. They had very little to offer and the prices were high for what they offered. My friend ordered the classic burger that came with fries. I ordered the spaghetti carbonara with a side of shrimps. The burger was overly expensive for a plain cheeseburger. (You can go to Gordon Ramsay BurGR and get a burger for much cheaper) the spaghetti was not what I expected and wasn't that great. Service could've been better. Our server barely came around to check on us or asked if we needed anything. Wasn't busy for a Saturday night either. Won't be going back

BISCLiYRD3FLebiyWD0Low.text: Just ate brunch at Hexx (located in Paris) and it was deeeelish!! Bottomless mimosas and had the protein omelette- egg whites, chicken, spinach and an avocado sauce. Served with smashed fried potatoes and an English muffin with fresh raspberry jam! Our waiter was one of the nicest waiters I've ever had! It is a great view to the bellagio from our outdoor table. Beautiful and delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottomless mimosas @hexx

0IqwuRatnqRc0depC6HZ5Q.text: I was last there in June and they're bourbon maple syrup was phenomenal. The service was also absolutely amazing and stayed on top of everything. I'm currently planning a trip back there and can't stop thinking about stopping in for brunch again. Would love it if they sold their syrup by the bottle :)

ibvAeJzigspvj41Y6hZYJA.text: My boyfriend and I usually come here to eat every time we're in town. It's one of our favorite places to eat. It has the best atmosphere and the sweetest servers. We recently helped by tristian and Taylor. The absolute best. They were attentive and made sure we were happy with everything. Such sweethearts and made our brunch so much more enjoyable. I recommend coming and eating here, especially for their endless mimosas during brunch.

7X2YkK4ZSCVSUtN9vZ-ztQ.text: My husband and I stopped in around their happy hour half price appetizer time and had a seat at the bar. We ordered one of the fun potion drinks and it was so good! We ordered a few small plates and apps with the bartender, a short girl. About 30 minutes later I noticed how busy it had gotten. I also noticed how all these other people had food when they came in way after us. Our bartender disappeared. We asked another bartender if he could check on the food. Turns out the girl didn't actually put our order in ): They quickly took care of it and got our food. The other girl, not sure of her name but had on black glasses was AWESOME! In the end we got our food, they handled it well and the food was good. We'll likely go back.

OAhLqIg9SVgWuh5bj1b0NA.text: Nice spot across from the Bellagio Hotel.. I recommend the patio seating if you like to people watch and get some fresh air.. they have a bottomless mimosa special for $25 and a pretty extensive menu selection of soups, salads, sandwiches and small plates.. I had the Swiss Chicken BLT sandwich and it was pretty tasty.. if you don't like a "peppered" taste to your meal I would pass on this one as the chicken breast was doused in pepper.. I'd do brunch/lunch here again but I'd personally look elsewhere for a better dinner selection..

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MQLixwXTu4RFufvGYNBkmw.text: A huge disappointment! Not good service either. Was offered a tequila shot by waiter asked about 3 different higher end tequilas each time waiter came back & didn't have them. Just assumed when offered tequila,place had a good assortment,wrong! Asked for 2 types of WHISKEY instead....NOPE ended up w/ a weak pour of Jack Daniels! Caesar salad was bland & NOT crisp & Magherita pizza was luke warm & NOT cooked well. Tough time getting ice tea refills too. Great people watching though,could have done that for less than $87 though!Like I said, other than the outside seating,a complete waste of time & money & very disappointing!Stay away!!

lj_X1afS51RmiLhKUvnlrg.text: I tried to have the buttermilk pancakes at Hezx last Sunday in LV.    The pancakes looked fine.. but once I cut into them I had batter all over the knife and fork.. the insides were not cooked through.  The waitress & Manager were very nice.. the waitress took the pancakes back.. she could see they weren't  cooked.  The Manager told my wife and I the pancakes were taken off the bill.. and another plate would be coming out.  I can't recall ever sending food back.. and definitely not pancakes.  The second plate wasn't much better.. this time I had one bite.. I needed to gulp some water to swallow the forkful.  The second plate was also under-cooked.  I wanted to head back into the kitchen, and make some pancakes myself.. can't most of us cook pancakes ???!  Phew... try Mon Ami Gabi !!

KDOMMfDHiU-z0esr7A8sqw.text: Pretty disappointed. The place looks like it is 'higher class' but we had to send the tortilla chips back due to them being stale, the calamari was cold, and the fries tasted like they had been sitting out awhile.  The drinks, however, were very good. The Moscow Mule and Mint Julep. Our server told the manager about our complaints and he really seemed unconcerned and didn't even bother to come over and sat anything (isn't a managers job to deal with these sort of situations..?) This place has potential, but the management is obviously of poor quality at this time of evening (6pm on Monday).   We will most likely not be back.

bgDQAApNCJd8tp6-c4ChUQ.text: Tracee & Patrick are the most amazing pair of servers we HAVE EVER had!!!  So much props to them for making our brunch extra special!!!!!

WAUh3zek23KsoZo8ScAtfA.text: We had drinks and dessert after a show.   No waiting, a great table on the patio to enjoy Bellagio fountains at night!    Milkshake with a side of the "over cooked bacon" for hubby, and a crepe choc raspberry dessert so wonderful it  made me forget its name.   Really.  Good.   I forgot hubby's name too.   Would have loved to had more time to try dinner too, the things being delivered to neighboring tables looked and smelled wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Over cooked bacon, really called that.  Brown butter milkshake and a delicious creation of 30 thin layers of crepe and chocolate

RCPmkFdpiEnu6ZPROMyohw.text: Everything was impeccable.  Our server was very good and personable without being intrusive.  The Cauliflower was the best I have had anywhere and our steaks were cooked to perfection.  Will definitely be back! Try the risotto, cauliflower and filet mignion!

dAR6DqR3trqCA83V-x72Fg.text: The service was too amazing! We were seated shortly after arriving, they expanded the bottomless mimosa for an extra hour. Our drinks were never less than half empty. Sean and Patrick are the best! If you go ask for them they'll treat you like royalty, at least that's how our group and I felt. Spinach dip was on point, hexx Benedict were absolutely amazing, Sean even recommended a croissant or muffin along with it. Fresh berries and their French toast were great. All around awesome place must check it out. But thanks to Sean and Patrick your amazing service warmed our hearts they were extremely accommodating!

zhSfN_p9yNmGorWaq1LVew.text: It's an OKAY restaurant. Lots of hype on the reviews but it's not worth the price and the desert is pretty small for the price. We got a brownie with espresso ice cream. Brownie was good, ice cream was not.  Waitress was extremely rude for literally no reason  and every other worker we talked to (the seater etc). Wouldn't recommend it at all after our experience.

XcEzp7BqbU2rq2Lo-wkvvw.text: Great value! Started with battered and deep fried calamari with slivers of carrots and celery and a wonderful creamy spiced sauce lightly drizzled on top (not drowned). Tasty sauce with added crisp of veggies, makes a new favorite on my list.  Branzino cooked to my liking with skin crispy and flesh moist and seasoned just enough. Enjoyed with side of yummy roasted brussel sprouts. Excellent meal with a glass of Chalk Hill Chardonnay. Hubby had the prime rib and a signature barrel aged drink similar to old fashion with the single large ice cube so as to not water it down. He was happy too. All for about $175 including tip. Two thumbs up! Oh, and did I mention we had great server, sat outside with view of Bellagio fountains?!! Made for a great Kickstarter to evening before a show.

jTYBDdLDcCc6Hb3x4LHrwQ.text: This place was excellent! The service was impeccable and the food was delicious. We ate here twice. I will recommend this place to all of my family and friend.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I9hPgleISRZ_3zwhf3luBg.text: Saturday April 7th. First impression when you walk in is the unfriendly rude hostess's at the front. Don't work in customer service if your going to be rude to customers who come in. Based off of that we went elsewhere.

eCfx6a4WbWT5vjL43Sazhg.text: Me & my boyfriend visited Vegas on vacay before Christmas, looked up places on yelp & decided to go here!! Everything was absolutely amazing & such a great vibe dining in. Live entertainment, lovely display & interior, & our view was right across the Fountains of Bellagio  We ordered the calamari which was so mouth watering, a pitcher of sangria (the best), and tried the wagyu burger which had a great presentation. It was probably one of the best burgers we've ever had. We tried to eat it slow & savor it as long as we could. Service was excellent as well I think our server was named Laurie or Laura and she was so very kind & helpful. We will definitely come back & try brunch next time!

HbungOoApXMJHFFFttYwlg.text: Stopped in for Saturday brunch this morning. We were advised it would be about a 35 minute wait for the first available table, the place was busy, so we waited. 35 minutes turned to 45 which turned to an hour... the hostess explained they were "cleaning tables" but there were lots and lots of open tables. After inquiring about our wait time twice, we were finally called in. We were brought out to the patio but our table was in direct sun without cover, I asked if we could sit in one of the other five tables for two outside that were in the shade. We were told that those tables were already "called for" - you can't swap my table with another open table that is five feet away? Hostess gave no effort to accommodate. Why would they? There is a long wait list so who cares about two unhappy people. So, we walked out - no effort from anyone to have us stay.   If you are the type of person who likes hospitality and quality over quantity, this isn't the place for you. They've got a lot to work on in terms of managing the seating of guests and giving accurate wait times. Save yourself the headache and go somewhere else.

_XlZM3kqxF5W9_gONHiCqA.text: Food was amazing with large portions. We had the chicken and waffles & the breakfast croissant. Both were delicious. The coffee was also great. I highly recommend.

t6VE4hZ1i7DxB7KNmG0yRg.text: I went here twice while in Vegas. Both times the customer service was great! The first time I went for lunch and had the sausage pizza. I wasn't really feeling the sausage, but the crust was great. The crust is usually how I judge a pizza cause it's my favorite part. :) The next occasion I went as part of a package for a bachelorette party dinner. We had 8 people in our group. My friends loved the salad! I had the burger and fries and the burger was good, but the fries were just okay. Atmosphere itself is great. They also have outdoor dining area and on those hot summer days a mist that gently spays you (not good for the hair though) :) I would return here the next time I come to town.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage pizza

_XDkGULWERzIzYqo_ZY5Qg.text: This is probably my favorite restaurant on the LasVegas strip out of what we were able to visit on our LasVegas vacation. Ideally located right in front of Bellagio and in Paris hotel. It was fun to have mimosa and brunch while watching all the people go by on the strip. The food was excellent. We had red velvet cake as desert which was awesome. I wish to go back again and try other dishes.

1LEhs1BNoe-cZlt5ksSabQ.text: Very expensive, bartender got our drinks wrong a couple of times. Service was ok. I didn't eat there just had a couple of beers and spirits. Probably will not come back

8_8TqgTD9qyBqLUG8JuPeQ.text: Bottomless mimosas is what brought us here... brunch was fantastic! Food is good and service is great too! Definitely recommend.

0Y73ue_xjjUyhYqwqQX6sg.text: Really amazing breakfast. I got the meatty omelette, and it was a lot of food and really tasty. The bottomless mimosa deal is 23 dollars and very champagny! Our waitress Cece was awesome and super helpful.  Would definitely go again!

qidssDt_HQe7vy2hd1eF0Q.text: Wandering the strip we got the munchies so wandered into Hexx.  Very upscale and the patio is nice to people watch.  The front desk ladies were great as was our server.  Made for a fun evening. The food was good.  Nothing to write home about but definitely merits a note to Trip Advisor.  Interesting menu and we decided on the Jambalaya and the spaghetti with meat balls.  I really enjoyed the Jamabalaya as it had tons of perfectly cooked shrimp and had a nice kick.  Mmmm.  The mesketti was good.  The noodles were cooked a bit beyond al dente but not overdone.  The meat balls were tasty but could have used a touch more seasoning.  The real all star was the shaved garlic chips that had been pan-crisped.  Great touch. Only complaint?  Outrageous prices or a pint of beer.

YzKM5Hgh0RDy_DxS43ryPQ.text: Went with three other couples.  The menu is really diverse -- which was good for the picky eaters in the group. The seafood tower was good -- little pricey. Must get the cheesy garlic bread. damn it was good. The filet was one of the best i've had in awhile -- expensive steakhouse quality for half the price in vegas -- that's for sure. Sides : get the broccolini and the cauliflower. so good. and deserts -- the peanut buttter cheese cake was rich and delicious. and if you like after dinner cocktails -- the tiramusu deconstructed is really good. but it's very boozy. I have followed the new executive chef -- from Fiamma at the MGM (when it was good ) to his wine bar Due Forni and now at Hexx. He's really classed up this class.

8TSM3zrgIl3d4iZkatG6qw.text: Cheesy bread fabulous. Great, friendly service. Possibly the best people watching (with outdoor table) in Vegas.  Can see Bellagio Fountains from table (in part).

Ur9HOxmvYN-reQjo3JSojQ.text: Amazeballs. 5 stars all around. Incredible service, great food, very attentive staff. Went for a birthday dinner and we decided to go balls to the walls an order tons of drinks and a ton of food to split. We started with the Mystic Berries Potion which comes in a pitcher and gets all bubbly (see video). It came highly recommended and it was incredible. We asked for recommendations on an appetizer since we were still deciding on food, and our server Jessica recommended the crab cakes. They were beyond amazing, so we decided to try a couple more apps. We ordered the overcooked bacon and baked cheese. Both were incredible, great flavor fusion and overall very impressive. I think the baked cheese was my favorite of the three.  We finally made some moves towards actually picking dinner items an wanted to get another pitcher of drinks. We ended up with another drink (cant remember the name) and it wasn't as  good as the first drink, but still good none the less. We decided to split the roasted tomato bisque, tagliatelle bolognese and the chicken an waffles. The soup was delicious, lots of great flavor, the pasta was amazing and the chicken and waffles were to die for. They were served with apple butter and burbon maple syrup, which together made for a melt in your mouth combo that made me sad  that i was so full and couldn't finish it. I will definitely be back because we were so full we couldn't even order dessert!   Portion sizes were perfect, huge and great for sharing. They're open 24/7 so thats a huge plus. I can't say enough about how amazing our service was. Our server made great recommendations and  the staff was always coming by to clear the table and give us new settings an were extremely on top of their game the whole night.   We had a table on the patio so we had views of the fountains at Bellagio, and the restaurant itself was absolutely beautiful. Well done and a great night!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potions menu!
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato Bisque

blvUUkhD4lwXJ3b5U74Jdg.text: Great food and environment. Breakfast was fresh, light and delicious. The wait time for breakfast rush was around 20 minutes but they have a great shop next door where you can grab coffee, treats and chocolate concoctions. Grab a seat on the patio and enjoy the Bellagio water show while you dine.

gP9hZk8c_yjFY0M8eqNrlw.text: The food and drink was incredible! Most of all the service was amazing. We had a large party and Brittany G was on top of it all. She was super personable and accommodating. We'll definitely be back next time we're in vegas! Thank you to Brittany for a wonderful brunch! She made our group have the most wonderful experience and we can't wait to visit her soon.

HyCy0HsI7BLlD9EwB2bLTQ.text: Me and my gf came here to try the Jungle Juice and we weren't disappointed. some appetizers here and there, so i cant really judge the food but from the reviews it all looks great! the reason why i'm giving this place 5 stars was because overall our experience was wonderful to the moment we sat down our waitress was super friendly and asking us frequently how we were doing. Great job. i don't remember her name but she has short hair and a butterfly tattoo on back of her neck, you cant miss it.

h0iTuc1mZtsfpUZb8YHweg.text: This is the first place we went to when we got to Vegas. We were starving for breakfast and decided to them out. My husband and I shared the surf n turf sliders. They were short rib with lobster and slaw. I tried to fish out the lobster out of one  because I really didn't like it. My hubby at the rest. He said it was ok but not worth the $28 price tag. I left hungry and dissatisfied. I would not recommend this place.

xTPa24ceZKhbHZ7sdK1PIQ.text: Location is the best in Vegas. Right across the street from the Bellagio fountain, so you have a great view to the fountain show.  Their food was okay. I think they have changed their menu recently and it seems to have less options.  Staff is friendly.

aRGW4czaCA1fqlj7DzSXdg.text: Sean (the new guy) was the BEST! He made us love everything about our experience here. Hexx Benedict's was definitely the best I've ever had!!

FsmwSWpDaUxdoQTZQtLpaw.text: Love this place for the bottomless mimosas Sean was our server and he was great.  He was calm cool and collected the whole time. The restaurant was busy but Sean stayed attentive and pleasant the whole time. His sidekick Brandon runs food like a champ. Come to hexx and let Sean put his spell on you.

weHz-CRV4ARndQJdd70Kvg.text: Really cute restaurant atmosphere and super fun little candy and thugs store!! The food was different but we enjoyed it! The atmosphere is very bright and friendly...great waitress!! Sad I can't recall her name, because my Sangria was awesome and delicious, along with the pita style chips and yum hummus...we all required another batch of the chips in order to finish the hummus..lol!! The store was great fun, especially for my kids and my coffee was superb!! We are coming back to sit outside and enjoy it more!! Great place!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious lemonade!!

g8f04cWelDZ_CqtTysgIig.text: All five stars go to Jody a waitress here and the mimosas at brunch. The couple of times I've been here unintentionally she has waitressed for us. Best waitress I have ever had.  If you really are trying to have bottomless mimosas request Jody!  Food is delicious a little pricey but worth it... specially the mimosas. Guaranteed you will end up drunk before 2pm

SUH7-V9uvylqyukTTfdeiQ.text: Place is awesome. Food was great. Service top notch. I'm a little inebriated to comment further. Will continue later.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macaroon cake
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Silk pie

p72Sa6n4nyX1QHgYo9G5kw.text: What a pleasant surprise! Located inside Paris Hotel & Casino, we decided to try it out for an early dinner before a show, and we're really glad we did. Service at the bar was excellent. Great teamwork. Everyone seemed to work together as opposed to one person only handling your orders, which meant drinks and food arrived quickly after ordering.  The cocktails are fun, fresh and unique. The food was outstanding. Of all things, the standout was the broccolini appetizer. Honestly, we ordered it to get a little "green" in our diet, but after the first bite, we devoured it. The simple salad was fresh and light and the sea bass with butternut squash couscous was really good.  If we hadn;t been staying at Paris, we probably would have overlooked this place, but really glad we decided to stop in. I'll now seek it out for the broccolini alone!

f_NPev9LLygSpg5jss4yog.text: amazing! love it all  the lighting is beautiful and the food was delicious ...i tried the risotto, ahi tuna, a salad and of course a glass of red wine...just perfect !

h85tz9zIPMpJEY0KJfnV5Q.text: such a great little place tucked away in plain sight. the servers were great & mist patio was perfect. i highly recommend the grilled chicken caesar salad.

_VQ-tXBtipAxnoyL-eMYRg.text: My friends and I had such a great time at brunch. Sean was our waiter and he worked his tail off serving us. We never had an empty mimosa. We loved the experience so much we ate here twice. Sean is the best.

2CEKMXZWeuz668um7lEg-w.text: Mediocre experience... Waited about 30 mins for our food. that's about the average longer waiting time but it felt like forever. When the food came, my friends and I were really excited to eat. One of my friends ordered the veggie pizza and the other ordered the blt chicken sandwich. I ordered the hexx burger. all three of us had the same concensus: food was not flavorful. We had to ask for extra sauce to give it flavor... The price for average food was pretty expensive... Our dishes average to be about 18/dish. Probably won't come back here again. Bad first impression. One thing I wanted to mention was, they had this really yummy sauce called yum yum sauce. It turned out it was a simple mixture of Mayo and sirracha lol who knew such an odd combination could make such a good sauce.

RuIOLniMIO925TZ-xLaZdw.text: Such a disaster. Came here on a week night for dessert. It was past 11 pm so the whole restaurant was empty. We asked the server if we were able to sit outside after making such a hassle and throwing a fit she finally said yes. Then she took our order. Like I said we just came for dessert. Got a couple of shakes which literally took an hour to come. 8 don't understand what could of possibly took that long. It's not like we ordered steak. Where were they getting the ice cream from?... Alaska? Didn't even taste good.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not worth the wait.

BKjfhPJJKoLegP_AJ9ZoBw.text: Went here for bottomless mimosas to celebrate a friends bday. The food was great , atmosphere was great and the best part was the awesome service . Shout out to Our servers Tracy and Patrick, they were attentive, had great personalities and made sure we had a great time and great service .  It's def a great place for bday parties or just gathering of friends.

m_O_BBUYbqImv1omG335IQ.text: Love this place. Great view! So peaceful and o like the decor. We got the cheese plate which was amazing. The. The scallop ceviche was little weird. It was creamy. I thought it needed lemon juice and salt but it was fresh and still tasted good. The hex cauldron is so good! Wait staff is great.

mbOgR16VL__JYKalwW5RMA.text: This place SUCKS. Can't get any orders right. Brought us the wrong food 3x and took over 45 mins. If you're hungry and want good food and service, DONT GO HERE.

6GqtVitpZb1Vn3n9NDPSbQ.text: dining in Paris... Las Vegas, that is!  Hexx is located in Paris Hotel and Casino just a few feet to the entrance of the Eiffel Tower. We were led inside by the host then back outside to a table out on the patio where the view was the dancing fountains across at The Bellagio. The weather was a comfortable low 70's.   The menu was small - appetizers, salad, steak choices, pasta and pizza, side items (sold a la carte), chilled seafoods and some entree's. For starters we had complimentary pita bread with dipping oil. Dinner followed and I had the Flat Iron Steak with an a la carte order of mashed potatoes. The steak was tender and juicy... so delicious! We also ordered Pepperoni Pizza and Artichoke Dip appetizer taking our time eating while pleasantly enjoying the fountains across the street at the same time. Although the music was a little faint we could perfectly hear the thunder of the fountains as they danced to a variety of music which came on every 15 minutes. Juan was our server and he did a great job taking care of our table along with another server who made sure our water glasses were never empty . Oh, and I love your accent, Juan... we were well taken care of by this team of servers. There is an attached candy store that we didn't get a chance to visit but we were each given a piece of chocolate after our meals. Teaser.   Perfect place to people watch too! For a while a couple of gals dressed as Las Vegas showgirls complete with huge feathers stood a few feet away from us. Sadly no one wanted to take a photo with them. They tried.    Overall, nice and pleasant experience here at Hexx.  Review #0906

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 11.24.17  Hexx chocolates
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 11.24.17  inside Paris Hotel
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 11.24.17  Baked spinach dip

D5HyMNhWigVUgLnLRZMdCg.text: The best kept secret for fine dining in Vegas without breaking the bank: Travel Zoo 3 course dinner for 2 people $80. We were impressed the food came out fast and the customer service great. Both steaks we ordered were charred to perfection. My only compliant was the band was too loud from where we were sitting. Added bonus get the shake with alcohol as your dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our 3 course dinner from travel zoo!

pqySSZHEfS_VlNGk8m_XmQ.text: Fourth visit. Each time good food and friendly staff. Breakfast is good, dinner is better for vegetarian options.  Views of the Bellagio water show and the strip. Great place to visit.

vmwHwkiSpp_wUJbRhWKETA.text: Sooooooooooooo goood!!! Loved the atmosphere!!! Amazing view of the water show! Filet mignon was Perfect !!!!!!!

VGXlDzRe3ADW2-zJaDypKw.text: Great place for brunch! Excellent food & fantastic service.   The surf and turf sliders were delicious.  We had the bottomless Mimosa. Worth the $24.  Every time we took a sip Adam our server swooped in & topped it off. We will definitely be back & will ask for Adam!

gY2vtsjOzvqONIR3c8CxEQ.text: Little oasis in the middle of the desert!!  We stumbled upon Hexx while galavanting on the strip.  The family was hungry and were very pleased with the ambiance and menu selection.  As someone into design, I loved the interiors of the place.  It all added to our dining experience.  We were greeted promptly at the door and seated immediately.  The service was very good, and the food met all of our expectations. If and when we get a chance to get back to Vegas, we will drop by again.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loved the interior
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WLqEjaflIdrYi6ZeTCMnxg.text: Our server MIGUEL , he is very friendly. He gave us good service and he is very funny.. Came here with my girlfriend from california to Celebrate my bday.. we all very happy! I order Branzino so bomb. They cooked so perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iAu61qXElgNDs-F66e0KMw.text: Went for brunch on the first day of my Bachelorette trip and wanted to go back every day after. Had the Hexx Benedict and it was AMAZING!  Scalloped potatoes really kicked it up to a whole new level!  My mom had a crab cake and it was also delicious. I will definitely be coming back on my next trip to Vegas!!

txU8mmwDJvPLeLeILqMJHA.text: I was curious about their potion cocktails, but $38 was a bit too steep for my morning beverage so I passed.   The Hexx $15: I opted for this cocktail instead. It was really good, like a grown up chocolate milk!   Cinaroll Waffle $14.95: The icing on this was really good, but sweet. The waffle itself was just OK. I personally prefer a thinner waffle.   Bacon $5.95: The waffle doesn't come with any sides, so a side of bacon sounded good to me! It ended up being a really good idea to help cut the sweetness of the waffle.   Marife was our server and she was amazing! She was really friendly and personable. She even split the check for us by what we each ordered without us asking! Although the food was OK, I wouldn't mind coming back to try something else due to the great service and location across from the Bellagio fountains.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinaroll waffle $14.95 and side of bacon $5.95
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Hexx $15

yw-nG-JC4fE8MFTJhM0BWg.text: The benefits of HEXX is that it sits just outside of the Casino/Hotel.   We sat inside for brunch and it was such a bright and airy spot that you can pretend that you're near a coastal area instead of the desert.   I had a huge burger that was amazing and cook a nice medium to rare side. Legit too much food and I had to take half of the burger back to the hotel. If you want to venture out and have some open air, go to Hexx.

40gHXLe2xoB0i2Sh74uaEQ.text: I'm a local in Las Vegas. I went here for my birthday for brunch! I had a group of 15 girls. We all enjoyed ourselves! Service and Food was great and mimosas were excellent! A little expensive but you can't expect anything less from the Las Vegas strip!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K96x-Fmf8b0hziPqD4u--Q.text: I came here a few months ago during a bachelorette weekend for a recovery brunch and it was the best brunch experience I've ever had! We had an amazing server named Tracee who made us feel like the only people in the place (although it was a full house). She pulled out all the stops for us and our bride to be! She cracked jokes, gave great local recommendations, and even got a busboy to serenade the bride! The food was excellent and the bottomless mimosas kept coming! Definitely a must-stop brunch venue when in Vegas!!

jWbQ0veofpXXDwcR7Gi4sQ.text: Went with my family to eat breakfast here during our stay in Vegas, and we all had an amazing breakfast, truly can't say enough good things about this place! Our waitress Rachel was phenomenal! Her service and recommendations made our experience even better. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5iE3IAwi4KCKcINylzo4hw.text: Service was very friendly but very slow. Food was just OK. We tried the garlic bread (tasted more of lemon than garlic), chilaquiles, and chicken and waffles. We wouldn't order any of these items again. Decor is great. The 4.7% concession fee on all checks is off-putting.

9ltdGee5IHG36fM2Oxnbjw.text: If you can't decide between the Hexx Burger or the French dip, GET THE BURGER! I will share this struggle with you guys. I got the French dip and regretted it.  I took a bite of the Hexx Burger that a friend ordered... TWO THUMBS UP! Bun of the Burger has a hint of white chocolate taste.  Surprisingly delicious and goes well with the meat.  French dip was good, but nothing special.  You can get french dip anywhere else just as good for a lot cheaper price (Arby's or Lion's Choice).  I honestly don't even remember how it tasted.  That's how boring it was.   Maybe we went at a bad time too. Couple girls were very drunk and loud. They kept screaming at each other, but none of the workers went over there to ask them to quiet down or leave and continuously kept serving them more alcohol. They weren't even sitting that close to us, but we can hear their whole conversation.  It didn't bother me or my friends, we actually thought they were funny...but there were annoyed customers surrounding them.   Server wasn't as attentive as we wanted her to be.  She was sweet but......Refill our drinks and bring us our check already.  We got stuff to do.   Anyway, they gave us a little piece of chocolate with our check, but it was horrible.  I spat the chocolate right out.  Bleh!  Want to try their other desserts the next time I visit Vegas.  I believe they make their own desserts there so that's pretty awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Where the magic happens..
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chocolate I spat out... of course this picture is before I ate it.
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French dip!  The salad was yummy though.

2xIOmrIdKRYYgSYqtJNGPg.text: My wife and I went here for a light dinner.  We ordered the Spinach Dip, Cheese/Meat Plate, and Gnocchi.  Spin dip was great, very tasty.  The gnocchi was decent, could have used a bit more sauce; they were super tiny (but good portion size).  The cheese/meat plate was the highlight, so many options.  I wish they gave you more honey and bread to enjoy the different tastes.  Finished off with the s'mores dessert, which was ok (not exactly what I expected).    I'm not a fan of restaurants having a menu online without prices (seems like they're trying to trick you into going there).  We didn't order drinks, our bill (pre-gratuity) was around $85.    Our waiter (Kevin) was great, he even had pictures of the desserts on his phone, which convinced me to choose the smores over another option.

SR8ah55RW7LfBbuJ0hgxCQ.text: Loved the food, daily bottom-less mimosas, The Strip people watching, the Bellagio Fountain show and our server JJ!! Can't wait to come back for the gigantic Bloody Mary with a crab claw and prawns! Yes we had fruit (platter) and vegetables (spinach dip)! Other low carb and high carb options. Also, check out this to go bag!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q9lvnW4iq3wcfM6H_IJzNQ.text: Tracee (of TreErik) - and of course Erik - were amazing. They are the servers of the stars! A+++++ rating for this dynamite duo!!

X4FT9uJyXeQ6glWNCYLLPg.text: The location and view were outstanding especially if you sit outside.  The service was good but there was very little flexibility on making some minor changes to the menu items such as the type of cheese and side item with the Hexx Burger.  The hamburger was mediocre even with the overrated and overpriced white chocolate bun.  Other dishes such as the spinach artichoke dip and chicken & waffles were average - nothing out of the ordinary.    The main complaint I have with Hexx (other than being over-priced and offering mediocre food) is the surprise CNF (Concession & Franchise Fee) that is tacked onto your bill and leaves you no choice but to pay at the conclusion of your meal.  I have since learned that a few other Strip restaurants charge this concession fee and it's far worse than a resort fee because you get nothing whatsoever for it.  It's just a money grab fee tacked onto your bill that is kept by the restaurant owners and ranges from 3-5%.  My recommendation is to find out if the establishment imposes this fee before you are seated and if so, exit the premises.  Hexx does in fact charge this fee and as a result, I will not return.

TRY751Kn93GVRLowtfpKNQ.text: The location is amazing, across from the Bellagio fountains. You can't get a better LV experience than that.  But a CLOSE second is Kevin, our waiter on Saturday late afternoon.  He is funny, personable, attentive and informed.   He made us feel so special!  We had a cheese & meat platter with the chopped salad (recommended by Kevin) and it was delicious.   We will be back and bring friends.

N9TH2PmvK69bhf80W3CGVw.text: After a night out, my friends and I were looking for a place to get brunch before heading home. Luckily there was no wait here and it was a quick walk from our hotel. A seat outside or by the window will get you a spectacular view of the Bellagio fountain show. Our waitress was so nice and gave us excellent service. I ordered a protein omelette with was make with egg whites and chicken topped with avocado. It also came with some potatoes and an English muffin. It was a perfect light omelette for the trip back home!

-4uCruEYQIwyYpG1ks-hWw.text: First time to Hex Great place for a Sunday lunch. They only have the brunch menu on weekends. But still lots of options. No kid options. But that didn't matter. A lot of us tried different things. Chicken and waffles was not as good as Yardbird inside the Venetian. But the cheeseburger, cheese pizza, and club sandwich was really good. No nickeling diming for refills on drinks. Service was good. Not your typical strip eatery. Not cheap. But nothing is anymore in Vegas. Looking forward to going back.

1NgNk23FPiiM2ezk2yro8g.text: The food here was so good! But the best part of eating here was probably are incredible server marife, she was funny and personable, and took very good care of us!

Cc5dvkXxnZzYzw0IJ9A-FA.text: The decor and ambiance of this restaurant is modern and classy.   My fiance and I had the same dish. The fettuccine bolognese. I though it was ok because it lacked flavor. I tried some of my fiance's and hers had more flavor. Their seemed to be a lack of consistency in the food.  Our waiter made recommendations of a brocollini appetizer and a Cabernet wine, both of which we ordered and loved.   The view of the strip is great.

1Ht8MiPvhH0CU5AfRCOA7A.text: Taylor and Abraham were amazing. So much fun and the food was amazing!!! The Benedict was awesome and loved the mimosas.

neoqFHL84MiiEspfjj3Hxw.text: Ambiance was really beautiful but the food just wasn't good. You'd expect to have the most amazing delicious "I've never tasted something so good" experience when you pay $120 for 2 people. Nope. The Filet Minon was $36 without any side dish. The mashed potatoes was $8 extra. And that wouldn't matter either if it was delicious. But it was spiced so weird. I eat steak all the time and this tasted odd and was way over spiced. The steak itself was tender and I'm sure it would have been delicious minus the spicing. So I tried ordering ice cream since they're known for their desserts. The chocolate ice cream was dark chocolate and bitter. Which I should have known because that's their specialty. But I just didn't like it. Overall I had a great time with my family but would have liked to have a better meal for the price.

67aVByhShxfw4jSuzhDU0A.text: Great food and good service ! The atmosphere was lovely and we had a seat right next to the window to watch the Bellagio fountain!

pmgEYLxberNhJrux2g5tEA.text: Mediocre pizza and bland customer service even though this place is open all night it is not working going to!!!

veDX3mL_BtTlaE4ol-N1vQ.text: The food was awesome and Tracee provided us with an excellent service. Super happy, highly recommended!

ESx8HFMxw6xnEDkt7V5XlA.text: I came here for my birthday brunch and had a great experience! They've completely renovated the space, it doesn't look anything like the restaurant that was there before. Great food, happy and kind employees and a really great atmosphere. They accommodated my group of 15 and checked up on us consistently, not to mention their prices are fair. The location of the restaurant is great as well-there's an open patio that you can look out on to see the Strip. Will definitely be returning.

K0XPSjwVNAJhF81ix6jx6w.text: Cleanly-designed open dining area: a tastefully-subdued change from the buzzy tourism of the strip. The decor was a pleasant combination of retro seventies-esque fixtures and modern use of space.  We had the broccolini (awesome), split the spaghetti carbonara (very good), and tried one of the potions for dessert. The potion - a pitcher-sized concoction of liquor and juice over dry ice - was amazing. Google-image "hexx potion las vegas" and you'll see the appeal.  Service was fast and professional. Our server was clearly having a rough morning, but he never let that show while at the table; I only noticed because I was watching and because I used to be a server. He had good recommendations and brought us complimentary chocolate with our "dessert."

qDTuhRkMOXlHYSL3xkdrbw.text: When we got there they were about to close, so I thought but in actuality they're open 24 seven.    It looked like they were closing, I say this because they seemed exhausted, at least the waitress that helped us out looked like she had enough, uninterested in her job and uninterested in serving us with a bad attitude she took our order.  The burgers were decent, fries were decent, the place is clean and somewhat cool looking, but not special enough to go back or give it more than 3 stars.  Time to get a drink and forget about this joint. I put a hex on you!  Just keepin' it real The Real Foodie

01KTITiRs2myFJhmRcPe9A.text: Tracee is the best waitress I have had in months. She was more than accommodating and beyond pleasant! Great pizza and salads! Will absolutely be back next time we're in Vegas

GBjp7iiw--2Qji1OPzJeIg.text: Never had a bad meal here. Our sever Steven was absolutely amazing!! Worth every penny for food and service.

3svDo_V53ud0XE8YDVBDVw.text: An awesome location should not allow a restaurant to offer such mediocrity in its food and drinks.  The sangria was over-sugared and under-boozed. The crispy broccolini was drenched in a syrupy sweet citrus glaze like orange chicken at a bad Chinese restaurant and the florets were not just crispy, they were fried into sand-textured oblivion.
