Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolates they gave us after dinner

y3CIw9zjFdwTiYWZcRGJFA.text: Had this meal at 1:00am, surprisingly the quality did not decline despite the time. Menu shortcut: hexxlasvegas.com/wp-cont... APPETIZERS: -MARYLAND CRAB CAKE: Okay, these were a miss. MEH. Although fried to perfection, the inside was off tasting and the texture a little too mushy for my like. an app that tasted extremely heavy even though it doesn't look it. -SPINACH ARTICHOKE DIP: Cheesy, creamy, excellently fatty for the chips and the pita was so fresh and warm you wouldn't believe that was possible at this time of night and with the cool weather. It was good, heavy. -CHICKEN AND WAFFLES: Great! I love this dish and wanted to check it out and it delivered. Juicy perfectly fried chicken, seasoning on point, saltiness just right, the apple-cheddar waffle was soft inside, slightly crunchy outside, sweet, excellent batter i have to say. The bourbon maple syrup was delicious and just rightly sweet. Must get! Good service. Despite a miss (crab cakes), most of the meal was good and I would recommend this place. Tip: They take Total Rewards points but do not give.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Juicy excellent chicken and waffles (apple cheddar waffles, bourbon maple syrup) MUST GET!
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cakes - mehhhhh - too mushy for my like. Flavor wasn&#39;t there.
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside the mushy crab cake

RxUVEcFSyAI9SM8zH0j3Tw.text: This was our fourth time to Vegas in 15 months and I said that it would be a PRIORITY to stop by HEXX the next time I went after seeing the food and ambiance as you walk past on the strip. Also, the music selection attracted me. The Top 40 mixed with throwbacks soundtrack made it very upbeat and live.   We went for brunch around 10:30 on a Monday and we were seated immediately on the patio. This place is so damn cute! It's very big so there is plenty of seating and one whole side is pretty much outside. The servers were very nice and attentive. The main reason I wanted to come here was to try the famous HEXX potions. They are similar to the goblets you get at Sugar Factory..very fruity with dry ice in them to add smoke...like a potion! Lol. They are expensive. ($36 for one) It is big enough for two but one person can definitely finish it. The elixir potion is a must try!   I ordered the french toast and scrambled cheese eggs and my boyfriend had a grilled chicken BLT. Both were DELICIOUS! I want to try every single thing on their menu! And like most places, they have bottomless mimosas. We tried to go back Tuesday morning around 7am but they told us an incident happened in the kitchen and they were closed until 10. I was so hurt.   You have to go to HEXX while in Vegas. YOU HAVE TO!

dVIk8ljIVS85S5hMKQ7gyg.text: We sat outside and it was a bit chilly being 53 degrees. The service was great, we had two different servers, both were very attentive. We had bottomless mimosas and the server was on top of keeping our glasses full. The cheese bread we had as an appetizer was the best thing I've had! It was perfection, so cheese but not greasy. We shared chiliques and buttermilk pancakes. The pancakes were a bit dry, not moist like I usually like my pancakes but the chiliques were great!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buttermilk pancakes
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese bread
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chiliques

Twjfy_JfU-SVj8aHvd38Hw.text: I must say that everything about this place was amazing. Came for Sunday brunch and it was quite busy to say the least. Was told the wait was only 15 minutes, and was barely 5 minutes. Our waitress Quinn was a delight. You can tell everyone here works as a team. What I admired the most was literally watching 2 members of management buss tables and go around asking random tables, how things were. Oh duh I forgot to mention how delish the food was. Favorite item I ordered was the fluffy pancakes. But overall food, drinks, staff and experience was amazing.

YWiVAY2BRW7KOrF5TGsmZw.text: Apollo provided amaZing service! I had the Hamburger with fries and coffee Cake, all were super delicious!

A1Ztv_UhY7lu2egdVs3FRA.text: We didn't have a reservation on a Saturday for brunch, but we managed to get a patio seat (right across the Bellagio fountain) after waiting for about 35 mins. It was kinda annoying though that the table was right beside a loud speaker. So my husband and I were practically shouting at each other so we can be heard. I ordered the cinnaroll waffle with berries and it was delicious. Although, it's not something that I haven't tasted before. However, the drink that I ordered, called the serious business, is very, very good. It's a mixed drink but tasted like whiskey. My husband ordered the hexx Benedict. He said that it was interesting and very tasty. Instead of regular potatoes, the Benedict included mashed potatoes.  The service was good. Our server was very attentive. Our glasses were always refilled with water and we didn't have to ask.

-ux9FqafAbKPKoqk2lrnQQ.text: Not the best or the worst.  Pros? Fruit platter was fresh and large. Liked the coconut whip... got extra Pretty interior Large menu Tasty muffins  Cons? Expensive and busy

_M51zvulNP9RPjn0obkbhw.text: I used to loved this place. I really did.  Last vacations (a year ago) we came and we absolutely loved it!  This time we came back and I was super disappointed.  If it's your first time having breakfast here I recommend you to do the reservation online because when you get there even though they have empty seats they won't sit you right away.  Our server one day was very friendly and I remember I had the lobster sandiwch and she asked the chef if they could do it for me even it wasn't on the menu.  Next day he was completely annoyed. The reason why I am giving it 3 stars is because the consistency of the food wasn't the same as last year.  It really tasted like they have all the dishes ready to go and they just warm them up so you can finish quick and go.  As you can see I'm including the pictures from last year which I didn't get the chance to write a review but you can see a lot of difference not only by looks but by flavor as well.  The potatoes one day were hard and the next day were so mushy that I just couldn't finish them.  I had the chilaquiles and I think I'll stick with the eggs next time.  The alcoholic drinks are really good and worth trying, I would come back but it won't be the same expectation I had from the last two years I went.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VJzIRWZswBeSixn1pR-Pxg.text: Yummy dessert! Food was good. Slightly on the pricier side. However service was prompt They have a lot of selections to choose from. The ambience here is phenomenal as it takes you back to the roots. Would definitely come back if there was more availability of their lunch menu into their dinner menu. Staff was very pleasant to deal with and they even remembered us from last time which is great knowing you are being acknowledged

nU0xPbI9Eb7BO-YVXisstg.text: Hexx was a lovely surprise. Went there after walking around the strip all morning and was beyond pleasantly impressed with the amazing food and drinks. Did I mention there is a vending machine that serves nothing but CHAMPAGNE? Yep. There is.   I had an absolutely amazing flight of sangria's. Idk maybe two flights. They were legit incredible.  We had great service and a great view. Can't wait to get back to Vegas and sit on the open patio drinking my flights.

NjehJQcJMdCu-QpRXlV0Aw.text: If I was forced to pick one brunch place to brunch at for the rest of my life this would be on the top of my list. So hard not to completely indulge in all of the delicious offerings. I had the carrot cake pancakes and split and order of cinnamon roll waffles. It was hard to leave a bite left on my plate. Come hungry, and dont count calories.

U0U2fc2dZaL7QQ_Y2DFa_g.text: Great location and atmosphere, food is good but nothing out of the ordinary, great attentive staff, I really enjoy coming here for breakfast and brunch, my favorite item is the french toast.

Yg28uKfkOiyswsoAYT4FZQ.text: This is in the Paris hotel and this review is for the restaurant (other side serves tapas). Had dinner here on a Sunday. We ordered the blue Elixir (awesome when they pour it into the pitcher of ice!), turf & surf sliders, and a side of risotto. The sliders were pretty good. The risotto is a small serving but I didn't find it that flavorful.  Brendan was our waiter and was very attentive and nice. He offered to wait if we wanted to take a video of the pouring of the Elixir. One suggestion is to close the doors leading outside as it was quite chilly. Also they charge an extra fee for maintenance of the restaurant - it's listed in the bill so just a heads up.

3osm79qs_-7MSkMOwWYEqQ.text: Chicken and waffles are seriously the best hands down.  I taste tested other people's food and it was pretty wack, but the CW were on

2sfVjmSf2yhzeSsPIFqUHg.text: I walked in at 11:46, with a 12pm reservation....told there was a few minutes wait...45 minutes later, watching walk-ins get seated, I inquire again. No record of my check-in. Told to wait a few minutes. Another 15 minutes and numerous walk-ins. Once seated, another long wait for service. Luckily, the waiter was friendly, the food was good, and the company was fabulous. We took advantage of the bottomless mimosas- you get 2 hours; we did have to continually signal the waiter, but we found the bottom! Lol. The brunch dishes are good, but not amazing, and the prices are not indicative of taste. I am overall unimpressed- friends and alcohol trumped service.

pG4bI_16h9Cz0RiyCXszxg.text: Really great food and service. We also got to sit outside and see the fountains go off which was nice. Th service was nice just the hostesses were a bit awkward.

oyxE7E4B7kYNA0aCIrfJAQ.text: Had a great breakfast at HEXX.  Hostess were very attentive. Service was excellent!.. our server clearly enjoys his job. Food was Tasteful, Fresh and perfectly prepared. The elegant atmosphere gave it the finishing touch.  Highly recommended for a nice as delightful brunch.

4fGODbVYq7kKrevDJPp_Gg.text: Ordered the chicken & waffles, the Eggs Benedict and pitcher of the Bubbly mimosa. Let's start with the Chicken. 2 fried breasts were given, topped with pickles which surprisingly went well together.  The 1st breast was actually better than the 2nd. The 1st breast's breading was crisp but not too crunchy. It was friend very well, leaving the meat still moist. Unfortunately the 2nd was fried to a crisp, leaving the crust too hard and the meat dried out. I've had beef jerky more tender than that 2nd piece! For a $24 entree that was s but of a lot down. I'd give the 1st breast a B and the 2nd a D. The waffle was pretty standard but tasted ok. Overall the chicken & waffles earned a C.  The Eggs Benedict earned solid C. The egg whites were a bit undercooked. The temperature was not warm enough either. The potatoes underneath were bland and needed more season.   The Bubbly mimosa was actually pretty good. For $36 tho the value was not really there IMO however.  The staff was friendly and efficient. All in all the whole experience was a C.

4r5HzKcSclxqP3row6pXrA.text: Excellent food, excellent service and a great atmosphere.  I dined here twice during a 5 day stay in Vegas.  Once for lunch and once for breakfast.  Located within the Paris Hotel; and convenient from the strip.  Definitely recommend.

ymwOujTFIGnxZmblOLhsxQ.text: 1st and last time here. 3 star breakdown 1 star for food -food was good and drinks as well. 1 star for service - out server was very polite and accommodating. 1 star for wait time for a patio spot.  0 star for hostess help. Nana - she was very unhelpful. She sat us at a front patio spot where the sun was bearing down on me ( I was also with 2 other ladies). When a nearby table finished and our food had not arrived yet, i requested a table change. Nana asked the table server, Antonio, if that was ok and I visually observed him nod his head in a "yes" motion. But Nana did not want to change us so Nana told Antonio to tell us no. Wow Nana, I asked you the question, it's only professional and courteous if you gave me the answer rather than telling someone else to do it for you.  I will not be back nor shall I ever recommend this place to another person.

pmsVLxMpcnb224FRxMOOig.text: HEXX is a solid restaurant. If you can, request sitting outside to see The Strip! They have a great menu and the steaks are wonderful!

usQC65NERDKqnsVZR4GUMQ.text: Terrific option at the Paris. Bright and clean space that opens to the Strip. Plates are slow but service is super friendly. Recommend the charcuterie plate. And a stop at the chocolate shop!

fp8lNJEFMrYf-DfLQnzr0w.text: This was our first visit to Hexx. The wait time to be seated was minimal. The food quality and taste was out of this world awesome. We enjoyed breakfast selections and as locals can't wait to return. Thanks to the hostess Angie who was great and our server Fallyn was super.

0LVcBHHp_aShsro5g6ZBJA.text: 11/11/16 - time 10:13am, server JP -  What a fun restaurant! Brunch was wonderful - chicken and waffles are must and bottomless mimosas - yes please.  JP was our server and he was awesome! He was upbeat and kept up with our table of 4 even though it was busy. Our food was wonderful and JP kept our glasses full at all times. I would suggest checking this place out for brunch or any time of the day. Thank you again and I will be back next time I'm in Vegas!

Byz_AM_wwXpRii0Gx-_ztQ.text: Really yummy sandwiches.  Service was pretty good. Our food came before our drinks but getting food fast is not the worst thing in the world!

t1ZQirMuvIZq9ijxXsSu-Q.text: Best Place in Vegas. Sean and Steven were great. Best bottomless mimosas were the Best, and we had so much fun.

TRvfFDHEc8CBXe1D39qjJw.text: We came for brunch for a Bridal shower. Our waiter Sean took really good care of us and made sure everything was perfect! He was attentive, friendly and catered to all our requests! Thank you Sean for a fun lunch experience!!

Y3P67b6_efiqi08r7_iHIg.text: Our girl Tracee was amazing. Super busy but she was on the spot. Never had to look for her, she was there. Food amazing and just enough. Thanks to her suggestion about mimosa bcuz I can not have orange juice. The guava was great. Will definitely come back.

9QAGUYDrc16utnLgTJScqQ.text: Came here anticipating breakfast because it looks SOOO GOOD, (and it's open 24/7, so I didn't even think they had a cut off time). Got here around noon and was very disappointed when they said they stopped serving breakfast at 11 . Nothing looked special on the regular menu so I got a burger. I'm giving this place two stars for the burger because it was good, but the fries weren't even warm... I am going to try my best to get back here for breakfast and maybe I'll give an updated review...

Yz8SBP_Sg63wm99mrV14Cg.text: Weird smell as soon as you walk in, it Threw my wife off. The wait was 15 mins for a table on the patio outside. So we went next door to the French Restaurant. Much better

zKSVBrVKv1I2U_kJWPaVkQ.text: We enjoyed two meals here during our extended weekend in Las Vegas. The atmosphere is fun and friendly and the food is impeccable. The bottomless mimosas flow freely and the outstanding service is second to none on the strip. J.P. and Julia provided amazing service and fun personalities to keep our trip interesting.  We will definitely return here on future trips and have already recommended this place to friends who are coming next week!  Thank you for a great experience!

Ev_m6UN01MnNhq0s51lUKA.text: jessica a is the bomb and this restaurant rocks!!!!!! great food great drinks great views

gKioT3Mt22hm_a0eKsGNOQ.text: so this is a great tourist trap if you love chocolate. there is lots of dessert places around that honestly have the same over priced over fattening mess desserts. i wanted some candy but no one would help me. only one girl at the counter i tried to but stuff in a bag but then i just left. its very expensive and fattening. i really didnt see anyone even buying anything

fgHmlf01a7h9HQ8Enm1TNw.text: Awsome menu, and amazing service. Definitely a place to hit up if you are a foodie. Love their Johnny cakes, love their pork rinds, loved their candy bacon, and most of all loved their bottom mimosas.If you are lucky enough to get Tolu as your waiter, your breakfast and/or brunch will be as rememberable as possible.

ZfDFnMOjGPCQnHz3_ERKmQ.text: It may have been wrong time of the year and the chef on vacation but service was awful and the food even worse. I ordered spaghetti meatballs and the sauce was directly of the can and meatballs cold and dry (tasted like old falafel ). I wish I could give one more star for the view but the view couldn't make up for the horrible food.

FVMorRWSLu9JM3j1ky0CrA.text: Sub par food, REALLY slow service. Everything we ordered was way too salty, as well as overcooked.

xvNuMmDqDNoYwxy9wO-Eug.text: Tracee killing the mimosa game. Great food and greater service. Will definitely come back

MQM8hRPJyJm4-fbztIX8TA.text: Great food..great service.. Our server was Tracee & she was awesome! Definitely going back there next time I come to Vegas.

wgWkyUNN38jpcQa95_Bv0Q.text: Love this breakfast spot. Been here several times and the service is always great as well as the food. Last time we had Natalie and she was top of the line! Best experience so far? I mean really...how does it get better each time?!

DjRaKMWD9wxlYCVUTJz5iw.text: Service was indeferent to say the best.  The clincher is having people sitting down 15 minutes behind us and get served before us.     We had a few pizzas but so did they, so it wasn't what we ordered

w1l1ONEWUxLVff3jb07EoQ.text: Brunch at Hexx Bar was fabulous. Tracee, our server, made it so incredible. She was a delight to have serving us and I would come back simply to be served by her again. She was a blast and made the atmosphere amazing.

6XyoKV9flN2vIHqzQR7Qcg.text: Such a fun place!!  I was a little skeptical because of the high prices but I figured why not especially since they have bottomless mimosas for $26. The food was pretty decent overall and I really enjoyed our time. Our waitress was really polite and kept us laughing throughout the brunch. I had such a good time here and a very pleasant experience will definitely be back!!!!

bA4nNXEbTEtmCbd9Ecmzyw.text: The absolute best experience for a corporate happy hour!   I worked with Kayla in reserving the space for about 25-30 people for a corporate happy hour after a conference exhibit hours. She was very attentive in answering all of my questions and quick to send over updated proposals as they needed adjustment.  Christian, the manager, was so insanely helpful when we got there before the happy hour. He showed us where everything was, and where guests would most likely come from. The space was excellent, and he even gave us little seating pods as part of our space.  Alexia, the server, and Sabino, the busser, were so great with our guests! They were always checking in on drinks. We never ran out of the apps for guests. The food was great, and they had a wide variety of drinks -- from wine to spirits to beers.  I really cannot speak highly enough about hosting a happy hour/corporate meal at Hexx while you're in Vegas! My company will definitely be hosting there again because we had such a great experience!

xJOPoqna97l36e8Pc53MAA.text: Ordered the burger and turkey club sandwich. The burger came out medium rare (more on the rare side) when I wasn't asked how I liked the meat cooked, but it was good anyway and tried not to think about the meat being rare as I was eating it. The turkey club was just okay. Too much turkey meat in the sandwich. The servers were very nice,  hard working, and very prompt to our needs. Nice indoor/outdoor seating area with neutral, calming decor. Music could be better though!

bSsuv4SUWF89YeCYvLCkDQ.text: HEXX Kitchen + Bar is one of the few non-corporate restaurants on the Strip.  It is locally owned by three chefs.  Oh, did I mention the food and service are excellent?  My wife, daughter, and I visited here on our recent trip to Vegas.  We were seated outside for brunch, and had a great view of the Bellagio Fountain.    We started with an incredible fruit platter.  My daughter had the Carrot Cake Pancakes and loved them.  I enjoyed the HEXX Benedict.  I think my wife made the best choice: she ordered the Breakfast Croissant with ham, eggs, and cheddar.  The Croissant was homemade and delicious.   Service was friendly and attentive.  If you are looking for a great locally-owned restaurant, look no further!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The homemade croissant with ham, eggs, and cheddar was delicious.

ouq5kjnDDRy0hYpvQ_S52A.text: Wow, talk about a great experience. We were celebrating my wife's birthday in Vegas and decided to try Hexx, due to the availability of getting a reservation for 14 people, with no strings attached. Most places we checked had a $150.00 minimum with that many people.  We are so glad we ate here. The food and staff were amazing. The staff never allowed a glass to go empty, they were all over us. Maria was the best, she is an exceptional waitress. Great personality and attitude. She also made paying the check very easy, she allowed us to split it accordingly. They made my wife's birthday very special. We will definitely go back when in Vegas again. Thank You Hexx, great experience!

qTfs0dsLQQAy1ZtRH_YtXQ.text: The corn beef hash should be HASHED OFF THE MENU! There was hardly any corn beef, and as another yelp review stated, there were NO sweet potatoes. Maybe they were substituted for carrots?!? The only things perfect about this dish were the eggs and the presentation, but from a flavor profile something was lacking... maybe seasoned sweet potatoes? Also the portion is rather small considering it is mainly veggies for $16. Anyway I came here with the intent to have a nice hearty breakfast to prepare for a day of drinking.... unfortunately that didn't happen with the corn beef hash.  I did have a chance to taste the chicken and waffles which was a heartier option. The chicken and syrup were good, the waffle was just ok. Also, if you are expecting to have a nice relaxing breakfast to mentally prepare for the rest of the day, that won't happen here. The music is loud and fun, and so are the large parties at tables. Also there is an awesome bottomless mimosa option for $24, which probably played into the atmosphere.  Personally if I ever returned here, I'd eat breakfast prior and take part in the mimosa special. And maybe if I get drunk enough eat something, but NOT the corn beef hash.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice presentation, perfect eggs, NO Sweet potatoes, a little bit of corn beef

iOS0mGYghyxLvNlEeABAaQ.text: Brunch, Saturday, reservations for 10am.  Pros: - delicious food. We ordered the corned beef hash and poached eggs, chicken and waffles, Cinnabon waffle, sticky bun. The corned beef and hash was a mixture with a little bit of gravy, different from what I'm used to but in a good way; the poached eggs and sauce were perfect. Cinnabon waffle blew my mind, not too buttery or oily like some waffles can be. Very mild apple and cheddar flavor, but otherwise a really great waffle; chicken was moist and flavorful. Sticky bun was absolutely delicious; sweet but just what you'd expect of a toffee-laden bun. Super satisfied after this meal.  - friendly staff - conveniently located on the strip - Not only was the food delicious, but it came out rather quick  Cons: - slight wait despite reservations, it's a really popular place - moderate noise level, but it's pretty quiet for being on the strip in Vegas  - valet parking is $15-20 ish.   Verdict: I'd go back if our schedule allows but would only do so if we could get reservations. The wait without would be quite long, especially for seats on the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4.13.19  Cinnaroll Waffle
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4.13.19 twisted sticky bun
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4.13.19 our full order

6Di2J9nEz5S0Z3mR299yLg.text: I had the flat iron steak with a side of mashed potatoes.   My friend, who ordered the filet mignon, and I both agreed that the steaks were a bit over seasoned to the point that they almost tasted dry. They do offer dressings/sauces, so you have that option in case this is a concern for you.   The steaks do not come with sides, so you will have to order those a la carte. The mashed potatoes are so so so so good, if you are a mashed potato fan, you have to try these in your lifetime at some point.   The prices are reasonable for a steak house, but especially so for it's prime location on the strip and tremendous view of the Bellagio and it's fountain shows.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meats &amp; Cheeses
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flat Iron Steak with side of mashed potatoes

c2Lg4fOtcnojxJKSHRQqKQ.text: SWEET views, all around!  Located in the front of Paris, overlooking the strip, this restaurant has very pretty views including the water fountain show of Bellagio across the street with a lovely indoor and outdoor open airy feel! They had a live band inside playing tribute music which was awesome instrumental music to enjoy.   For sips I had *Moonshine* which has- Zinfandel, Blackberry Currants, and Hennessy VS. This drink was excellent! For my dinner I had the *Korean BBQ Ribs* which were tender and delicious, however this came with "fried rice" which was too spicy and not mentioned on the menu as hot or with any heat at all, but only listed as "fried rice". My mouth was on fire which killed my appetite at dinner. The *Bolognese* was scrumptious, but a tiny portion although featured on their menu under "large plates". The staff were friendly and nice, the ambiance provided special vibes, but the food was disappointing. 2.5 Stars.~

Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bolognese

b_CBHBL78aRWhkW2Y11R6w.text: Yo I've only been to Vegas once since I've turned 21 and wow JESSICA L IS THE BEST THING TO HAPPEN TO VEGAS EVER (BESIDES ME OF COURSE) she was absolutely clearly amazing the best waitress of all time of every time, and if she was any better she would be Tom Brady because he is the GOAt. She kept the mimosas in our cups  and the good times on tap! I lie a lot in my life BUT I can 100% deadass say (you can't lie on deadass) she made this entire first Vegas trip AMAZING The best part (besides the black out?) she split the check 4 ways!!! COME HERE IF YOU WANT THE BEST TIME EVER

rid1yif7Amw9lyaDxgUWKw.text: We had a travelzoo coupon for $89 3 course dinner. We decided to try it out and after reading the reviews was thinking it would be either great or just average. Our experience was great. We had A great server, teddy, who was excited about the menu and had knowledge about every dish and could help us make decisions about what to order.   For our cocktails we ordered the South of the Boarder, a spicy strawberry margarita. Very delicious with a hint of spice. So don't let the "spicy" throw you off   Appetizer was the Lump Crab. This was awesome. Normally crab cakes are small but this came out with plenty to share for two people.   For entrees I went for the salmon. It was perfectly cooked on a bed of quinoa,peas and mushrooms. Very delicious  My husband got the short rib. Meat was perfect along with the mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts. I highly recommend them both.   Dessert was the blueberry crumble. It was a perfectly light dessert after a big meal.   I only got a photo of the appetizer because we enjoyed the meal so much I forgot to take other pictures.   Overall I have hexx such a high rating for the atmosphere, service and food. The travelzoo discount was an added bonus, I would have paid full price for this meal for sure.

uxmHtNDzrUHvTEqrG9_N8A.text: Cool brunch choice with a great patio scene inside of the Paris Hotel. Hexx is a lively, fun spot but still chill enough to have an intimate conversation with friends. We tried the burger and the veggie omelet and both were tasty and well prepared.   Our server was kind and hospitable, but also extremely busy and overwhelmed with a packed house. This meant we had to wait seemingly forever for our bill long after we ready to leave,and also wait unnecessarily for condiments that we requested at the beginning of our meal. Other than those minor inconveniences, it was a great experience and birthday brunch for my friend. Upbeat vibes in a bright setting directly on The Strip.

-0FMXkNvpRTWIePbNoGpQw.text: We came for breakfast at 9 am only waited five minutes for an outside table on the strip . Service was really fast and friendly . Food was great . Perfect place for breakfast  in Vegas   Returned for dinner and it was fabulous. Best steak I've had in years and the service was excellent

mo5emw441imkGsMQJEy8jQ.text: Apolo was an amazing waiter. He was super attentive, very friendly and really seemed to want to make our dining experience a great one. We came into dine for breakfast on Christmas eve around 9 in the morning. There was no wait and we were seated promptly.  Everything on their menu looks amazing. It was hard to decide between all the wonderful sounding options but narrowed it down to the following three:  Carrot cake pancakes $13 Eggs Benedict $16 Twisted Bun $8  The carrot cake pancakes were to die for! Bursting with flavor just as if you were eating a piece of carrot cake. The eggs benedict were equally as delicious! They are served with a bit of a twist, potatoes instead of english muffins, we weren't mad though. It paired perfectly with the other elements in the dish. The twister bun (cinnamon roll) came out piping hot. The frosting puts this over the top. It was melt in your mouth delicious.   Don't forget to sit on the outdoor patio to get a view of the Bellagio fountains as you eat.  Overall this place is a major win and I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict! So delicious!

7eoUZ43Uf29RJgT0-x-lFA.text: Great place to dine if you want to see the fountains at the Bellagio. We made a reservation since we had a bigger party and because we were celebrating three birthdays that occurred over the week.   First when we arrived there was confusion as to what reservation we were but it was handled. Then we were sat outside and had a great view of the fountains and spot to people watch.   I mean cmon part of the fun of Las Vegas is people watching and taking pictures of your 16 year brother with nude truck advertisements driving in the background. Haha.   Anyways, the service was nice and the menu was reasonably priced but a little steep for what it was in my opinion. Bread was served complimentary at the beginning and the oil served with it was good.   I ordered the veggie pizza that had butternut squash  and other stuff on it (see picture). I am 99% sure this was vegetarian but not positive. They do advertise that they have vegan and gluten free options so if anyone in your party is vegan or gluten free they are safe to find a tasty option here.   The pizza was really good and unique, I liked it a lot.   I also tried some of the salad (Cobb maybe, I can't remember the name, but it looked and tasted like a Cobb style).   Then the three of us celebrating birthdays were brought out dessert with candles and that was so cute and thoughtful in my opinion. So I blew out the candle and made a wish.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie pizza

r3eaimDkkPkz3X7S4XZvpg.text: This was my first time here and I car by for brunch. The location is pretty great! There is a decent view of the bellagio fountains and the patio is heated.   I ordered the colossal Bloody Mary and it could have been a meal! There are so many snacks included. Shrimp, a crab leg, beef jerky and so much more. The Bloody Mary itself was really good too!  The chilaquiles I ordered were ok -nothing amazing. If I go back I will probably try the French toast. It looked pretty great!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ai9LpyY6MWh_iu0DpWqqWg.text: First and foremost, thank you to Daniel - our server (2/11 around 6pm) who provided exceptional customer service!  ... because of him, I would definite consider a second visit; from what I hear..brunch is quite popular here with the indoor and outdoor experience.   Hexx can be located on the outside of Paris Hotel. The perk about this restaurant is its location; it's directly across from the Bellagio Fountains, so be sure to request a "table seat" of you're looking for a meal with a view.   The overall ambiance of this establishment is "classy-casual-dining." The decor may come off as "fancy" but that's just the classy coming out. No need to throw on a suit and tie, but no sneakers & sweats - if you catch my drift.   The menu is great! It offers a little bit of everything with it's American dining inspiration. For appetizers my gf and I tried the Beef Carpaccio (5 stars) and the Surf and Turf sliders (braised beef and lobster, 5 stars).   For our mans we both tried pasta dishes: the gnocchi and carbonara. I can report that I was slightly disappointed with the carbonara. Although it looked creamy and appeasing, it lacked a lot of flavor and I truly feel like I wasted $26 on this dish that I maybe had 4 bites of. This was tough as I haaaate to waste food. Even adding crushed black pepper and Tabasco this just did not have any flavor.   From the looks of it, steak is their bread and butter here. Surrounding tables ordered steak and salads...so maybe I'll consider that next time. Steaks are in the price range of $40-$70. That's just the steak. Then you'd add your sides for an additional cost.   I think Hexx has a great location and b'cuz of the indoor/outdoor experience, this would be a great place to grab appetizers, enjoy a stiff bevie and people watch walking the infamous Las Vegas Strip.

HAOU0aA3HfJPmdZU33-Bvg.text: Family or five and everything was very, very, very salty.  Three different streaks, ceviche sides. All salty.

IKUMOP5Ln6XQrhR3eQRnfQ.text: Horrible service. Good food but I won't be back. Everyone working there looked miserable and our time here reflected that. We were seated for 45 minutes when the manager decided to create a large party table behind our large party. The two tables were so close that neither table could get in or out. Everyone was uncomfortable for the rest of our meal. When brought to the staffs attention they said "oh we know". We asked for boxes for our food; they didn't come for 20 more minutes. When we asked for our check we got instant attitude and a snarky "thanks for your patients" from the server. He then proceeded to say he was busy. We didn't ask for much and were very polite but yet we were treated poorly. Next weeks brunch will we of the strip and somewhere more local friendly.   P.S. being accommodating is great but not if you can't handle the accommodations.

3ekQ7vV137eki0em9ZTkDg.text: What a great place to people watch the diverse crowds of the Las Vegas strip! However...it started with the hostesses who sat us in the corner when there were seats available elsewhere, when I asked if it was possible to seat elsewhere, in a short curt response, no it's busy tonight and if cane with no reservations this is it. Ok wow! Not even a let me try, needless to say the table remained open for at least 30 minutes while we waited. Service was poor, took us another 30 minutes to get our waiter, ordered a beer twice and twice they came back and said they were out. The recommendation of what they did have sucked and luckily he took it off the tab. Cesar salad was good as was the pizza. Great place to people watch. ,

GANAOagiDwI82NO7xjz-lQ.text: This place is so So and expensive.  Paying for view of strip and the Bellagio i guess.   Food came out completely cold and service was slow.  The cheesy garlic bread was not good, I under cooked and doughy.  It tasted like Pillsbury dough from a can.   $38 for short ribs that were dry and stringy.  Don't recommend this place for dinner.

89FufgA3J5R30IJEx0OZwQ.text: Had a great experience at Hexx!  The food was delicious.  We had the best server Tracee.  We loved her energy and enthusiasm.  Her customer service was great and she kept the mimosas bottom-LESS!!

mrMloYsJqw5BstBXDnggCw.text: Chilaqiules are so good. Huge portion, two people could probably share. Chicken and waffles, the best I've had. Place feels very hip with loud music and patio seating - almost too loud for me though. Staff wasn't too friendly,  but service was good.

We went to the host stand and which she said it would be just a moment. Then watch 3 other parties walk in and get seated right away. Not sure if the hosts need to be re trained on how to seat people or they are not able to handle the volume of guests coming into the restaurant.

This visit we had the pleasure of Joahana being our server and she was AMAZING!! Super friendly, came to our table just enough, especially with our bottomless mimosas:) between her, my bomb ass chicken n waffles and mimosas my friends and I truly enjoyed our brunch and everytime I go to Vegas Hexx is a MUST

Get to people watch and you get to see the fountain show across the street.   I love their decor too!

rwPVIZOImZMVIBWNxNn3zg.text: Sean and Big Bobby, our servers were so amazing. We came in after a long night out in Vegas and they made our hangover recovery so pleasant! Definitely recommend this place for the service!

The butternut squash as a sauce and perfectly roasted veggies is an all time favorite of mine and next time I come back to Vegas will be coming to hexx specially for that!  The calamari was great with light breading and flavor.  Overall good service. They do seem to be a little busy but the food is worth the wait

1QV9HhpJto4jivpQH0wR1w.text: I went to a business breakfast this morning. All I can say is "CARROT CAKE PANCAKES" amazing! amazing! amazing! It even comes with frosting!!! Whhhhaaaaattttt!!!!!! Yes frosting!!!!

edRbIWdY2QQdPFW6Tbo2nA.text: Came here for a birthday with a large group. Patrick and Sean were so accommodating and  awesome, especially with a big group! Our food was delicious and our servers were always on the ball refilling out bottomless mimosas when we needed them! They were so nice and fun, really made our experience in Vegas so fun!! Will definitely come back next time we are in town!

rP_mKOsI8DXM88m4szdAZQ.text: Jorge is an excellent server!! He made sure our mimosas were full and we had everything that we needed! Such an awesome brunch spot!

j7GACHX9mimxhjAfYWr7Ig.text: Loved eating on the patio. Provided excellent people watching on the strip and a great view of the Eiffel Tower. I ordered the Eggs Benedict, which was delicious. We even considered going back the next day for a repeat meal.

7f2KWPkPP8o6c0N625CW_g.text: This is a pretty cool place open 24/7 in the Paris hotel. While staying for an extended time in Las Vegas, it became surprisingly difficult to eat some where nice super late. This place filled that need. The food wasn't memorable and I believe I ordered crab cakes but the drinks . Omg. They were large pitchers filled with dry ice and smoked like a cauldron. So cool and obviously why I chose this place. In Vegas you will pay for a novelty so the drinks alone were close to $100 I believe, but hey when in Rome, right?

KUWGPN2jhyWWGjzmlzHeRA.text: Great view. Service was good. Awesome spot for a date night and you can head to the beer garden after for drinks. We had to seafood tower as well and a salad and a side of fries and we where stuffed!

h6NhqzrTjTOKa5CqdcO1sQ.text: Terrific brunch spot. Even though we went on a busy Saturday the wait was short. Open doors with a nice breeze & view of the fountains. We shared chilliquiles & French toast. Both delicious. Good service. Some really tiny two top tables. We ubered to Paris as this is kinda of mid strip location. Would return for sure.

ZrPsM7ntiWTu_qbcJhFhgg.text: Excellent service and friendly staff and great food. Nice outside dining great early morning for brunch. There is also plenty of seating inside when weather is warmer. The staff very attentive and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great drink selection

S2qyxJLPU_LRFTDNox2tzw.text: Amazing food. Amazing service. Johnie was our server. He was the best.  And so attentive.  We got bottomless mimosas. Highly recommend. I just can't say enough good things about this place.

svlfZs3OOcObCW_mlV1IZQ.text: The food was mediocre at best. Chilaquiles didn't have much flavor and the lobster roll was mayonnaise-y and didn't have much lobster. Had a pitcher of Bubbly sangria and that was really good. Go for the drinks and people watching with their outdoor seating.

HQzJzW39r3V3kQbMH929Bg.text: was a little confusing on which door was the main entrance.  We wanted to sit at the bar, but was too hot. It was a heated bar that felt more like a sauna...really gross.

BzjY8NI-1WjjOVKaT4D6Rg.text: The perfect example of Las Vegas fine dining. Right on the strip with a GORGEOUS view of the world renown Bellagio fountain!  To top it all off, Chef Shay came to my table to see how everything was, which all I could do was look in her eyes with a lustful desire as I chowed down on my amazingly elaborate seafood platter.  The steaks are TO DIE FOR. No teeth? No problem. They fall apart in your mouth. I don't know what they did but I ate a piece of heaven that night.  Their desserts rival the artwork of Michelangelo and taste like a flavor bomb exploded in your mouth.  I can't recommend this place enough. If you have the desire to eat at the best all around experience in Las Vegas, go no further and good luck at getting a reservation!

0zt_5sg3kKtx-nr8v-vhxA.text: A decent spot for brunch on the Strip  *Hostess stand is located at the entrance facing the strip..if you enter in through Paris, you'll have to walk through the dining area to reach the stand.  Wait: ~25 minutes without a reservation around noon.. they ask for your phone number & will text when your table is ready  Ordered: Pork Rinds with lime Vinaigrette,Corned beef hash, Steak & Eggs, Meat Omelete  Wait for food: Pork rinds came out shortly after ordering (served cold) & just as we were finishing up..our waiter stated that our entrees would be ready shortly after  The food: Pork Rinds with lime Vinaigrette- portioned for sharing with the table, vinaigrette paired perfectly with the pork rinds Corned beef hash- smaller portion than expected, I helped my table finish the rest of their food. Poached Egg was overcooked. Steak & Eggs-Prime rib eye steak was chewier than preferred. Presentation was poor Meat Omelete--filled with plenty of small meat bits, egg itself was overcooked. Presentation was sloppy  Service: Good. Servers were friendly,attentive, and checked in regularly throughout our meal. Small snafu--server removed our appetizer plates and utensils before our mains arrived and did not replace the utensils. We sat for a couple minutes (eager to eat) but without utensils.  Ambiance: The main dining room gets pretty loud. Considering the number of bachelor/bachelorette groups & unlimited mimosas..I believe it's to be expected.  Overall: Decent casual brunch experience--could be improved by greater attention to food portion and presentation.

v0kCd39L2IUxJRCZz76koA.text: Went to Hexx with a $50 groupon. I realize it is strip pricing, but dinner was $$$ One person could easily spend that on themselves with a drink and a mid priced pasta dinner. 2 apps, 1 little salad, 1 side, 1 drink was $90ish. Beautifully decorated and a great patio. Dinner was good...nice presentation...but not a "Wow" factor restaurant.

Mfq_PF2cdLLM9S9ogh7vVw.text: It was pretty empty when I got here around 5:30. The customer service is ok.. I asked them to get a side of mashed potatoes, they didn't get it for me. They messed up my steak and it was well done.   Our waiter was pretty rude, because he was like yea whatever. It took about 20-25 minutes and everything was salty, there was nothing good about this place.   I don't recommend this place because their service is bad as their food. Save your money and go somewhere else.

sVmXlLFVQXMEPrPiT1roSg.text: I went here for a work dinner, I wanted something light (especially after the appetizers, we got the meat+cheese plate and the cheesy bread and they were very yummy) I ordered the shrimp cocktail and the mushroom risotto. The shrimp cocktail had to be the most fancy presentation I've ever eaten. I liked it a lot! The mushroom risotto however was a bit crunchy and I didn't see or taste any mushrooms in it? It was more like a Parmesan risotto. I tried my friends steak (EVERYONE got steak and it looked even better than my food...I'm just not a steak person I don't eat red meat) and damn that steak was so good! I'll have to come back and get my own for sure! Then we got dessert, their chocolate "spells" were cute, but the chocolate wasn't anything to cry home about. However, the peanut butter cheesecake...drool. Think of it as a snickers bar, an Oreo cookie, and a peanut butter cup all in one. But it's not overwhelming. It's a perfect mix. Highly recommend.

The wait staff was a little pushy, making faces when we did not order alcoholic drinks. Food was so so, service was below average.

qxU0TOYP19BZfARCRQ_1ZA.text: Pretty pricey, but overall pretty good food and views. It's right across the street from the bellagio so it's a great view of the water show.  I got the short rib with mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts $30. The short rib was really tender and the Brussels sprouts had a great coating of flavor!  We also got the magik dragon hex potion, which again was very pricey but yolo when in Vegas. Decently strong and not as sweet as I thought it would be, which was good! Plus they give you a huge piece of dragon fruit to eat which I love!

DGDc-719YQZU8hT_vVZ_wQ.text: Visiting Vegas for a few days and one of our bucket lists was to do brunch with bottomless mimosas! We are staying right next to hexx kitchen at planet Hollywood so it was convenient for us to come early for breakfast! We were seated right away outside which was a nice view of the strip. We started with bottomless mimosas and the omelette, potatoes, and English muffin. It was ALL delicious, perfect size portion and fair pricing. Our server was very consistent with filling our drinks before we finished. We really enjoyed hexx and will recommend to friends who come to Vegas!

uzjwoo3gIKtBWjZeAMLkUA.text: My friend and I both ordered the Eggs Benedict which was delicious. It was served atop scalloped potatoes instead of on a English muffin. The server recommended we add some hot sauce to it. When we did, that took the flavor to the next level.   Drinks were pretty, but very sweet. The Mai Tai (left drink) was less sweet than their take on an Old Fashion (right drink) but we enjoyed both equally.   Good breakfast/brunch spot and prices are average.   Make a reservation because it's always busy!

7GR0m4DSkb9xBZ3MGXmB8Q.text: Wow!  How do you possibly mess up pancakes.  I ordered pancakes with butter and slices of lemon on the side.  They brought my date his food and me cold pancakes no butter no lemon.  I asked for the butter and the lemon, they brought the butter and lemon and then I waited another 10 minutes still no pancakes.  Decided to not eat.  Manager cane over and asked if she could now bring the pancakes 25 minutes later.  I asked for the check.

Y5V3LVw94JwLyewsXvMO_g.text: Went back just yesterday for Brunch and thought it was great.  First off, finding a restaurant on the Strip serving breakfast till 4 p.m. is RARE.  So I was pleasantly surprised to find Brunch till 4 p.m. especially when sometimes in Vegas my husband and I don't start our day till 1 or 2 p.m.  We had the Meat Omelet and the Brioche French Toast and split them so we could have some sweet and savory.  We were very happy with both selections. We did not do the unlimited mimosas this time as we were catching a flight later that afternoon.  Service was great and FAST, surprisingly so since they were quite busy.  It did get a little loud in there, guessing it's because everyone else around us had the mimosas and other cocktails.  We definitely recommend this place and will be back.

XOBr5Yg67wXZtJN2Ldkrng.text: This review is looooong overdue but very necessary! My boyfriend and I were in town for Easter weekend and decided to stop into Hexx for lunch and mimosas. We had passed this place walking up and down the strip but decided to stop in on this day (day after Easter). Our server was Sean (he said he was fairly new). He was very kind and informative and was always wearing a smile. Our food came out in a timely fashion and everything was absolutely delicious!! Sean and the gentleman assisting him were always on top of things like questions, drink refills and plate clearing. We had gotten a bottle of champagne that was actually being retired so Sean had us sign it, along with himself, and showed us where they would store it so we could come find it next time we were in town. They have a whole display of signed bottles! Pretty cool experience. We will definitely be back! Thanks again Sean!

phlpqUSC3AfCnPLir1yyIQ.text: Great place for Sunday brunch. Food was fresh and service was great. Huge portions, quality bloody Mary's, and bottomless mimosas. Great patio for people watching too!

u04n99TCfstlrq8XFLH2mQ.text: Had the simple salad and the hexx burger plus one of those awesome bubbly drinks. The food was ok, nothing that stood out and a tad overpriced but a cool experience.   Be forewarned- why I am giving this experience two stars... we had an amazing seat outside right next to the sidewalk on a beautiful day when it was 70 outside. Perfection right? NO!!! There was a HORRIBLE man set up on the sidewalk singing. SO LOUD, my date and I couldnt even hear one another. It absolutely RUINED the entire thing. There are NO WORDS as to how awful this was. We couldnt wait to finish eating and get out. My ears were ringing for an hour afterwards.

r0Ie2KQKvSIy_kc4WK9jMw.text: Burger was well done. Way too hot. It was so done i burnt my mouth. Asked for medium. Artichoke cheese appetizer small. My son's spaghetti and meatballs was lack luster. They did not charge me for hamberger but overall place is expensive a food a three star for they way the sell the place.

W1DtyQEJGjdzi1ZUKJYpCQ.text: HATE  Nothing.  DISLIKE  Hostesses weren't smiling nor were they very welcoming. Kitchen was out of sticky buns which were recommended by server (so maybe a lack of communication).  LIKE  Protein omelet with avocado mousse. Cinnamon roll waffle. Passion fruit margarita. Variety of brunch selection. Friendly server.  LOVE  Location and view of the Bellagio fountains.

oAJKnipRgogKhOSvUhX26g.text: SUCH AN AMAZING BRUNCH! We had the pleasure of having Tracee as our waitress. She kept the mimosas coming, and was such a joy to have us four Senior Spring Breakers happy  10/10 recommend - ask for Tracee as she was spectacular!

ezr2vRZ6QTYZhABNEgjGrw.text: This is one of my most favorite and memorable restaurant!! My boyfriend and I went here for a nice dinner out my 1st time in Vegas and sat by the window that looked out to the water show which was pretty cool to watch! Starting out our sever Steven was amazing a professional enjoyable server, the dirty grey goose martinis were perfect along with out meat and cheese plate to start out with.  Then moved on to and delicious bottle of serra barbaresco 2010 which was delicious! For our entrees I had the shrimp scampi and my boyfriend had the short rib both were fantastic! For sides we had broccoli I really enjoyed my dinner the chef knows what he's doing! To top it off at the end they asked us to sign the bottle to put in up in the ceiling and leave a little of us in Vegas we will let everyone know about this place! Thank you everyone at HEXX

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We enjoyed being HEXXED Himmy (Jimmy and Heather)

aGdwWCiFuMDOAsImj5Wj7w.text: We decided to do a nice dinner on our last night in Vegas at Hexx. I was browsing the groupon deals earlier in the day and I had seen a deal for Hexx. The menu looked pretty good so when it was closer to dinner time, I bought the groupon and we decided to check it out.  It was about 9pm and we were able to sit outside on the patio overlooking the fountains which was nice. Soon after seating the waiter took our drink order and I asked about how I go about applying the groupon. He then told me just to show him my phone when we get our bill. Okay. No problem. But then he goes on to tell me it has to be more than 4 hours since buying the groupon. Well I had maybe bought it about 1-2 hours prior to dinner.  It wasn't a new groupon that had rolled out that same day or anything. I read all the fine print prior to purchasing any groupon out of habit and nowhere does it read that it must be 4 hours before I can use it. I conveyed this information to the waiter who then proceeds to tell me "Oh, I'm SURE it's on there." So at this point I'm a little frustrated/annoyed. I reread the fine print. I was then told it wasn't their policy but groupon's policy. So I was thinking "hmm that's weird" because earlier in the day we purchased the groupon for the Eiffel Tower experience literally 5 min before walking up without issues. And when I read groupon faq's, all it reads is "most Groupons can be used right after purchase, up until the expiration date, but may not be combined with other specials or promos". Again, I was told this 4 hour clause had to be on the site. We'd been walking around all day. We were hungry. So not wanting to wait the 3 hours more, we decided to leave.  I figure since the waiter wasn't very empathetic and guaranteed I had somehow misread the fine print, that I would ask the lady at the door. She told me they had apparently just had a meeting on groupons and this is the information that they had been told but that she would ask a manager for us. To make this part short, the manager came out (who was definitely more understanding) and scanned our groupon and it amazingly worked within maybe an hour and a half of being purchased... Lol. All that trouble?   We were seated back at the same table. It was shift change and we had a super nice waitress (wish I could remember her name). We ordered and everything went pretty smoothly from there on out. We had the spinach and artichoke dip which was about average. I had the shrimp scampi which was pretty good. They were more generous with their shrimp than I was expecting. My boyfriend had the chicken and waffles and ate everything on his plate so I'm assuming he enjoyed his food. His plate was also a decent portion size. He originally ordered the jambalaya and although it was good it was way too spicy for him to eat comfortably. I did feel the food was a little overpriced for the quality but it IS Vegas.   I am glad we had a groupon though. But, I guess I wouldn't have been so put off by the initial service if I didn't have a groupon.   Just be aware and buy your groupon well in advance y'all. It will save you the hassle.

3JQ9cwoV8Sx2BpqlN5GpjA.text: We had a wonderful dining experience at Hexx two nights ago on a quick trip to Vegas.  We ordered the Calamari & Rock Shrimp appetizer and it delicious!  I love that peppers and lemon were also fried  and served with the seafood and the dipping sauce was amazing.  So much flavor!!  My kids ordered the pizza's and they loved them.  My husband and I both ordered a rib eye and it was absolutely perfectly grilled, juicy and flavorful.  The Yukon gold potatoes were crispy on the outside, creamy inside and perfectly seasoned.  It was a great meal with an awesome view of the Bellagio water show and an attentive and friendly staff.

BHar3e7ShaYovgHNfXm42w.text: What's telling about any business is not how it acts when things go as planned; but how it responds when it drops the ball.  Hexx gets a F in this regard.  When I made my reservation that same morning, Hexx said it offered complimentary valet parking for its guests.  When I arrived, the valet said Hexx hadn't updated its website and I would owe $13. After placing my order, I showed the manager on my phone his restaurant's offer and he incorrectly told me that was between me and the hotel.    As a courtesy to him, I called the hotel.  The hotel's response was, appropriately, that the offer was between the restaurant and me. Again, I asked to speak to the manager and told him that the hotel was correct when it said the restaurant was responsible for honoring its contract, and I would deduct the $13 from payment.  He said he would review the listing to see if had any outs such as "subject to change without notice." Seriously!? I couldn't make this up.   Is that really intended for a situation where the restaurant changes its parking policy 45-minutes after someone makes a reservation because of its parking policy?   Sure, if the website had adequate disclaimers, it may have the right to respond "screw you," or similar, to its guests if it would like to.  However, disclaimers are not intended for when less than hour passes between a quoted price and someone accepting it (the stock market excluded).  The waiter returned with a $13 credit on my check since the manager wasn't able to find "subject to change without notice."   ***Note to all restaurateurs: if 45 minutes earlier your website stated a cheaper price for anything (corkage, parking, menu items), and someone makes a decision to dine at your restaurant based on that and comes directly to your restaurant, honor the information on your website.***  An appropriate response would be, "Thank for letting us know.  We'll update our website and, of course, honor that price this time." Any other response serves as litmus test for anyone "serving" at your restaurant.  The food was good but the music was too loud for casual conversation.  Fortunately, I was dining solo.  If I had a guest, I would have found it challenging to converse.  For that reason, and my not needing to assume the risk for any restaurant's mistakes, I would not return.  I have to give 1-star for value because paying for valet parking almost doubles the cost of breakfast for a regular, solo diner.  I suspect using the free parking may make going there take too much time for the everyday diner on his lunch break.  My server, Julio, was great.  The service score reflects my overall experience which, even a truly service-oriented server like Julio, can't overcome significant mishaps from management.

0ak_Z8l5uiICYn-YNtR6pg.text: Came here twice with small groups both times. To be honest the staff here is hit of miss. The first time we had an awesome server who was knowledgeable, on top of everything and we really enjoyed him. The second time we had a different guy and he was awful. He barely greeted us, messed up my friends order and took  forever to get us our drinks, our food, our check, you name it. Too bad because I do like the ambiance here, it is trendy and touristy but also casual. Nice place to go on a date or bring your friends after a night out on the strip.  My favorite things to eat here are the smothered fries, which are normal fries but with cheese, pulled pork and BBQ sauce on top. They were amazing both times I had them. There are more then large enough for one person, or good for multiple people to share. I have also had the hummus here which is different. The chickpeas are not smashed, they are whole and so the hummus us not smooth as one might expect. Still good thought I thought.  Their drinks and chocolates are for sure their top items around here. Their chocolate tastes very different from the normal ones we know in the food store but if you love chocolate or are adventurous then why not try it out? The chocolate reminds me of strong dark chocolate, supposedly with no chemicals or preservatives and man can you taste the difference! I personally didn't like it, but my friends did. Worth a try for sure since they bring some samples around at the end of your meal. Their alcoholic drinks are also worth a try- if you come during the day make sure to look out for their happy hour or drink specials and save yourself a few bucks.

DRixCf4galBA5L731jhZSQ.text: After reading all the positive reviews I decided to check this place out my last morning in vegas and I was not disappointed.  For a casual restaurant the ambience is definitely upscale.  I got the meat omelette and parfait.  The highlight of the meal was the home fries... so good.  The omelette was ok, just too much meat for me and maybe a little over cooked.  But that's just my personal taste, a meat lover would probably love it.  I'd probably try one of the other ones next time.  The yogurt parfait was delish with fresh berries, as was the jam.  Portion sizes are huge and I couldn't even finish my plate.  And the staff is friendly too.

hQqDENZJPcH5usHiKYIzyA.text: Okay so they have a 36 dollar silly cocktail on the menu!  I guess it smokes. Anyway, we went there about 3 in the afternoon and they had several tables on the patio overlooking the strip.  We went in and the hostess said they had an hour wait.  We insisted we be seated and were at a dirty table.  Then it took a long time for the waiter to come and he was kind of rude.  I looked at the menu and they gave me a crappy brunch menu at 3.30 in the afternoon.  We got up and left.  The place was a mess and the staff was unprofessional and rude.  The food is very expensive so I expected better.

O2GdKL3Yy5vKQTt736iYlg.text: Seriously the food is amazing! Unique dish and many traditional items like burgers and pancakes. The breakfast pizza sounded odd at first but gave it a try and so glad we did, it was yummy.

BtiELnra2G0dg0A72ZyVkg.text: We had a wonderful experience here! They quickly sat us and the entire staff was very friendly. Unfortunately, happy hour is bar only (why I'm not giving it 5 stars) but the bartenders and food are top notch. Try the spinach artichoke dip and the brocollini while you're here!

aN9SYMBO17GEniFBugBxSg.text: They should rename this place to "rape" because that is what happens to your wallet when you dine here. Hexx is a crazy name for a Las Vegas strip restaurant anyway so it wouldn't be that much of a stretch.   You're basically paying to sit mid-strip at an okay restaurant. The quality of the dishes does not measure up to the prices charged. $36 for a basic cocktail with Malibu and pineapple, LOL.   I tried some of their $25 burger on a white chocolate bun, it was pretty good but not $25 good. Would have rather had In & Out. Their fries are decent. My son had the margherita pizza, it was pretty good. I also tried their pappardelle  pasta, this is where they failed completely. The noodles were so overcooked that they all stuck together in a gelatinous  blob. Too bad because the sauce and mushrooms were pretty good.  The worst part was the hostess at the Paris entrance was immature and rude. Also, they told us we would have a 15-minute wait and it ended up being 45 minutes. Our waitress was okay but it took a while to get a menu and our drinks.   I was very underwhelmed.

wT3mgxZOqAXlkBvdIsY_DA.text: Great lunch at Hexx. Our waiter, Sean was so friendly and accommodating, even let us move tables midway thru our meal due to sun. Had crab cakes.. and prime rib sandwich.... very tasty and fresh.  Love the location as well

NeWDBSPINtLMuLRN4kiSsg.text: We went for my birthday brunch. It was "so-so" and the drinks were okay. I truly think some places off the strip are better !

fQeuj1uyTri7Y2rzY3-WMg.text: Tracee is sick AF! Bottomless mimosas, gave me 2 hot sauces to choose from and they were all bomb DIGGITY, tracee know what's good! bottomless mimosas comin and the water too baby she  ask for tracee she will take care of you!

i0hgTLrNen60tOvEPr5PmQ.text: Sean was awesome! Bottomless mimosas wee always filled to the brim. We had the soundtrack of a performer on the strip. It was awesome!

8bDJ9PWjRrcOgXJXf1JkQw.text: TAYLORRRRRRRRRRRR also Bobby holy shit go to this place for brunch and ask for one of them. Worth it

pKK2m2TkiLgJJ5SCd8f-Iw.text: Good music, great food, terrific service. I recommend the beautiful and friendly Dominique! Best service I've had on LVB. You can't go wrong, ask for her by name..

4DDS8kFX8IDxEEGFp0H5DQ.text: Best service on the strip and everything tasted as amazing as it sounded!  And the food quality was equivalent to restaurants that are much more expensive- wonderful delicious food at a value price!  And we sat outside on the patio with an awesome view of the Bellagio fountains, great ambience.

fw9W2jdilGFlYamlpObMIg.text: Perfect for a date night or with friends. Brussel sprouts were killer, chopped salad was delicious. Scallops and flat iron were cooked to perfection. You cant go wrong.

8ViYATBLaaLg_GyLJYFmlQ.text: I bought a dinner n show ticket n this place was the restaurant to go to....hostess was going to seat me in sunny area but asked for a diff seat away from sun..got a nice better seat ..i ordered a cocktail..tried the hypnotizing strawberry..deelish! Dinner was a prix fixe menu..several items to choose from..i chose the maryland crab cakes w/lemon aioli..big portions n delicious! My entree i tried the fried chicken n apple cheddar waffles wit bourbon maple syrup topped with sliced, chopped pickles..chicken very tasty..waffles nice n fluffy inside n crispy outside..big portion i could only eat half! But it was yummy! dessert was a single serving box of dark chocolate to take home..i guess they want us to make it in time to the show..which i did..awesome food n service..i will be back!
