w7aYlkTsHIN1B64Cf0u-nA.text: 50 minute wait for our food to come out...a party that came 20 minutes after we ordered got their pizza before I got my salad. On the flip side, the water server topped us off promptly before and throughout our entire meal and the chopped salad was very refreshing and colorful.

D90b8NQgjnwiF7tUagwP-Q.text: My second time dining at the Hexx! Best Sangrias and brunch! If you don't want to wait for seating go and grab a seat at the bar. Full meals here! You won't leave hungry

E3BmJVWN13WJw5n1HUo42w.text: Absolutely love this place . The waiter was super friendly and our drinks never got empty . The food was excellent and the view  as amazing . I definitely recommend this place .

py_ZirOjO7zCgxI_LQggqA.text: Best food and service I've experienced in Las Vegas yet. My Benedict was awesome! The drink in the disco ball was delicious. Rafael is the BEST waiter in Las Vegas!!! It was my sister's 24th birthday and he was so attentive. He truly made sure we had an excellent experience at the restaurant. Highly recommend this restaurant, make sure you ask for RAFAEL!!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zAdJhCIkCGEVKpI4489WDA.text: That man Apollo is the best waiter I ever had. We went around 1130, sat on the patio and it was the best eating experience I ever had. Corned beef hash was delicious.

MU_MfiJDt6lsBQOrAZCATw.text: I've visited this restaurant twice while in las vegas. Both times had good service and well executed, creative meals. I'd be happy to return again.

IRkGJ4HnGy9BausDbyz_ng.text: HEXX is really underrated!  It is seriously good!  It is one of the better restaurants at this price point in Las Vegas.  It is a not just a good, but a great value.  You can usually find a discount to Hexx, and so it is always a good value for Las Vegas.  The view also can't be beat!  You can sit outside if you want, but even from the inside you have a great view of the Bellagio Fountains!!  This time we tried the Cheesy Garlic Bread and it was good, but next time I would try something else.  I had the Filet with Creamed Corn, and I seriously think the Creamed Corn at Hexx is the best I have ever had anywhere!!!  I love it!!  I have also had the Ribeye before, and it was also very good.  The Veal Milanese was huge!!  It was also really, really great.  The Smore's dessert was ok.  I have had the Tiramisu there in the past and that is amazing!  They make it right in front of you with a funky contraption!  So go for the Tiramisu and not the Smore's dessert, you will thank me later.  If you want some really good food with a really good view at a great price go to Hexx.  I try to go there every time I go to Vegas now.  I need to try Brunch next!!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu Contraption!!!
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Milanese!!!
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye!!!

D42DCpdjgFB8q2AtE9RAUQ.text: Love this place. Been here handful of times now. Good food. Great view of the strip. Fun atmosphere, but it is a scene & be seen place. Make sure you make reservations. It's always busy. Pricey, but it's expected, you're on the strip. It's at Paris hotel. Brunch is easily $95 w/mimosas for 2.... I'm sure we'll be back a few more times. Lol

Q2RJA1WK3zfkCDKe0vCSaQ.text: My favorite place to hangout with friends! Great view and such a fun atmosphere!   Thank you to Melody, Ari, and Steven for ALWAYS welcoming me and my friends to this great place!   Keep up the great work and we can't wait to come and hangout again!

DQKCcl29CIHbYvekSdNwPw.text: One of my favorite restaurants in vegas. I come here once a month when I come back into town. Prices are average here for a vegas restaurant. Food quality always comes out good  Last week it got a bit busy for a Sunday and the waiters were probably tired or run down but rest assured one of the bussers "Christian " saved the day. Not only did he go above and beyond to accommodate our table but he was a funny guy. Hope to see this guy as our server in the future

sCZXD4jqgc9_TBlBYUIWkw.text: 5 stars for location. The rest: food, price, customer service, waiters... all deserves 2 stars. My prime rib sandwich is not edible because its beef has a very strong smell. Our waiter disappeared after serving our food and we kept looking for her to refill water. I guess she didn't care when we ordered ice water instead of beers or alcohol.

x7saoHQhu2_rFaf9Dji3ng.text: Good food and good service. I had the scallops and the wild mushroom risotto, and both were off the small plates menu and were excellent. The killer Tiramisu for dessert was my favorite. I can't remember our server's name, but he was funny and efficient! The only complaint I have is that I really wanted the lobster roll but it's not available on the dinner menu :-(

Lo4fVzsuRCVGlYrvjCS22A.text: My husband and I were just walking along the restaurant when we saw 'bottomless mimosas'. We immediately rushed in. It was about 15 minutes for the bottomless mimosas to get over. However, our waitress for the day, Tracy was so sweet that she kept pouring mimosas for us although we were way past the cut off time.   The food was amazing. I had a veggie burger with fries. The burger was excellent. The veggie patty and avocado which came with it was too good (absolutely no words to describe).   My husband however didn't like what he ordered. He ordered for a veggie omelette and looks like they had made the omelette using a cheap version of some oil or they probably used the non-veg oil to make it. It was horrible that he threw away most of it. However the mashed potatoes he got along with it was tasty!  This is a must visit restaurant for an amazing brunch with bottomless mimosas and if the food is not good, you can always tell them and ask them to change it.

QdlfhE-J1hg7j3Ha_gMvyg.text: Seems to be the place to be and food is very good. Service is chaos though. Huge line up while tables sitting empty and unused for way to long. Doesn't look like the servers are interested I giving quick and good service at all.

79O2egB6L6OAXb8cfuiMGw.text: This place is bomb. They encourage you to drink as many mimosas as u can. How lit. Food is good. Pancakes are beautiful. 10/10 would recommend.

a1tYnYH1StH6jthqRMQaww.text: Bar menu hasn't changed for years, same boring items but they carry good cocktail menu.

jhOyamXZ4Ichda8bURwEzg.text: Our punch bowl was weak. We ordered the cheese bread appetizer and it arrived cold. The margarita pizza was just ok. Would not go back.

KjMKqr-1mU8dzccDDrlIbw.text: We came here for brunch and the food was amazing! It was walking distance from where we were staying at and we got seated right away. The environment is extremely clean and you can choose to be seated inside or outside. The outside has a view of the strip and faces the Bellagio hotel. This restaurant serves mainly American style dishes. Next door you can find their chocolate bar to fulfill your sweet tooth.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EW44SCvfXpJKIT3xo_Yt8g.text: We went to Hexx for the first time this past Sunday because I had a family member in town that wanted to eat out on the strip. With 4 out of 5 stars and over 1,000 reviews I expected way more.   It only took about 10 minutes for us to get seated, but over an hour for the four of us to receive our food! The service was very slow and the waitress was very forgetful. We had to literally ask them what was taking so long with our food.... then 10 minutes later we got our order. A group of 10 girls got seated 30 minutes after us and got all their food at the same time we got ours!  Also, we did not order bottomless mimosas, but we still expect our beverages to be refilled every now and then.  I wanted to give only one star for the awful service, but gave two because the food was pretty good. The Hexx benedict was okay (I've had better eggs benedict) but the burgers were good and the carrot cake pancakes were super yum!    All in all, I probably won't be going back. Not impressed. We arrived at 1pm and left at 3pm. It shouldn't take that long to get lunch.

mkj5YlOoc-zWsMyPQhIXzg.text: Great place to have brunch, hands down! Sat at the bar as that's our preference but they have a beautiful area to sit outside as well. Mimosas are bottomless which was well worth the price as they weren't weak by any means. Eggs were perfectly cooked & hubby loved the corned beef hash which came with sweet potatoes instead of regular. Awesome bartender Noah, drinks were never empty for sure & took the the time to answer our "tourist" questions!  They have their own special bloody mary, vodka infused with jalapenos if you enjoy spice!!

N6lPpvkACTDUy9v_gpuOKQ.text: Great location and people viewing but I believe it's more of a $$$ than $$ as far as the price rating. I went here during a work trip & am a little nervous that my expense report will get me in trouble!  Food was very good but not excellent.

WOa9gfRHUVNjTCVjvoI92A.text: Hexx is our go-to breakfast place whenever we're in Vegas. They are on it with the unlimited mimosas, seriously, we never saw the bottom of our glasses (also they aren't stingy with the champagne). The food is amazing, we typically get the cinnaroll waffles, and they never disappoint! Yesterday, I tried the brioche french toast and it was so good! Service is great and both the atmosphere inside and out is comfortable. We will continue coming here every Vegas trip.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unlimited mimosas

8ygfhCpUMWYrw1Bwq0OZkA.text: Definitely a must visit! The pricing alone is worth the visit but the service and food will just exceed each and every one of your expectations! The food was so good that I asked for a Togo box and finished it all before we left. I wanted to go again during our visit but the wait was too long since we had a plane to catch.   Definitely worth the visits for the bottomless mimosas alone!

1jgPOsogvVm2o_n38as3rw.text: Awesome spot for brunch- great selection of food and drinks but also a wonderful patio to sit and enjoy it on. Wonderful to just chill there for a few hours and people watch while you're enjoying a pitcher of some nice, brunching cocktail.   The usual Vegas prices of course, but at least the grub tastes super good!

CPoWySW-1ZUmuJCA6zg90w.text: We came in for brunch. I booked a reservation on OpenTable 40 minutes prior, which was clutch. We arrived ten minutes before our reservation and were seated when our reservation time came up.   We got our water right away and also ordered the bottomless mimosas, which are $24 per person, but soooo worth it, because one mimosa is $12, and the waitress legit kept refilling, even if I took one sip lol. My gurrrrlllll.   I ordered the Hexx Benedict. The portion looks tiny, but it's actually the perfect amount. I love the unique twist on eggs Benedict; it was light and delicious.   Highly recommend this place, especially if you're like me and looking for a tasty but quick brunch. The service has been great and the food is even better!!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hexx Benedict &amp; Bottomless Mimosa

rjZzIBPKzhvNZH1BZFWaRA.text: Food tasted not bad and menu does offer some varieties. Yet service was not that great especially when in the tourist area, I would expect better service.  We didn't make a reservation and walked in but the lady didn't seem to care much. Then our server was not that friendly. He didn't introduce us any menu of the day etc. By the time we paid we used the Vegas dining card and he didn't even bother to hand it back to us directly but hid it with the change which obviously we didn't notice and left it there and of course, we lost the card and couldn't use for the rest of our trip.  The 3 stars are all for the food.

yKIPgYoL9FYseX7rmSUIoQ.text: Hexx is not the answer. Hexx is the question. Yes, is the answer.  My wife and I came to Vegas for a weekend of excitement and stumbled upon some casual Hexx. It all started, like so many Nevada adventures do, with a draft beer (Ballast Point IPA - $11) and ended with both of us satiatied and satisfied. OMG, the Hexx in Vegas is amazing.  My wife discovered the joys of Hexx thanks to Eggs Benedict ($16) with Scalloped Potatoes, Canadian Bacon, and Asparagus. Known as Hexx Benedict, it's a filling meaty combo featuring a pair of big white spheres oozing a tangy sauce.   For me, the Apple Cheddar Waffle and Fried Chicken breakfast ($24) was the perfect afternoon delight of Hexxual satisfaction even though neither was the best I've ever had. It turns out there's no such thing as bad Hexx.  Open 6:00 a.m. to midnight, Hexx is like sleep in Vegas ... you never can get enough ... whether it is Hexx in the morning, Hexx in the afternoon, or Hexx in the evening.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffle with Apple Cheddar Waffle and Fried Chicken - Hexx Kitchen + Bar

vg8y0zYwvqbcHCMZDpz_ZA.text: I passed Hexx many, many times while on the Vegas strip and every time, the patio is full with a line out the door. Finally decided to give Hexx a try for brunch and I was surprised at how great the food and friendly the service was there.  I made a reservation for two via Yelp and upon arriving to the restaurant we were seated within five minutes. We got a seat under the awning by the patio, our waitress greeted and got our orders placed quickly.  We got the Hexx Benedict, Chilaquiles and Carrot Cake Pancakes. Everything came out at a timely manner and both brunch entrees were tasty. The Carrot Cake Pancakes were probably my favorite. It came with four fluffy stacks with a dollop of cream cheese and sprinkled with chopped pecans.   Hexx is the perfect location for brunch and will be coming back to try other dishes. If you're lucky to get a spot on the patio, you'll get a great view of the Bellagio and maybe even a water show. Highly recommend getting reservations!

9IxdDFSKhocTzaBSY2YYiQ.text: Best chicken and waffles you'll EVER have. Unique and tasty drinks. Service is great. Must be patient when getting seated. They are busy. I've never waited more than 30 on a busy day though. Love the location!

edYIiGXgsV7TBegVyrQEHg.text: This was my favorite spot in Vegas for breakfast/brunch that we checked out! The location is perfect, right on the strip. If you plan on going and want to sit outside it will be at least a 20-30 minute wait!  What we ordered:  Sticky bun, my favorite part of breakfast. Had a cream cheese filling that was sooo good! Must get this to start if you have a sweet tooth.  Eggs Benedict- also so good. Instead of having an English muffin it had a cheese potato on the bottom that was perfect. I'm an eggs Benedict snob and this place did not disappoint! Must try this one too! :)  Carrot cake pancakes - also really good but was kind of full when we got to these. If I had to choose I'd still get the sticky bun over these pancakes.

4Du_lbRpFKdQg9MNrCd2Iw.text: Best chicken & waffles that I've ever had. Conveniently centrally located across from Bellagio. I got a table on the patio to people watch. I could have stayed for hours. The food is excellent.

lFiITalEB5-OF6X7qOHuoA.text: We had both dinner and breakfast at HEXX Kitchen & Bar, and both were great, although we enjoyed the dinner a lot more!  I started with the Barrel Aged, which is an old fashioned but with hazelnut infused whiskey.  So different and so delicious that I had a 2nd one!  For my appetizer, I ordered the shrimp ceviche, which was fresh and tasty!  Followed by the 8 oz filet medium rare.  The steak was cooked to perfection and melt in your mouth delicious!    We had reservations that were early enough that we had the option to dine inside or outside, but the day we ate at HEXX, it was 107 degrees outside, so too hot to eat on the patio.  Service was great, so we will definitely be back!

vVqN3qEhHlP3kdA6CPGQow.text: Awesome place for brunch - plus they have $24 bottomless mimosas & the champs is actually good!!!! I personally enjoyed the Bloody Mary which was so good but was bummed because they're removing the one with carrot juice & cucumber vodka so we couldn't get it.   I split their shrimp salad and it was so delicious! Tried my friends potatoes which were also amazing and their chilaquiles, wow! Highly recommend the chilaquiles. Also tried their sausage, egg & bacon pizza and surprisingly lived it. Plus there was plenty to take back to the hotel!   Overall, definitely recommend. The view, staff and food is great even when accommodating large parties.

4FiTvyzM_jlY3YS_xlVFyA.text: One of our favorite spots on the strip for brunch. Excellent chicken and waffles. Excellent cocktail menu and atmosphere

6U0ZXiZTzJjFIbbi1SE8jQ.text: I had dinner and brunch here in the same day. The bottomless brunch was great they really keep the drinks coming. For brunch it was very filling. I had eggs, bacon and English muffin. Fresh and big serving.  For dinner I had Shrimp Ceviche. Probably the best shrimp ceviche ever. It had a hint of spice and an avocado sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. shrimp Ceviche

MlkO3WyftDz6cbQy6Je23A.text: Let's face it. If your reading this your looking for a good breakfast/brunch spot in Las Vegas. You have a long day ahead of you, and you need to build a hood base for the day! Hexx will be your foundation! Service 5 star, food 5 star, quantity's 5 star, atmosphere 5 stars.   I recommend sitting outside if the weather is right. It makes for some great people watching while you eat.   Excellent!!

KhaRPZRXHIh57DPxYNTK1A.text: This was great for brunch!  It was early enough to eat on the patio, even though it was hot they leave the restaurant doors open and the air conditioner helps! I had the eggs Benedict and it was amazing!  It did not disappoint!  I also had the sunshine xxpress drink, it is a nice mango drink, so refreshing and not too sweet!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hexx Eggs Benedict
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunrise xxpress

vqTiTlRdWWxVbFBj5GBbKg.text: Great place to eat and listen to music. Service was amazing. Thanks Alex. Great view. Bellagio is directly across the street where you can see the water show.

HBr0zJu4MORLyUzCKN_Mqw.text: Went for Dinner and we were extremely satisfied (especially compared to night before at a celebrity chef's restaurant at Caesars).  Service, Food, Atmosphere all excellent.  We had Shrimp Cocktail, Rib Eye, Carbonara, Creme Brulee, wine and coffee.  Everything was delicious.  Almost $200 w/ tip for two, but we left satisfied and excited to have a great meal.

nwMrj4Fp7ADfrmcDGfkh-Q.text: Our initial server was good and he kept my mate's endless mimosa well topped up.  However,  although we specified food restrictions and were assured it would be observed...a huge piece of bacon on our omelette was not cool. Maybe the kitchen was off.  The carrot cake pancakes were just ok, sugary mostly. The beef brisket sandwich tasted weird, I discreetly spat it out but my buddy had to line her stomach.  It was a good spot to people watch and check out the Bellagio fountains though. Maybe come for the location but not for the food.

FmsMP3RUJvNlu28uQMc5fQ.text: Beautiful, Clean restaurant with great view of Bellagio's fountains. Me and my husband went for breakfast in the morning and I loved the fact that we were seated right away. I ordered Turkey sandwich and my husband ordered omelette. After 20 minuets the supervisor came up to us and said that they did not have our order in kitchen but they have it now and they are working on it. Our server was very polite and did everything possible to accommodate us until food comes. When the food finally came it was delicious. We asked for the check and when he brought us the check he said that they restaurant gave us discount because our food was late. It was very nice of them to do that, because usually restaurants would say sorry kitchen is busy and it's coming up, but they were honest about it. I would definitely dine here again when I go Vegas next

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FLauIq_A-bBJijhOouA4WA.text: 3.75 stars  Popped in to HEXX for brunch, and it was enjoyable though nothing overwhelmingly special. We were fortunate to get a table pretty quickly on a Sunday afternoon, and we admittedly were in a bit of a rush because my sister-in-law had to catch a flight within a few hours. But they were willing to take us and we were staying in that very hotel, so it made for an easy and convenient option.   The service was fine but could have been better; the staff clearly had a lot on their plates, and while they were friendly, they were probably a bit stretched. There was a bit of a miscommunication regarding my sister-in-law's meal that resulted in her missing out on an ingredient that was supposed to be included in her dish (chilaquiles) and that she had really wanted, but ended up not getting due to the mix-up.   Otherwise, the food was definitely solid. I ordered the veggie omelette and it was quite enjoyable, with good depth of flavor. Sides included potatoes, which were fine, and an english muffin, which actually had an unusual but interesting texture. The meal certainly filled me up for a good chunk of the day, so that was appreciated. My husband ordered the veggie burger, and I was impressed to see that they made their own. While it did not hold up well in terms of composition (as in it fell apart easily and ended up being eaten with a fork), it was delicious in terms of flavor.   Enjoyable and well worth the visit, particularly for a filling and simple brunch after a lot of perhaps other excessive Vegas meals. Solid option for folks looking for an easy place to dine along the Strip.

lfLYqd85Gp4gfY8we19ZRw.text: Came here with my homegirl for brunch while visiting Vegas for the first time! I'm always looking for great food with great custom service and yummy drinks! This place has all three! Brunch was so good! We had spinach dip for starters. It was delish! Bottomless mimosas were a hit of course! And the chicken and waffles were great as well. The atmosphere was real chill. One of the waitresses were dancing to Beyonce and hyping everyone up in her sections. Lol! We even tried to get our mimosas to the bottom to see how fast our waitress would come fill them back up.. she beat us every time! I highly recommend this spot! I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked spinach dip
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottomless mimosas!!

ZDR50KNmhFUN2BJNEfrm-g.text: This restaurant is in front of the Paris Casino and has a great ambiance.  It is very updated and is very open.  They have outdoor and indoor seating, but the way they have the restaurant set up it has the feel of covered outdoor seating.  The wait staff were cordial but very busy and therefore we had to wait a long time for everything (like coffee refills :-\ ).  We had the corned beef hash (a very small portion), the Farm Fresh Eggs with a side of bacon, and coffee.  Although the portion was small the corned beef was good, and so were the farm fresh eggs and bacon.  I think the coffee was the best part of the meal, but like I said we had to wait for it.    If you do not want to wait, they do take reservations, which we recommend.  Overall, although this wasn't our best experience we would still recommend it for those that are already close by.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s3v6WMRoD0j5tHJKfHzrvg.text: The first time I visited was the sweet shop. The ice cream and cookies were both great!  My second visit was the restaurant. Two of us split the charcuterie plate and the short rib. We had great service and the food was excellent.   It's a pretty busy place, but we didn't have any issues being seated without reservations. They have both indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor has some great people watching.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KkQGtkC-UITY9sL7Po0i7Q.text: Unbelievably tender medium well New York Strip. The service was 5-Star. I'm sad to learn this is the ONLY location in the world, but hey it's Vegas and HEXX IS another AWESOME reason to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wetting my whistle before the steak.

NGvoB9eet8qR2sf7pLCN3Q.text: The restaurant was empty inside when we arrived, very full on the patio.  The wait was 50 minutes outside but 25 minutes inside.  We said inside was fine.  They pointed us to the bar area.  We could sit anywhere and hang out.  They had nifty little private alcoves.  The restaurant is beautiful.    The menus are not grammatically correct.  Normally neither am I!  I went up to the bar to get a drink.  I asked for the Desert Smash without rosemary agave and asked if I could get it with regular agave.  Pretty sure I asked nicely, but the bartender bit my head off and told me it wasn't rosemary agave.  It was rosemary AND agave in the drink.  Oh okay - the menu was missing a comma.  Maybe they were really understaffed.  Maybe she was having a bad day.  Maybe she has to answer queries about rosemary agave all day everyday... She never warmed up to me.  Maybe my Vegas hair was too big for her liking.  We did eventually get a table after a long wait.  Outside.  The interior remained empty.  It is very nice on the patio and we were fine to be outside.  The food was very tasty, though it too took a long time to arrive.  The oddest thing, other than the grumpy bartender, was we were close to a POS station with glassware.  A few waiter/waitress were taking care of business and a glass fell and shattered by an occupied table.  The wait staff just finished up their business before checking on the affected patrons.  That seemed weird.  They could have been cut or gotten glass on them.  Seemed very uncaring not to check on them immediately.  Great location, people watching, food/bev, but oddly uncaring service.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H6aDePfghzlEp1a23Xqssw.text: We are waiting for the check at this restaurant and while the service was outstanding the food wasn't as good. I had the lobster and short ribs sliders. The taste was good but the short rib was at least half fat. My family had the pancakes and said they were over cooked. We all had the berry bowl and that we VERY delicious! Would we eat here again?? With the Groupon probably.

e1lDKIyKrXm-3nkcFRGArw.text: Great time at brunch! Drinks were flowing, food was cooked to perfection and plated with care. Servers worked together and made jokes to keep things fresh. Left a 100% tip! Great experience! Will be back again soon!

lXJ14q1rmkfDwYr3V_wWdA.text: The carrot cake pancakes and brioche French toast are amazing! They have bottomless mimosas daily until 2p which is always a plus!!!! They quoted us 25 mins and we only waited 15!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

obf4r62-1kfWt-hk1e4lfg.text: Great place for bunch. Apollo and Edgar were amazing, best servers ever!!!! Bottomless mimosas, fantastic food, and great service. Highly recommend this restaurant and these servers for anyone looking for a good brunch in Vegas!

wUJJCrOu_pxhbQ4kgD_A5w.text: Located at the Paris hotel right by the Eiffel Tower, Hexx kitchen is a great place to go for brunch. I was here with a couple of friends, and we ordered mimosas. Can't go wrong with OJ and champagne!  It has a patio outside where it is great to do people watching. There are a bajillion of people walking on the strip. You're bound to see something interesting.. or maybe it was just the alcohol? Nonetheless, this place has an enjoyable ambiance surrounding it and the service was great. The food was good. I took a bite of my friends pancakes which were fluffy and good.

vzwyJOzO-640XyAgBso5jg.text: Audrey was absolutely the best server ever. She took wonderful care of us and made my friends birthday memorable !

png-hKWSeG57hCKjtwDQFA.text: This place was awesome! We went for brunch and the atmosphere was great. Right on the strip so you can people watch. Even get some glimpses of the fountain show at the Bellagio. The food was delicious. JJ was our server and he was on top of everything. We had bottomless mimosas and they are not kidding, you never even get close to the bottom. Highly recommend.

NbRvwGl-N1zIGcRFPh57gw.text: Absolutely delicious and awesome experience. My husband and I came for Easter Brunch. We had reservations so we're able to avoid the crazy line. I ordered the chicken and waffles and he got the corned beef hash. And we double down in the bottomless mimosas. Food was quick and soooo good-- flavorful, prepared well, and plated beautifully. The service was sensational. Our glasses were never empty and our waitress, Aubree, checked in on us regularly and was a pleasure! Views were awesome and we caught the Fountains at Bellagio a couple of times-- a major bonus! We'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles  Corned beef hash

s2NSsCI-seMlRy7ah_3Ixg.text: Me and my hubby came here for brunch Friday Morning liked the atmosphere of being inside but being able to people watch everyone passing on the Strip. My husband ordered the fruit platter and I the Chilaquiles I had coffee and he a Bloody Mary and were not disappointed the staff was tentative and absolutely delightful, we loved everything so much we came back that same night to have dinner and again were blown away with the service and food, my husband had the ribeye and me the filet with the smoked blue cheese crust and a side of brussel sprouts, I ordered the Mint Cucumber Mojito delicious I drank it down fast, and my husband really enjoyed the Bloody Mary again. After Dinner it was time for dessert our waiter let us know a few of his favorites and I went right for the blueberry corn cobbler the hot cobbler with cold vanilla ice cream and crumb and freeze dried corn absolutely delicious. If your in Vegas and want a great place to eat definitely try out HEXX. When we come back we know will be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye Steak
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry corn cobbler!!
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Calamari with buffalo and ranch delicious!

_eNvhwTRuSJkSWUI3c2xPw.text: Worst experience I've ever had by any establishment in my life. This is clearly no mastros when it comes to service. I visited this place for my birthday weekend and had a pretty ok time I think our party of 8 saw a server about 4 times. Fast forward to receiving the check it took our server 20 to get to us just so we could tell him and another 20 min to come back. When our server finally gets to us he then tells my husband his card declined which was odd ( clearly there was money on the card). After giving the server cash he comes back with the same amount of cash and a receipt for ya to sign from the card that was "declined". After signing we start to leave and decide to call the bank  for transactions to see why it was declined. After 5 min we get through and see the payment went through the first time the server swiped and 4 times after that that he swiped. To our surprise we had payed for our food and drinks 5 times. Our bank assured us that the payments were not declined that they asked for customer authorization. Anyone who has WELLS FARGO knows it's as simple as texting Wells Fargo yes (which we did). After learning this we then requested to speak to a manager and again to our surprise he already knew why my husband and I were pretty pissed.   We were shocked that "Christian" the head manager had a attitude with us before we even explain to him what happened. He never apologized or took responsibility he simply acknowledged that he was the one present while the server swiped the card multiple times. At that point we realized not even the manager had common sense to say hey STOP SWIPING just go see if they authorized the payment. Before we could even get out what the procedure was he threw his hand in our face and attempted to call security. My husband and I are not in the business of embarrassing ourselves in public and starting a scene we have children and businesses so we were really taken back at the type of behavior this manager displayed. Another manager I believe Ari stepped in and can I say his attitude was the complete opposite he was apologetic and wasn't the least but dismissive of there mistake.  Btw can I add Christian attempted to call the police on us. I've never been in a racist situation but if this was it I defiantly felt it.   NEVER IN LIFE WILL I EVER STEP FOOT IN HERE AGAIN.

ujx83W0hpKanMjfuFdlH0g.text: Went to Vegas for the weekend with some friends. My friend from home always talked about this place called Hexx... just happened be right outside of our hotel. We went for drinks the first day and tried one of the potion drinks. It was super sweet. Great for the insta, not worth the money though.   Two days later we needed food AND drinks. We sat down and waited for about 20 minutes. Our waiter kept walking past saying I'll be right back. Not gonna lie, we were thinking about leaving. THANK GOODNESS we didn't. Sean was triple sat right as we walked in, hence the long wait. Once he could get to us, he was the best! Him and his helper Josh never let our bottomless mimosas get even half empty. Very attentive and helpful with the menu. He was willing to take a picture of the group, followed by a selfie with him! One of the best waiters I've had in a while. Very personable.  The food was great too! The turkey club was amazing. 3 of the 4 of us had it. The 4th had the chicken and waffles with the bourbon syrup. As a KY girl, I enjoyed it! It was a perfect mixture of sweet and savory.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey club was amazing!!
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our waiter Sean was the best!

I0zkxw9Rlpind731dpAzrg.text: The food is great here (breakfast)except for the pancakes! The pancakes are pretty thick and no flavor (regular). Everything else was good. Service was OK I just didn't like that they put your silverware on the table and straws are unwrapped. Other than that i will return again

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q3hfPTldydm_GQANkdUplg.text: Loved the food the servers recommended! They definitely did not steer us in the wrong direction! I'm a brunch person, so I know brunch. And this place was spot on delicious! The carrot cake pancakes, superb! Did not need syrup, all was needed was the whipped cream cheese frosting, it was not too sweet and not too bland, just perfect. The corned beef hash, they used sweet potatoes instead of regular potatoes, that made all the difference, total game changer! Though it would of been better if it came with a side of toast or English muffin. Overall, the service was great, food was great. Definitely coming back here again next time! I prefer outdoor seating just because it is quite loud inside and a little stuffy. The servers really do go above and beyond their job duties.

k53nCOqR-EiWCqSbPcNfdA.text: Let's be honest, I found this place after the most recent Jersey Shore- Vegas episode. We were lucky enough to be able to going to the following weekend so we decided to give this place a try.   We sat on the patio which sits right on the strip across from the Bellagio, so you are able to watch the fountains while enjoying brunch.  We both tried the Hexx Benedict and it was amazing. A smart twist on a classic with the variation of thin sliced potatoes instead of an English muffin. I would definitely go back the next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9Gb0nK1Sguo7JHWILSt9xw.text: Love that this place is open late. This last trip to Vegas, I was actually surprised to learn how hard it is to find a good restaurant open past 10:30.   We had the surf and turf sliders and shrimp ceviche to start.  The sliders were on brioche so that's always great, but the lobster flavor was covered by the short rib so I wouldn't get these again.  The shrimp ceviche, however, was amazing.  Large portion.  A lot of spiciness though and there's nothing on the menu to tell you it might be spicy, much less that it will be very spicy.    We also got the cheesy garlic bread and the pasta carbonara.  The bread looked great, but was very meh.  The carbonara was amazing.  So, come here late night and def get the shrimp ceviche and carbonara.

2geLncFfNsicj5a3RuF4gw.text: What a great experience we had here. It all started with our server Mike. Super attentive and very welcoming. My husband showed up at the table first and let Mike know we were celebrating my dads 70th birthday and we had my aunt and uncle surprising him. Once we all were there he introduced himself and welcomed all of us for the celebration. We ordered a Purple Haze that he suggested. I wasn't a big fan of it. It kind of tasted like medicine to me but I'm also not much of a drinker. But everyone else at the table liked it. We got some calamari and the meat and cheese plate. Both very tasty. We later ordered our dinner. I was very pleased with my spaghetti carbonara. I tried my aunts filet mignon and that was very tender and flavorful. My husband had the braised short rib. Very good as well. All in all Mike took care of topping off our waters and assuring we had a great experience. Brought out a little birthday treat for my dad. Thanks again Mike for outstanding service. We will see you on our next trip out!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp cocktail appetizer
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised Short Rib
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti Carbonara no peas

4gIhDdKhcbqMihCQIGlxlA.text: Just finished our meal here. Alexia (spell check) went above and beyond for us. We ordered a veggie pizza with pepperoni and bacon as add ons and it was delicious!! Alexia was really friendly and attentive. She made sure everything was great for us. I really loved the brussel sprouts on the pizza, it works really well. We'll be eating the leftovers later tonight. Btw this place has fabulous views of the fountain.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zKuUAfyAn7iD2h_ErvOq3Q.text: This was a wonderful spot for brunch when we went on a Thursday morning. It's located on the strip in the Paris casino. We were able to walk right in and get a table. The service was quick and very professional and polite. I had a traditional breakfast with eggs, bacon, homemade English muffin (made in house) and potatoes. Even though that's a basic breakfast, it was done better than most breakfast places I've been to. It was exactly what I wanted. My friend got the corned beef hash and loved it. It's Vegas, so be prepared to spend a little more than what you'd expect for what you're getting. However, I didn't mind at all based on the good food and good service!  Also, if you're in the mood, they have bottomless mimosas for $24. That's a pretty good deal for Vegas, where most mixed drinks will set you back $15 or more!

kYz_yiZKUTt3onpk9p5-YQ.text: This place has some great breakfast options and service is very good. Inside Paris hotel it is easy to get a seat without a reservation. Outside patio faces the Bellagio fountains. BONUS! They have a Groupon $30 for $50 which was a great in the moment find while reading Yelp reviews. The pancakes and parfait were very good. Portions are very large.... so sharing is good. The sticky bun was too much and very sweet. Also the mimosa was average. With the Groupon it was totally worth the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buttermilk Pancakes
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parfait

W574uG43TObcaHmL66-GGg.text: Compared to our amazing breakfast day 1 at the Henry, Hexx was just average. Was nothing special when it came to the food, I could had made it better myself at home.

zB-MWcqE6aKPhB-HUPTnug.text: Busy place but we got right in around 10am. Server seemed irritated at first but warmed up to our fun group. Food was delicious! Had the carrot cake pancakes, waffles, ham and cheese croissant!  Bloody Mary was too spicy and I ordered the weakest one. Bottomless mimosa's for two hours on Saturday, not sure about the rest of the time.

13NbdmTNtWLJ_qUO2AcOdA.text: Great food, great environment! We arrived at 11am and waited approximately 30 minutes to be seated for a party of 2. Our server was very knowledgeable and made sure we enjoyed our meal. We were seated in the patio and I loved their 90s music playlist. I ordered the chicken and waffles, and a "desert smash" -both were very good.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chickens &amp; waffles
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Desert Smash&#34; - bulldog gin, fresh blackberries, rosemary, agave, &amp; fresh lime juice

A_LTtmRKGadDxMkEYqBOkA.text: Ok so I can't say enough about Steven and Ivan!! The food awesome!  Service unbelievable!  Birthday mission accomplished!

qL_q3PjWumVJUASU9gvPwg.text: Came to try one thing and one thing only... the colossal Bloody Mary.  For $38 some odd dollars it's not bad... it was about half-pitcher (easily shared between two people)... it had crab, olives, and bacon. I was disappointed that there were no pickled vegetables as was advertised. The flavored vodka wasn't my favorite and I must say I prefer a more basic vodka that is doctored up with spices and sauce. Service wasn't bad at all and it was nice to sit outside and people watch. The food on the menu looked alright but nothing stood out enough to try as we had dinner plans. Definitely somewhere to try once for their extravagant items but be prepared for the price.

xBsvWYx3yzoO31egVXTwfA.text: So we just had our first visit to Hexx located on the Las Vegas strip. The food was ok but our waitress,Eva Marie must have been having a very bad day. She was so rude! We will probably go back at some point but will never sit in her section again.

UQqfd2tHruQbk0FGvuQr6Q.text: OMG let me start off by saying that their menu has the largest variety of dishes. Anything you're in the mood for is probably on their menu. I ordered the eggs Benedict and a veggie omelette with potatoes , since it was breakfast time. The food is great, the atmosphere was amazing and the servers were really friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q9nLjmBOZEC_08-2TOh_1g.text: Came here from brunch. We had Apolo as our server. He was super helpful. Would definitely come back just to see him!!

uzwx6RzQ84mEs33leQUX1g.text: Loved this place. The meat and cheese platter was delicious - very filling. Staff were beyond great - the servers were so kind. Definitely will be back

XhDrhL7hvOWkKq2lIeiZvA.text: I recently purchased a Groupon for this place and I can't wait to purchase another one.   We went during brunch and ordered calamari to start, then had the chiliqullis and ended with dessert. I was pleasantly surprised with the service and the food.   The view overlooks the bellagio fountains and the pricing was not bad at all. They have the smoking drinks similar to Sugar Factory, endless mimosas and other menu items. I want to come back and eat at brunch again.

DxqqL54KyOJVtqUfn2T6eg.text: Went here for my daughters 25th bday. We had a large party. The service was good however the food was very disappointing. I found a staple on my food and my father had a long hair in his sausage. To say our appetite was ruined is an understatement. The server did her best to handle the situation but would have thought a manager would have addressed the issue. A staple in food is no laughing matter!   Don't think I will ever go back. Word to the wise look st your food before you eat it!

tsw-C0ogLMI9f50fvUzAGA.text: After a poor dining experience, the next day I called Hexx and spoke with the real general manager, Melody. Melody was kind, listened to my concerns, and apologized. She asked if we could come back and give Hexx another chance. My friends and I were tentative (since our past experience was so awful); but we returned to Hexx for brunch and our experience was AMAZING! Our waiter, Enrique, was attentive, helpful and friendly. He checked in on us frequently and made us feel welcome. The food was good, portions are huge and very reasonably priced.  I ordered the veggie omlet and it is definitely large enough to feed two. The ambience is casual and calm. The restaurant was crowded but our food and drinks came out quickly. If you're looking for a tasty and reasonably priced  brunch, I highly recommend Hexx!  We will definitely come back to Hexx next time we're in Vegas!  Tip: brunch is from 5am-2pm on weekends. We went at noon on a Sunday and I'm glad we had a reservation because Hexx was crowded.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c4_l3mcvVtiF68N5bIhCig.text: Omggg I had an awesome brunch at Hexx over the weekend. The food, service and just overall ambience was just perfect. I ordered the chicken and waffles and the Desert Smash cocktail. That dang chicken and waffles was so flavorful and hearty. It is not for the I'm not that hungry person, be ready to grub! The Desert Smash was great, I needed a little extra agave, then it was spectacular! The music was good and our waiter was on it!! I will visit Hexx every time I'm in Vegas!

2vvbvT4r-iJh26v7gMZq6Q.text: I had the greatest service here last week, I wish I could remember my servers name because he was awesome at accommodating my vegan requests! My step son turned 21 and of course, in True LV fashion we had to start the day off with bottomless mimosas and brunch. Our server did a great job at making sure we never had an empty glass, as well as plenty of water. He verified with the kitchen what items we could order that were vegan (breakfast potatoes with no cheese and a bowl of fresh fruit - we added a side of avocado as well to round out the meal). My step son ordered the Benedict and he loved it! Our server didn't complain when I showed him our Groupon - (they have a great deal right now for hexx) and we left here happy, and full. This place makes amazing breakfast potatoes, I used to love them with two over medium eggs before we went vegan, and I'm happy I can still enjoy them sans the huevos.

6deigubV9qC1FnlYSUTkbA.text: Love the ambiance and the happy hour menu Is reasonable.  Have been there a few times and plan to return.

jikXYgExL4YJ0Lh_-4251g.text: Tracee was our server.  She was personable without being intrusive.  She had a great disposition and seamlessly interacted with our family, sharing her favorite menu items as well as witty quips from her son's time playing competitive sports to encourage our son to play well in the tournament.  The chicken and waffles were the truth!  #thatsryuptho #yaaassssss

Sm9NheJvJkUJpDHz8MmIcw.text: Mother's Day is always a challenge at restaurants but a surprisingly positive experience. Portions a little small. The noise level, however, is out of control and the background music makes it even worse!  Bathrooms are in the casino like so many casino restaurants.  Service terrific - Natalie!  Quite frankly,  it would have been a near perfect experience if not for the noise!

gkG9TDxcP18YvxTSj_V4Bg.text: Absolutely the worst service ever. No drinks after 25 minutes. Had to go to bar and get our own. Then got billed for them after paying at the he bar. Jason, a manager was rude, disrespectful and arrogant. Worst service, mediocre food. Gave us a hard time for THEIR bad service.

nszJLkuWHU6qIfrYKwHtfQ.text: There were two people who knew what they were doing at this trendy resto in Vegas on our recent visit. The lady behind the reservation computer and the bartender. Everything else was chaos. More than half of the tables were empty yet they claimed a 45 min wait for brunch on a Saturday. We said find and ordered a cocktail to enjoy during our wait. We were actually seated very quickly but in a table in the connecting space between the two outside seating areas that was very windy and cold. We took the table and placed our order but after freezing for a few minutes asked to be moved to one of the empty tables either further in or out but not in the wind tunnel in between. Again we were told nothing was available,. Seriously at this time there was no line and more than half the tables were empty. We let them know to cancel our order and walked out. Clueless would be a complement here. Aside from the nice view of the fountains at Bellagio across the street I can think of no reason to go here. We walked to Mon Ami Gabi 100 yards across the entrance to Paris Paris and had such a lovely meal and great service that we returned 3 more times there during this trip. Don't waste your time or money here at Hexx.

TBKotlgg4G4KriF00HdOqA.text: We were a bunch of friends spending the weekend in Vegas. We couldn't get a table at Gordon Burgers and ended up in this place.The food was pretty good &  I wanted to specially call out Joshua for his amazing service.

Iup_kI4F_wGzzQ98kcteug.text: I came to this bar with a large party and we were taken care of  very well. Apollo was an amazing server! Highly recommend!!

VWUVglK0_X_T1BQMLssCEw.text: I loved this place. Came here with a couple other hungry girls for brunch. We had no reservations and had to wait abt 20 mins.  Once seated the place is open, loud, and busy. The mimosas were delish. We pretty much enjoyed all our food. What I wasn't expecting was how surprisingly their fruit salad was...it real good! I was expecting a typical fruit medley but this salad was big and each bite of fruit was sweet and perfectly ripe!  Our server was great too. She was friendly and attentive. I'd come back here.

x533rQxVYeli3z_xRRLCbg.text: Unbelievable experience. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Derek saw my wife drop her knife and he immediately came with a new one before we could even ask for one. I am very impressed with the work ethic and environment of this restaurant. The food was cooked to absolute perfection, I applaud the kitchen staff for their execution. Thank you to everyone especially Derek for making this experience special for us.

8xJOhL07OuikCpZJ_6PEbg.text: Amazing brunch and atmosphere! Beautiful decor but slow service. The typical Strip curse of convenience, expensive and poor service.

b6JtffjHIB0XByEFdigryg.text: Went for the location on the strip & outside seating. Great server. The food was good. Not extraordinary but good. Would go back for the spinach artichoke dip. Limited menu selection was a negative for me.

-TRVvGevOyt4VnFxThPpPw.text: Amazing eggs Benedict! Can't beat endless mimosas while watching the strip walking by.

GCKlfPCiOCDqU5sqCqM9zw.text: I first checked this place out on Yelp and the pictures of the food didn't look appealing to me and people complained about the service. I said what the hell let me try for myself and see how it goes. So Hubby and I and another couple went and we had a good time. The service was great and so was the food. We ordered the maple glazed bacon for an appetizer. It was really good. It was thick cuts of bacon more on the line of small cuts of pork belly. Hubby ordered the Hex burger with white chocolate bun with fries. I ordered the club sandwich with herb aioli and cranberry bread. It was so delicious. Our friends ordered a meat omelette and Hex burger also. Everyone was pleased with their food. When we are in Vegas we will be back

aSYIyi89KbQoAIrJYlba7A.text: TRACEE IS THE LITTEST WAITER EVER. Made sure my girls 21st was fun and one to remember. Not only was she so nice and funny and accommodating , the food was sooo good. Bottomless mimosas so yummy too. Overall this place is a must to visit in Vegas for brunch, or dinner.

2dGpY-znEFLqsxPnw_qc_g.text: Had the Veggie omelette with fried potatoes and an English muffin and it was good. Veggies were fresh ~spinach, peppers, onions, mushrooms.. Seats are very uncomfortable though! While there is construction going on in the restaurant there is NO hot chocolate! So bummed! I would have gone to Serendipity across the street if I would have know before I was seated.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Omelette, fried potatoes and English muffin.

S-d82RBhYKqua2MclNh8dg.text: Tracee and CeCe are the best servers ever ! They were so attentive and sweet, on our last day the best choice was to come to hexx and have them as our servers ! When I come back to Vegas they will the first people I visit!!

4QZmf8FC3tB11vgy5pCUJQ.text: Great service, our server (Britt) was amazing and patient with us as we had to add 2 more people half way through the meal. She moved in an extra table for us.   Their specials for drinks are delicious! We shared the Jungle Juice, between 4 people. It definitely is a creeper. I had the pork hash and shared it with my boyfriend, thankfully. Small dish but heavy with the meat and potatoes (good for hangovers). My friends has the chilequiles and loved it - a bit spicy tho.  I will have to say it's a little pricey but it's Vegas, lol. Share as the plates are filling.

oLLeDFgwSZIDjwTE19PqSg.text: The service at this place was beyond fantastic- so glad we chose Hexx for my birthday dinner! We ordered one of the pitchers of cocktails that came with dry ice so it looked like its was smoking and it was so delicious! Then they brought us a free pitcher of a different flavored steaming cocktail because it was my birthday!!! Loved that!! The manager also came to our table twice to ensure that our meal was good and wished me a happy birthday which I thought was very nice.   All of the food we had was delicious but j must say the dessert and the cocktails were the best part. We got the mocha espresso flourless chocolate cake and a chocolate ice cream sundae and both were phenomenal!   From the outdoor seating area you can see the bellagio fountain show across the street which is a must see when in Vegas! I thought the prices were very reasonable for the location. I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone visiting Las Vegas!

3ohEYqCTkeXRxSOTHyN4UA.text: This place is a bit overpriced for the quality, service was lackluster. I had the Hexx burger which was not bad, the patty seemed like it may have come out of a freezer, but tasted good. Just too perfectly round. A little weird. Also, they charge a cnf. Concession fee for being on the strip. Something like 5% added to your bill. Manager said the owners charge it because of how expensive it is to run a business on the strip. Also, it's a decent view of the Bellagio fountains, however it is very, very loud because it is an open environment. I would not go back. Many better options here in Vegas. Try Giada's at Cromwell instead.

hFK6IgGmxdokbg_KNvLl1Q.text: Roman is the best waiter you can get at 3AM on the strip. The banana sundae was amazing. Service was great.

XWQrtd8yitEStiIw8ylUjg.text: The Hibiscus tea cooler which was good and very refreshing. The sweet lady with purple lipstick was very nice and offered us a free cookie that perfectly compliments our drink.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Hibiscus tea cooler which was good and very refreshing.

87mdY_KVcKeQ4fkKnkBDkw.text: Stopped by here for a drink and maybe a an appetizer. Our server alexia sold us on an entire meal and I'm so happy she did! The crispy broccolini was amazing! It was light crisp and full of flavor. Me and my boyfriend shared the burger and finished off with the bake sell, which was my personal favorite. All of her recommendations were excellent. She was very informed on the menu and genuinely excited to serve us. Can't wait to come back, hopefully we can get alexia as our server again.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bake sell! Deeelish.

lIwPVvEwB2uB0RF9b47GFA.text: We really enjoyed having lunch at Hexx. The chicken and waffles were amazing. Chicken was lightly breaded and the waffles golden brown perfect. The wait staff were very attentive and helped guiding us through the menu. Even had no problem taking pics of our party. All in all a great experience. We are looking forward to heading back to Hexx this September.

AAcR2Uxv-gXFeqqgzbxJcg.text: We came here for brunch during a short stay in Las Vegas. Our initial experience was good, however once the food came, I found a paper napkin or something in one of my pancakes which put a damper on the meal. We thought about mentioning it to the staff but they took so long to come by with the check that we just wanted to leave by then. The food tasted good otherwise and staff was friendly.

lTIFbbDcQ0a8xBAJZqQifQ.text: I was in Vegas for a work conference and we booked two separate client events in their private room. The managers were extremely accommodating on a last minute notice and the food was excellent. Definitely try their potions, pizza and pasta! Hexx is a nice break from the gaudy Vegas strip. A must.

G5mADIiU_Dfuq5RMyZq9hA.text: Don't go!  Terrible service and awful food.  Checked in and told it would be 15 min for outdoor table. Waited 30 min and went and asked them told their system lost our reservation. Then sat indoors waited over 10 min without being offered water or a menu. Finally complained to manager and got service. Ordered the club salad. It came overloaded with soft giant bland cubes of bread that were supposed to be croutons and missing the turkey.  Awful food and bad service. Wish we would have walked out at the start and went to the much better Moni Mi Gabi

hOAobsIRYv2FzzBo1M5Rcw.text: This place has good food. People really seemed to like the Hexx burger. I got a pizza and it was good. A bit pricey but most things on the strip are. Didn't order alcohol so I can't comment on the drinks. Service was great. It's a good place to go. Not sure I'll go back just because there are so many other places to eat at on the Strip. But I was certainly not disappointed in the meal.

jfLEi5BhUlvHBt6B9AtEMA.text: I had the burger here and it was delicious! But the one problem I had was that it was a little pricy and the menu barley had any entrees available. But if u like burgers this place does have a pretty rockin burger!

yCrOozr8v5Ybaq1hCcGt5w.text: Went there for brunch and had bottomless mimosas with the ham and cheese croissant. The mimosas were amazing but not as amazing as our service! Jody, hands down best server we've ever had in Vegas!

RIaT0ooBpPtnTzeCXPLTyQ.text: Very good food!  I only wish they had a few more menu items.  I tried heirloom tomato soup with basil oil sauce, antipasto salad, mushroom paparadel and chocolate molten cake with coffee ice cream. The  server Jessica A was great and introduced me to their in house bean to plate chocolate process, their amazing extensive dessert list, and was very attentive and polite.  The molten cake was serve deconstructed and the cake had no form - it made for an unusual dish and I'm not sure I like it that way but it tasted good and rich.  I really also like all of the different seating options and this restaurant and this is great for a meal or even just a dessert stop.

vgHDPFZz_r1NqwE2kiUSgA.text: Awesome drinks! I had the chiliquiles, they were a little soft (hence minus one star) I sat at the bar Sheena was awesome. She made amazing drinks and checked in often. She saw I didn't like my meal and was super accommodating offering to get me something else on the menu. I opted to just share with my bf, the quiche was dope. Thanks Sheena :) xo

7bsGLIpiVQGujI-JW_52FQ.text: Good food. WORST service ever. We won't be back. Had to call other servers over to get drinks and didn't see our server after our order. Extremely disappointed.  I gave this 2 stars for the food but after reflection I'm giving it 1 because that is the lowest I can go. I've never left a restaurant in tears but I did here. They made us feel like we didn't exist. No one should leave a restaurant feeling this way. Food should make you feel good, not like you'd just been bullied.

68UXumn_lLa5Gu06PMwDGA.text: 24 hours...except when they don't want to be. Unapologetic, rude, terrible experience. 7am breakfast shouldn't be so hard.

bb90eDTUwc_4lmea63ucsw.text: Ask for Aubrey and Tracee! Best service in Vegas! True to the claim of the bottomless mimosa! Never had to wait for a refill! Best restaurant experience in Vegas and we've been here since Tuesday.

32skWGw9mpIGQJoeX8Hnfw.text: Our waiter Apolo was by far the best we've ever had!!! We're here for my best friends bachelorette and he made it such an amazing experience. The atmosphere is also super fun, food was delicious, highly recommend getting the cauldron big drinks too. They are so worth it, and you get your money's worth. Apolo went above and beyond for us, and we left highly satisfied!!!

GctJoPP4wOVKt2QVY6o65w.text: Food was good along with the service. VERY loud and right on strip. The quality of food DOES NOT reflect the price you pay or the amount you get. I got a 12 inch personal pizza with pepperoni only and it was $18!!! Don't get me wrong it was good but for the price it was not a great pizza. If want a better meal go to near by Birristas Italian restaurant for WAY better food for a decent price ( they give you wine with your meal).

8ed6Lo2VeM2lWj8YbhCCpg.text: This place is amazing! Great staff and excellent service!! Food was delicious and I loved sitting out on the patio. Will definitely be back next time in Vegas!!

QZROL0pKHy2__ekKQOYcbg.text: Went here for brunch and we weren't disappointed.  The yogurt parfait was delicious and the eggs with sausage and an English muffin were too!  Great people watching from the patio as well.

U6_bhEPW9nP3QGTT1UQcvQ.text: They told us a 45 min wait and they would text us. We only had 3 people in our party. We waited over an hour they never texted us. Then we went up to the front to check our time. The host told us another 10-15 min. A different server then told the people who just walked in that he would sit them. We left. It's been 2 Hours and we still never got a text to come to the front. Worst service ever!!!

1cRRMjtdnrZZbNSY-TPxEA.text: We showed up at 6:30.. no hostess in sight, so we sat ourselves on one of the many empty tables on the patio. We were approached that we did not check in, so a manager came and asked if we could check in and sit down.  There wasn't anyone waiting so I'm not sure why they actually asked us to go check in to go sit down where we were so we left. Assumably this is the reason why it's half empty where everywhere else in the vicinity with a patio is full.   So... we're staying at Paris as try to give this place another chance, benefit of the doubt. It's 4:30 so it's not really dinner but we hoped to grab a drink and some appies on the patio. Nope, not this place. They can't chase us away fast enough. They explained if we weren't both going to order an entree we had to sit inside at the desolate bar with not a soul in sight. Again, more than half the patio empty. We opted to go next door and had a great time. I guess we'll just never try this place since they can't chase away their customers fast enough. Twice you come.. twice they can't be bothered

3MdF2CMCZeUhqm-PImRgdQ.text: Came for a late Birthday dinner.  What a save by the manager and our waiter Jackson.  Extremely rude hostess seated us for a 10:45 pm reservation at a table with a dirty napkin on one of tge couch seats.    We asked if we could sit at the next clean table.  She said no and made a show of picking up the dirty napkin and tossing it behind the couch seating but still in view.  She then tells my wife "well if that makes a difference here you go."  We were about to walk out but decided to first let the manager know what happened.  The manager apologized profusely and promised to take care of us.  Our waiter Jackson turned out to be fantastic in terms of service, conversation and attitude.  The manager also comped a good portion of the meal which was excellent.  Aside from the hostess that seemed to want to be anywhere but there, it was a nice experience.

p3vHOiGLF4EWDh44Uh4HBQ.text: After visiting for happy hour, dessert, and brunch, I can confidently say that the food at Hexx is better than it needs to be for a Strip location with patio seating and an attached dessert/gift shop. Apparently the chef from Due Forni (a local gem) recently took over the kitchen and is responsible for many of the improvements.  For HH (20% off apps plus drink discounts), the Surf & Turf sliders and Flatbread Carpaccio were both solid flavor-wise but neither was quite what we expected. Menu makes no mention of the barbecue component of the short rib-lobster pairing but it somehow worked. Shout out to the amazing housemade kettle chips on the side. The flatbread flavors needed the mustard sauce to harmonize and seemed to be closer to a tartare than a carpaccio, but it got devoured, too.   Brunch featured a swath of dishes from all over the menu, with the Prime Rib French Dip falling flat while others like the Hexx Benedict (featuring a base made of scalloped potatoes!), Chicken & Waffles (elevated by housemade pickles and bourbon-maple syrup),  and Carrot Cake Pancakes (a well-balanced sweet and savory combo) stood out as reasons to come back. The Twisted Sticky Bun was a little too sweet and a little too doughy for my personal preference but makes a great share dish, particularly if you don't opt for other sweets.   Dessert is really where they shine, though! The S'Mores Semifreddo is a creative presentation  that combines all the classic flavors with an emphasis on the toasted marshmallow. The safe-sounding Peanut Butter Cheesecake also gets you a photogenic treat with spun sugar and candied peanuts, and tasted both super creamy and nicely nutty.   Service varied on my visits, from our super-friendly brunch host to an absent-when-needed bartender. Reservation and seating policies seem inconsistent, with one hostess militantly insisting she couldn't seat my party til all were present while another graciously rushed us to our table five minutes after appointment time regardless that one guy was still stuck in the parking garage. Luckily the great food made up for the lackluster introduction for others in our group who had no previous experience here... but it should still be addressed.

dfU4IYSj2bkqi-D4dSrFLg.text: Restaurant is better for brunch, which takes place 7 days a week, vs dinner. Dinner menu is over priced (pizzas are $20+), limited in variety and lacks cohesion. From what we sampled it was good but once again over priced. The short rib entree ($38) was the size of a Tomahawk steak with bone just as large. Although enough for two people they could serve a smaller portion and lower the price. Mac and cheese ($13) was bland and tasted like Kraft white cheddar straight from the box. Even the server agreed. White bean hummus ($10) was great but they give you so little pita bread youre stuck with half the jar remaining and no pita bread.    One sticking point that will not see me returning or sending any of my friends is the fact you cant use the 20% off business card they give out and Opentable giftcard at the same time. One is to be treated like cash and the other is a discount offered by the restaurant. We could have split the check and created a hassle but its not worth it. Manager came by and snidely said 'you can use this 20% off next time.' They want your business but not bad enough to honor their own discounts.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The short rib, hummus and flavorless mac and cheese.

R7j_bKC5IvBL8xXx-VW04A.text: Our favorite brunch spot!! It has a great view of the strip. The food is always great, The drinks are great! The service is quick and the servers are so friendly. One of our Vegas favs!

xEuDktupR_Q9QfG4lHrscg.text: This restaurant is right on the strip across from Bellagio. Highly recommend. The first evening in Vegas we had dinner here. My sister got the pepperoni pizza - delicious and a large serving. Six slices I believe, could definitely share if necessary. My other friend had the veggie pizza - delicious as well. I had the wedge salad, great choice- so fresh and yummy. Definitely satisfied.   A few days later my sister and I stopped in for breakfast. Again a great experience. Bottomless mimosas for $23, definitely worth it. I had the ham and bacon omelette. Very good. My sister had 3 eggs scrambled.

zidpcyGz7KvNqw6z1o550g.text: I ordered carrot cake pancakes and they were amazing... but my friends order corned beef hash and the portion was a bit under whelming for the price. I personally would recommend to go try the place if you want someone different and out of the box but if you are in for a big filling brunch with multiple items you should pass.

qJjoTRYmA9sAl3t3BQoTiQ.text: Great location right on the strip! I would highly recommend the patio seating for an amazing view of the street. My boyfriend and I ordered the Hexx eggs Benedict, lobster roll, and calamari. My favorite dish was the eggs Benedict! This dish came with a perfectly poached egg and a very rich hollandaise sauce. Instead of an English muffin from most places, Hexx serves poached eggs on scalloped potatoes! It was very tasty, we enjoyed every last bite. With that being said, I do wish the serving size for the eggs Benedict was a little bigger since it is more on the pricey side (but worth it)!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qHdal4RS7cVwR8JUuo0yEw.text: I tasted lots of great foods at our table, so I have little doubt that my dining companions will swarm this listing with 4- or even 5-star reviews. Unfortunately, my own entree was lacking.  HEXX Kitchen + Bar is a newer American restaurant that took over the Sugar Factory space. This is a great location, with entrances to the Strip and the floor of Paris Las Vegas.  I accepted an invitation to Saturday brunch, which took place in a busy and loud dining room (which drowned out the 80s-heavy music mix) with lighter colors all over that wouldn't seem out of place in a tropical getaway. Maybe that's some sort of implied appeal toward women (you know, the "XX"), but our table as well as the rest of the main dining room seemed to have an even mix of genders.  Without further ado, allow me to dissect the problem child, the Prime Rib French Dip ($19). The portion was ample, so no problem there. As expected, I experienced rich flavor between the beef and the au jus. The hoagie roll was capable of soaking up that au jus without being too thick or distracting, so another win.  The first notable concern is that I had at least two gristly bites which most would spit out and call inedible. This suggests that cheap meat may have been used or at least that the meat wasn't trimmed/cleaned completely. I also found the thin-cut fries to be pedestrian and not very fluffy or crispy. They were only barely useful as a vehicle for the "horseradish cream" that wasn't very strong, perhaps diluted with ranch or something similar.   And seriously, what's up with how runny that sauce is? I already have the loose liquid dip that is supposed to saturate every crevice upon dipping, so this second sauce simply slipped off. Execution and design flaws all around detract from what could've been a great entree.  I have to give most of the weight of the rating to the food that mostly filled my belly, so even the standouts of what I sampled from around the table weren't enough for me to feel comfortable with giving 4 stars.  Magick Dragon cocktail: pay attention when the server pours the liquid into the pitcher. It instantly activates the bed of dry ice, and a clear smoky vapor starts pouring out. This really is a great show. However, the cocktail itself doesn't have any sort of tart or gingery notes aside from the sweet, vaguely tropical fruit profile. For that alone, I'd recommend against ordering this drink even if you're trying to find something to share between multiple people.  Also, a minor quibble, but I'm pretty sure that the dry ice froze the last fraction of the drink. We had neither time or temperature to deal with that, but it was annoying that we still saw color despite not being able to consume any of it.  Twisted Sticky Bun ($8): Rick M's order. Huge, chewy yet soft, and non-saccharine version of this breakfast pastry. I loved the cream cheese topping and the crispy pecans. This is best for sharing unless you have a huge sweet tooth.  Chicken and Waffles ($24): Clint B's entree. Both items were crispy and the chicken was delicious and fork-tender. I didn't really get much of the apple-cheddar character of the waffle in my limited sampling, but it sounds delightful. Price concerns aside, I'd definitely consider ordering it for myself, and it's likely one of the best takes locally on this classic (and considering that Clint prefers another Strip restaurant's rendition, I'm also putting that one on my list).  We were all too full to contemplate ordering dessert, but our server did present to us one small piece each of two different, house-made chocolate blends. I can't recall the names, but one had some fruity flavors in it, and both seemed to provide complex bitter notes despite initially tasting like milk chocolates. They mentioned that we could get 15% off chocolates at their store (a separate business listing), and I may have to consider making that visit next time I'm in the area.  Ultimately, I would consider returning to HEXX Kitchen + Bar, although I'm not in any hurry. I'll just have to remember to skip the French Dip and avoid anything else with fries like the plague.

Service was ok but food was delish! I had the chicken and waffles. The portion was huge and it was warm, crunchy and seasoned well!   Definitely would come back here even if I didn't stay at Paris.  They have misters if you sit outside but we sat just inside with a view of the outside and felt super comfortable temperature wise.

19H3KgO6UHhPI1dhYuTLMA.text: My boyfriend and I came here for Tuesday brunch because of the great reviews I was reading. However, I do not agree as I did not have the 5 star experience that it is getting. It was mostly due to lack of service, our waitress did not seem to be too attentive to our table. In fact, multiple times I had to track her down to either order something, get a refill and ask for additional condiments. I'm addition, after we ordered a dessert, the waitress came out 10 min later to tell us the dessert was not available. This happened twice... It would be better if the waitress was able to inform us earlier that certain desserts were not available at that time instead of waiting after we ordered. We were definitely at the restaurant for much longer than what we intended. I mean, I didn't want to spend most of time in Vegas at a restaurant...  Regarding the food, I was not too fond of the corn beef hash. I was expecting it to be more fried but it had a very soft texture. However, I also tried the carrot pancakes and I actually really like the flavor of the pancake. It is topped with a nice cream cheese frosting which is delicious as I did not need additional syrup. The frosting was sweet enough with the pancakes and I would definitely recommend that if you are in the mood for a sweeter side. The dessert we got was the smores which had ice cream in between Graham crackers topped with heated marshmallows and chocolate. Definitely try if you like the mix of warm and cold desserts!

F5Nr3kXiiSxM0I-BQuRaYg.text: I've been here twice, based on recommendations from other business travelers. I have to tell you, for the price, it's just ok. The service is completely unorganized CHAOS from start to finish. They have runners that work with the waiters, which is quite normal, but they're pretty unresponsive when delivering the appys and entrees. I dined here Wednesday evening during a convention, and I probably won't return, just because the service is just OK. We needed exceptionally long for cocktail refills, the waiter really didn't know the bourbons on the menu and our entrees were ordered incorrectly, not too mention we almost received another tables entree, which would've been incorrect.

T90Zu9qV0gntKqQDBBBXsw.text: I was in Las Vegas for a friend's 21st birthday, and we celebrated here as a group of seven. The food was fantastic, and very affordable for the quality, and the waitstaff was pleasant, attentive, and accommodating. This was my favorite place we dined all weekend!  My friend and I split two pizzas (about 10" in diameter): the Pepperoni and the White. Both were really tasty, and the pepperoni even had an extra kick because they use arrabiata sauce instead of just tomato/marinara. We also ordered a side of macaroni and cheese which was to die for. It was so rich and creamy that we could barely finish it after starting on the pizzas. It's a small dish, but well worth the price.   To top it all off, we got these fun mixed drinks (unfortunately I can't remember their names, and they're not on the online menus) that are served with dry ice to create a bubbling cauldron, of sorts. They're big servings (and run about $38 apiece), and if it hadn't been for a 21st birthday, we surely would have split one drink between two people. As it was, we each drank one and survived, and I didn't find it too strong, especially when consumed slowly with dinner.   The ambiance and decor was dark and rich, and we could see chocolate being made to one side of the dining room. Bonus points for the attached candy store!
