gDPVFUDE4uXGgx3SmB9wuw.text: Love the brunch! Bottomless is a huge plus especially on the strip. And they take reservations! Huge shout out to our bus boy Antonio. Extremely personable and very attentive. Honestly felt like he was better at filling up our water than our server was with our mimosas. Antonio needs to be a server ASAP.

TfLSUkEAAlMAGe3-jKro9w.text: This is a must stop in for breakfast spot! If you love breakfast like I do please order the carrot pancakes they are to die for. The veggie omelette was delicious too. We had the most amazing server named Carl. My friend asked did they serve Mexican coffee and Carl went to the back and found the main ingredient ( Patron XO Cafe Incendio) it's a Mexican Chile chocolate liquor added to the coffee. It was a taste of pure heaven! What an impression this left on us Carl went out of his way to ensure our first visit to Vegas was memorable and I will forever be grateful.  It was the highlight of my vacation thanks Carl!

GN6SgjBt1nsPrZ0bY1pnHg.text: I love this place for brunch ! They had a DJ, bottomless mimosas, and great breakfast! The DJ gives it a better vibe for a Sunday brunch ! We ordered a side of strawberries for the mimosas which was great ! I ordered the eggs Benedict. It was really good with bacon and avocado! It was packed since it was a Sunday  but we sat down less then 5 mins after we got there. I definitely recommend this place for a Sunday brunch , bottomless mimosas and a DJ! You really don't get all 3 at many places!

vilGaPJpk9Y7Fi9NgIZZfg.text: Everytime I went back to Las Vegas,  I would visit this place for food and drinks especially carpaccio. I always sit at the bar, easy to access and commute with bartenders for drinks and food.

DHwjqh7snIo873ZiZ4Ga-A.text: The food wasn't amazing but we had a great time with the $24 bottomless mimosas especially being in Vegas!  It is a must if you want to have a good time while catching breakfast in Vegas while partaking in a few alcoholic drinks.

OncUpFOaZ6az4viqvIWbgA.text: I would have given this a better rating if the service wasn't so bad.  We went in for breakfast and ordered eggs with chicken sausage.  When our food arrived I asked the waitress for salt and pepper since there wasn't any on the table.  She gave me a look and walked away.  A few minutes later I thought maybe she didn't hear me.  Several more minutes went by.  I saw her walk by and asked her again.  She let out a sigh.   Asking for salt and pepper was obviously an inconvenience to her.  She was rude and not friendly at all.  I had to ask for the check.  After a bit she dropped it off with a snide remark like "I hope the rest of your day is better."  I am not in any hurry to go back.

afqgthJ086XgADvYtCAYxA.text: Ambiance, 5 stars!  Beautiful decor, light and airy with trendy appropriate music.    Service, 5 stars! Everyone was on point.  Food, 10 stars! Delish, delish, delish!  Added to the list for date night restaurants.

V3K5gDxhF3OQivy3foqMBw.text: Tracy and Jesus made our Sunday brunch amazing from the moment we arrived.  You rock!  Go TCU and Hook 'em horns!   . Get the bottomless mimosas and crab cakes!  Can't go wrong!

RduhrUjw46CoPd2JKuCcDw.text: Came here with a group of friends for brunch and we made a reservation. We changed our reservation a few times and they were super helpful and lenient about it. My friend and I shared their steak & eggs that included an angus New York steak, two eggs any style, potatoes, and an english muffin. The portions were decently sized and my friend and I got pretty full from sharing. I thought the meal was pretty good overall but nothing really stood out. The rest of the group seemed to enjoy their food as well so I'd probably come back if someone wants to try it!

xIg357_0uFDbO3-ZovifFg.text: Amazing breakfast here this morning. Latte was to die for. People watching was wonderful. Staff is outstanding!

P3IhQMXKIdJMbYz6ogkHDg.text: We love Tracee! Amazing service! She truly went above & beyond. We were recommend this place from some friends & i am so glad we went. The food was great & i can't wait to go back. Bottomless mimosas  daily till 2p & you definitely get your moneys worth. An incredible dinning experience.

Pjd9u62aqSlgCWaUwBwEMg.text: This is my FAVORITE brunch spot in Las Vegas hands down and that's saying a lot seeing as how I'm a bruncholic.  It's located inside the Paris, the interior is so cute. You can see them making chocolate next door from the bar/lounge area which I thought was neat. Every time I've been I've sat out on the patio which gives you an amazing view of the bellagio fountains for when they go off.   My first experience was the best, got some brunch with a close friend. We got the bottomless mimosas. Blade, our server, was out for blood. I could NOT reach the bottom of my mimosa he kept filling it up even after a sip. I was in heaven, I get very cranky if I reach the bottom of my bottomless mimosa. They also had a yellow ghost bloody on the menu that was made with gazpacho and ghost peppers. BEST BLOODY MARY EVER! The yellow gazpacho  made the best base ever. Toe curling delicious.   I ordered the carnitas hash and it was amazing. The eggs were cooked to perfection, the egg yolk mixing beautifully with the carnitas and the potatoes. It was absolutely divine.  We finished eating and just sat around enjoying the beautiful weather out and people watching while still enjoying our endless mimosas. He served us them past 3 pm even though that's when brunch ended.  It was an absolute blast though, I'm surprised I was able to walk out of the restaurant, we probably had 15 mimosas.   At the end of the meal the server delivers a plate of dark chocolates with their logo on it, and every chocolate has a spell card. Some are for wealth, some are for fun, some are for wisdom. Either way it's a very cute touch and the chocolate is probably some of the best chocolate I've ever had.   The second time I went the server wasn't as enthusiastic with the mimosas. Obviously still got my 20 dollars worth but I did reach the bottom of my mimosa.   I ordered the chive waffle which was really good. They brought me hard boiled eggs, lox, chives, cream cheese, onions and capers I think. It was REALLY really good. My friends ordered the chicken and waffles which were the best chicken and waffles I had ever had.   It was only 11 am and paramedics were already carting someone off property on a stretcher. Gotta love vegas!

Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas hash
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chocolates they gave us after we ate that came with a cute little spell.

a-QO1Fcdmv0OV5SFImnMbQ.text: Had the Eggs Benedict with home fries. My husband had it the regular way with the scalloped potatoes. I prefer the scalloped. I was surprised to see no english muffin, but they were very accommodating and gave me one. It was actually great even without it. The potatoes were delicious, the poached eggs were cooked perfectly, and the hollandaise sauce had a great taste. Also, as an added bonus. I went to tix4tonight and they gave me a card for an extra 10% off! UPDATE- We went back the next day and it is a hit or miss. The Eggs Benedict wasn't anything like the ones we received the day before and the ham was totally different as well.

Sci8g2d4VGZ6IwJPkOE15w.text: Rafael was an awesome waiter. The food was so good. I got the prime rib sandwich and it was so good and me and my friend shared it. We were lost in the sauce. It was great. He was super attentive to our table and was sure to never let our drinks go empty! Also, I need to include Christina she is amazing at her job! She made sure we were fully satisfied.  P.s. Rafael (tongue roll) was so good anything he suggested on the menu I bought including chicharones. Love the country boy vibe!

QGAHgUcjM--Q9R5Sq_eWSQ.text: We were so excited to try this place. Even tho they were so busy it looked like a great option for lunch. We arrived without reservations and had no wait time until we got to our table. The waitress was so slow. We had our water and ordered our food within five mins. After that we had to wait for 15 mins to get coffee and water refills. Whenever we needed something we had to wait a long time or go and find a waiter to help us. The spinach dip was good, but the salads were wilted and soaked with dressing. I did not finish mine. Then I had the chicken and waffles. One piece of chicken was perfect and the next was not all the way cooked. The waffles were dry as a bone and then we couldn't get enough syrup in time to have my waffle not be dry. I will not go there again. The one good thing was the valet. They were expensive but quick

GAp70-IV0PnkJ3fGuVj23w.text: This place is a MUST for bottomless mimosa brunch! Tracee never let our glasses empty and made it so fun! Definitely recommend this place and if for whatever reason you get to choose your server, find my girl Tracee! She's what brunch dreams are made of

Tracee our server was the best waitress of any restaurant we dined at while here in Vegas. She was friendly and prompt.  A great smile and genuinely cares about customer service. 5 stars for Tracee.

p9vvPAhJ8XJfjspfWzBk9Q.text: A group of my friends and I stayed at the Paris Hotel for Labor Day weekend and spent that Monday holiday morning gambling in the casino. Eventually, when we got hungry, we debated on where we should go to eat. Somewhere close by and somewhere with great reviews. Then I realized, I have had HEXX kitchen bookmarked for a while now and it is located inside of the hotel, so we decided why not!   We arrived around 11:30am and it was brunch time. There was a 25 minute wait, so we spent our waiting time drooling over all the desserts they had in the HEXX chocolate bar next door. Everything looked so good, especially the ice cream sandwiches!! (I ended up getting one and omg, amazing!)  Once we got seated, we were overwhelmed by the amount of items they had on their brunch menu. We STRUGGLED to decide. Ultimately, we ordered an array of delicious brunch specialties and it was awesome!  Chilaquiles (3.5/5) I must say, these weren't bad. But they were not amazing. Plus, you will always get a dish of chilaquiles anywhere that will eventually become soggy. Not my thing really.  Corned beef hash (5/5) Now, this dish was so freaking good! Probably the best corned beef hash I have ever had! Highly recommend!  Breakfast croissant (5/5) The croissant was perfectly flaky and so buttery. Let me say that ALL croissant breakfast sandwiches should taste like this one! Nailed it for sure!  Meat omelet (5/5) This is what I call an omelet. No complaints. BOMB.  Carrot cake pancakes (5/5) Okay, okay. Now this right here had me craving pancakes for the rest of the week and I am not the pancake type. Waffles are my go-to, but oh my goodness, these were heaven!!  The four stars is because our service was not that great. We had to ask for water re-fills and it seemed like our food took a little longer than it should have. I don't know if it's because we didn't order alcohol, but the service was just alright. Part of the time I really wondered if we were forgotten about. But from my experience working in a restaurant, it seemed like they were transitioning and new servers were coming onto the floor because we really couldn't tell who our server was.   Anyway, I would still come back! The food was great and it would have been a great pair with their bottomless mimosas! Until next time!

O_CqK5J9WQoKYQuPA-wlyg.text: Awesome service and the best bottomless mimosas in town! We sent everyone we talked to there. The carrot cake pancakes taste exactly like carrot cake and protein omelet is delicious. We got into Vegas around 10 am and thanks to the mimosas, were drunk by noon.

-EBpi8ssBQGIvijWI1mErA.text: Sugar Factory vs HEXX Spinning lollipops vs Chocolate   Locals and avid Vegas tourists understand what I'm saying. No lies, I loved the Sugar Factory. Everything from the ambiance, the food and the service. The concept of having a candy shop attached was cool. The spinning lollipops were fun but now very 3 years ago.  Now for Hexx, I really love their concept and the changes they made by opening up one side. Enjoying some sun, people watching and enjoying the Bellagio fountains is just part of The Strip. We were seated on the patio, so we could enjoy all three sports on the Strip.  We ordered the bacon and it was super crispyn. thought it good, but I'm not a fan of overcooked anything, so I guess it's a matter of taste. For my meal, I ordered the chicken and waffles. The waffle was great but I found the chicken to be bland and dry. Chicken breast can dry pretty fast and that's what happened. I don't think I will order it again.  After brunch, my daughter and I shared the hot chocolate and wow it was good. I'm big on hot chocolate... Angelina's in Paris... Max Brenner... I like it a lot. HEXX has amazing hot chocolate, very rich and a good consistently.   The service was amazing. We weren't rushed and they were all very friendly.  When done, head next door to pick up some chocolates. Don't expect it to be the packaged cheap stuff you pick up at a grocery store. They serve chocolate here, it's the real deal.   I love the chocolate here. I was never big on the spinning lollipops anyhow. :)

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just bacon.

dNil4f3OMxKybQudcYiTow.text: Super awesome food and a great patio! Went here for brunch before the race and it was a great way to start the day!

JdQDDmDbP6JJ3Jhxna3N4Q.text: Very Surprised how FANTASTIC the burger was!!!!         I stopped in HEXX, to wait for my husband who was @ the UNLV vs Duke basketball game ~ had some time to kill, was hungry had seen picks in Paris of their burger, to cold to wait outside @ Beer Park, saw an open table in the bar and the rest is history!!!     I kinda consider myself a burger addict or affecianado!!! Don't eat fast food burgers and consider Bachi Burger the burger to me measured against!!!! And the Hexx Burger stands up very solidly to Bachi. (In my opinion)       Not only does the burger look good ~ it's DEEEELISSSH. I don't know if it's the fully melted American cheese, the well done bacon or the chocolate bun.... YEAH! I know that sounds weird but it's different and not what you expect ~ but go Order, Look & EAT a HEXX burger you'll be very happy you did!!!

WTD_1xkA7yOzpHzbYSY8qg.text: We came to this restaurant on a Monday. It was a 45 min wait and eventually we got seated at 11:05am, which 11am is apparently the cut off for weekday breakfast/brunch.   I asked the server if we can still have the breakfast menu, since I heard HEXX is known for their breakfast. The server unfortunately couldn't give us the breakfast menu and we were forced to order from the lunch menu.   The lunch menu is definitely pricier than the breakfast menu, but we felt optimistic about this place.  I ordered the chicken BLT burger and it came with fries. I had one bite of the burger was it was BLAND all the way! Nothing too special about this $18 burger! The fries were average. I asked our server for a side of ranch dressing. The service was SLOW. It took a good 20 min just for ranch. And by the way, the restaurant wasn't that busy around that time. The ranch tasted like Hidden Valley ranch from the bottle. Ehhhh..  To summarize my review: slow service, overpriced & bland food (at least for lunch) & I wish we had the option to order breakfast instead! Definitely disappointed.  2 stars rating though because we had a view of the Strip.  But honestly I would rate this place 1.5 stars.

y6oey8HYA8E8GxyY6B4DEw.text: All brunches are super expensive on the strip. My husband had the eggs benadict and was disappointed that there was no muffin. Eggs were perfect. My egg breakfast was clean, not greasy but I would have preferred toast to muffins. Service was good, not super. Meh.

MYyDKhGc0NNtgRmj1JIJuQ.text: Came and tried hexx and the service was awesome but the frittata was definitely a disappointment!!! It was super small and had no chorizo in it as stated in the menu and over priced for what it was!! Bummed out!

TQYBQr_4Q5VQU32OTxYkxA.text: Stay far far far away from this place. New name same crap management and it encourages its employees to write reviews. Shady business and even shadier management.

aRxlEIXni_iMxCjbFD-6ow.text: Had dinner here last night with a friend, and up until this morning at 3 am I would have given this place 4 stars - but at 3 am she threw-up all of her dinner and has been sick in bed all day.  I know this is Vegas, but we can't blame this one on alcohol as neither of us drank last night, nor did we eat anything else after we left the restaurant.  She's got all the signs of food poisoning.  Which really sucks because we're in town to attend a conference that we paid for out of our pockets, and now she's missed a full day of sessions.  We're praying that she'll feel better tomorrow.  So far the best she can do is small sips of Gatorade.  She ordered a pasta dish, I think it was one of the house specials.  I'm pretty sure one of the listed ingredients might have been egg yolk.  Looking back now, that seems odd - why list egg yolk unless it is raw - in which case - what the heck?  She thinks she remembers seeing that too but, at the time, not giving it much thought.   The location is amazing (right across from the Bellagio fountain).  As far as my dinner - it was okay.  We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip - which is one of the best I've ever had.  For my main course I had the fillet which was cooked exactly as I ordered (medium), but a bit dry and lacking any flavor other than when the pepper it was dusted with before cooking happened to touch my tongue.  There was a very small dollop of 'steak sauce' on the plate, I suppose it's there incase the pepper didn't work.  I tasted the sauce - nothing to rave about and I'd prefer something better than homemade A-1.  This space used to be occupied by the Sugar Factory... and I was really hoping to eat there.  It wasn't until we made the trek up from the Mandalay that I realized Sugar Factory was gone.  Another small positive note - Hexx just opened, literally.  I think last Friday (Feb 27th) was it's first night.  So the place was still fairly empty at 7:30 pm on a Monday night.    Might be empty because it's so new, or might be empty because my friend isn't the only one to have spent the next day puking up her dinner.  I visit Vegas a lot - and I'll keep an eye on their Yelp reviews to see if this was a one-time fluke.  Bottom line - should you go here?  If you want a great view of the fountain and fabulous spinach dip - give it a shot.  Just stay far away from anything else on the menu that might get you sick if it's not cooked/prepared properly.  Good luck!

KgjeSn_xCpgMWzoS6bg7vw.text: I want to give a shout out to Juan at Hexx. He turned our night from a 5 to a 10 every restaurant should have a manager like him, especially at night in Vegas. We had an issue with our order and he completely took care of it with no questions asked and a smile.

_T985RSsXk9gxf9-pEdlzQ.text: This is the best place to eat in Vegas. Fresh environment, light and happy vibe with FRESH AIR and natural light and views of the Bellagio water show. The prices are affordable! Yes, I said affordable. The servers are fresh, friendly, happy, energetic, fun, informative, helpful and kind! Sit in Tracee and Jordans section! The food....fresh, beautiful, nutritious, exciting, flavorful, elegant to look at. From the front desk to the servers to the kitchen they pay attention to detail. Did I mention the flavor of the food? AWESOME! Visiting for Moms 70th with my sister and we were not diappointed. From hangovers to batchelorette parties or a 70th bash, you want to eat and drink here. Great memories! Thanks Tracee and Jordan!

The portions are HUMONGOUS. It will look like the bartender's bringing you a huge smoky mug of potion, and you're ready to cast a spell in that joint. #hocuspocus!

The service left so much to be desired compared to what we had experienced at all the other restaurants we had gone to while staying in Vegas.  Not once were we ever asked how are meal was or if there was anything else they could bring us. We split the prime burger and was told it was far better than the Hexx burger that was no longer on the menu. Well our server was wrong. Hopefully everyone else continues to go to Mon Ami so this place stays a best kept secret for our next visit. ;)

sYsb-3jcln4FLdUK0VP_zQ.text: I just finished eating at Hexx and the food was pretty good. The biggest turnoff for me was when I ordered a 17.00 dollar desert that was advertised as sharing with the table was a joke. I ordered something that came with icecream and it had like 2 little scoops, so I asked the manager Juan for more icecream for my 17.00 dessert and he proceeded to tell me it was 3.00 a scoop and I told him I refuse to pay Xtra for icecream when more should have been on my plate. Juan chose to lose a 17.00 dollar sale for the dessert and took it off the bill, when he should have pleased his customer and brought out 2 scoops. I had planned on coming back for breakfast tomorrow morning but I don't feel like I was excepted here. And to top it off My server Tom K seemed to have an attitude all throughout my dining experience.    I wrote a bad review on Hexx yesterday but I must say the General Manager Michael made our experience today very pleasurable. My server Adam was the best he made us feel how customers should feel when eating out. Side note come for breakfast and try the Chocolate banana pancakes there the best.

It was a hard consistency and did not taste like chicken at all. The only reason I gave it two stars is because the service was good. The food was horrible!  Save your time and money.   Plenty of other good places to eat.

LGTu8r5ob38VFn_EYgHQQQ.text: Jessica A is the best! Best customer service I've had this trip.  Great food, ample portions and great view of the Bellagio fountains. Also - only a 5-10 minute wait.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qFUpqx1i8TPxFHwdLbFRcQ.text: Delish!!! I had the ham and cheddar croissant with roasted potatoes and a hypnotize strawberry cocktail... Damn I love breakfast in Vegas!!!! We sat on the patio, Our waitress Tracee had a great personality, and was great! There bloody Mary's were good too! Great place, pricey but really enjoyed it

K5RNlPEtfi3SSlhA38Z-fw.text: Sat at the bar for Saturday lunch. Service was incredibly slow. Waited 15 minutes to order. Ordered the roasted beet and grains salad. Waited 45 minutes for it to come and when it did it was full of capers which was not listed on the menu. I hate capers, but did not have time to complain after the long wait. The bartender was apologetic, but did nothing to help with my bill. Salad and ice tea was $27 after tip and I was still starving after. The salad was the only potentially larger vegan item on the menu (I switched out the dressing). Not impressed and annoyed that I went over my work lunch budget.

3ZppvQsad0n3Pxv_6qru1A.text: Hexx was next door to our hotel and we decided to try breakfast here one morning we were up early.  As soon as we walked up to the restaurant, I could smell a strong paint/varnish smell.  I noticed they were getting ready to open Beer Park on the roof and it looked like someone was working on the area.  We got a seat inside and I hoped the varnish smell would subside.  I ordered orange juice because I saw it was served in a carafe and assumed it was fresh squeezed.  I should have asked because it tasted like it came from a carton at the grocery store.  Unfortunately, the varnish smell started making me queasy and we left before eating.  We tried Hexx again another evening for dinner, and this time the varnish smell was gone.  We were seated at a table farthest from the windows.  It still had a great view of the Bellagio fountains just across the street.  I ordered the spinach artichoke dip as an appetizer.  It's served in a mini skillet with tortilla chips and pita bread.  It was creamy and did not disappoint.  It was HOT though, and I burned my tongue - so maybe let it cool a minute before you dig in.  We also ordered one of their signature Hexx potions on the special drink menu that appeared to have smoke or mist coming from it.  We had to ask about it though, because $36 seemed pretty steep.  We learned it was actually a pitcher and not a single serving (you cannot tell from the photo) and we ordered the purple haze pitcher, which was a berry flavored drink.  The server brought out the pitcher and another cup and then proceeded to pour the contents of the cup into the pitcher and it immediately began smoking.  We figured there must be dry ice in the bottom.  We were given two straws and told to go to town!  The drink fizzed for a long time, at least 10 minutes!  It was tasty but not super strong, alcohol-wise.  My bf wasn't very hungry, so I was the only one who ended up ordering an entree.  I chose the Pappardelle, which was described as a pasta with wild mushroom, baby spinach, portabella cream and parmesan.  It was an average pasta dish and not very flavorful.  As a lover of all things pasta, I ate only about half and did not take the rest home.  I wouldn't order it again, either.  We skipped dessert and left once we'd finished our drink.  Service was satisfactory and nothing to complain about.  We did not get any chocolate with our check as another reviewer mentioned!  Tip:  If you have a Total Rewards card, they give 20% off the check!
