9oLRE0w-n5xCwBbD7mk5AQ.text: Terrible service. Been sitting at our table for 30 minutes. Still waiting on the mimosas we ordered when we sat down. Ridiculous!  Just talked to the manager and complained. He did not seem to care one bit. Never coming back.

VNpj20b9wyPKrnQC7JjXhw.text: I wanted to love this place, the reviews from fellow Yelpers were glowing. We went around 3:00 for brunch and were very excited about the entries we ordered. I got the Hexx burger and my partner ordered the Chicken and Waffles. It wasn't busy but we waited for quite a long time. I ordered my burger medium expecting some pink in the middle, it was cooked through, dry and not hot, barely warm. Fries the same, only warm. My partners chicken and waffles were hot but the breast piece was over cooked, dry. The thigh piece was delicious. I loved the location but the service was spotty.  This was close to a 2 Star review, probably closer to 2 than 3.

sejNK8DexG_Ka6I8gxM-Xw.text: Man. I was very disappointed with the food at Hexx. My family and I were super excited to try this place out. At first impression, Hexx is a beautiful place to have brunch-- you walk in, and you just feel the classy-boozy-brunch ambience. That feeling of, "Hey, let's get a morning cocktail to nurse this slight Vegas hangover."  The staff is incredibly attentive, accommodating (had to move to another table to accommodate my ankle injury), and personable. Our waitress was super funny, and our host was very sweet. But the food-- meh. I'd say that if you're getting something sweet, go for it. But their actual meals were just dry and tasteless.   We ordered a mocha to start. Delicious. It was smooth, foamy, and not too rich. And then I got a bit too excited and ordered one of their dry-ice smoking cocktails -- the Elixir (most definitely did not give me life). It tasted and looked like an AMF. The worst is that I low-key was annoyed that this particular cocktail was recommended to me by the staff and now no one at the table wanted to drink it lol. There goes $36.  I'd have to say that the highlight of the meal was the Cinnaroll Waffle. The decadent cream cheese and cinnamon flavoring was amazing. I expected the chicken and waffles to be as great too, but it came out to be kinda dry and tasteless. So was my protein omelet-- the chicken was cardboard. And the corned beef hash? Not enough potatoes. And the salad? As DJ Esco would say, "Too Much SAUCEEEE."  Bye.

iFHj4fwx2u9m76XVOL6Vmw.text: This place was so so so yummy and didn't mind my one year old being a little active. Staff was really nice and the food was amazing!

CrbhpxsoouNACwX2uNA4LA.text: Chicken and Waffles were good, but I've had better. Drinks were great and open air dinning atmosphere was nice. Very loud and busy. Waiter was average.

za9CtkVPZt6qgotSw_EgiQ.text: The pizza here just made me cry, seriously. Fried garlic garnishes & basil underneath the toppings. Fucking brilliant

b5FYhKsZEKJpMCMQBsA4gg.text: The food is awesome here however, THE SERVICE was HORRIBLE! We didn't get the food til one hour later and the waitress came once and after asked for ketchup she didn't come back at all. Instead she was talking around with others and clearly just didn't care. The bussers were the only people working in this restaurant. Great food but really not worth it!

GdDuELvW_nNnXWmDe4EuRQ.text: Great food. Great atmosphere. Great view of fountain. Great waiter and servers. Great location. Whats not great is the CNF 4% fee they add to the bill. It is bad enough I have to pay resort fees at the hotels. It is ridiculous that a restaurant will add an extra fee that does absolutely nothing. I ate at many great restaurants on and off the strip that none of them added a CNF fee. I will only return here if they get rid of the CNF fee.

Yrdkmcbef1HFpMcfCO_ivA.text: My friend and her fiance came to Vegas for her birthday. Her fiance and I originally wanted to go to Sugar Factory but since Hexx took over and that option wasn't available we decided to try this place out. We ordered the Jungle Juice drink. It tastes similar to Malibu/Pineapple. It was really good. About 10 or so shots inside. We had the spinach artichoke dip, Loaded fries, Pepperoni pizza and calamari. The food was great. I personally loved the dip and fries. I would have given 5 stars but was disappointed to hear that they don't do anything for birthdays. I was offered a dessert menu and told they'd provide me with candles but I'd still have to pay full menu price. Considering how much $ we spent here I would have assumed they would at the very least speak to management and try to make some sort of gesture even at 1/2 price. Most places do something small for celebratory events. I really hope they consider this in the near future. We sat out on the patio and we got to see the Bellagio fountain show during our meal which made the atmosphere a lot more enjoyable. If you go here, be sure you're ready to spend $ as they are on the pricier side but overall good service and good food. Thanks

TWgi3I9SSOSBgjKxNPDAoQ.text: Hexx has such a fantastic atmosphere with the patio being right across from the Bellagio water show and underneath the Paris' Eiffel Tower but the food quality is two stars at best. I reserved a table for 8 for a friend's birthday party and the experience was disappointing. The drinks were probably the second best part of the visit next to the sights, the drinks were shareable and had 8-10 shots and a pretty presentation. I wasn't able to try one so I opted for a virgin strawberry mojito which was pretty good. We ordered a variety of food from the guacamole to pizza and everything was pretty bland. The burgers had stale buns, the pizza was way too greasy, the pasta was bland. I ordered the mushroom pappardelle and I shouldn't have let our server talk me into adding shrimp because I couldn't stomach any of it and even though I literally didn't take one bite of the shrimp, she didn't ask what the problem was or even apologize for talking me into something I knew I didn't want. Adding garlic bread to your pasta costs extra and wasn't worth it. At the end of our dinner they came out with a tiny piece of cake for our friend and had the candle sitting on the plate all by itself so naturally the candle blew out and fell over before reaching my friend and the server just said I'm sorry, worst presentation ever and ran off. It was lame to say the least. Then two tables over we see a beautiful birthday treat come out with three well lit candles so that was even more upsetting. We ordered another dessert, the warm cookie Sunday and it was awfully dry and too thick to be considered a cookie. More like a dry chocolate chip cake. Just awful. For a place known for sweets, the desserts couldn't have let me down more. I won't return to Hexx and I will not recommend it. Also, the cherry on top, I came home and food positioning commenced. The papardelle DID NOT sit well.

hH77ZW9ZQELRqY5uP4R5sw.text: Sean was our waiter and he is truly the best! Really good with recommendations if you are ever stuck between a dish, and just cares about how you are doing! You can feel how genuine he is when it comes to making your experience the best! If you come here ask for Sean lol!!

B4re_dhJT3yMj9_jFaS9Og.text: Went here for a birthday dinner. The service was great. The waitress went above and beyond but sadly the food is just not good. I'd go back only for the drinks, which are really good.

What type of hostess doesn't smile or ask if you need help? Literally they all just stood there and talked to each other lol... So weird and terrible management for allowing that to happen

Af7jmuiZ9MyDFdGjCnc3pg.text: There's literally a thousand plus places to eat at within a 5 mile radius. My husband and I wanted to try something different to celebrate the new year. Sadly, we chose Hexx. We ordered the Hex burger, marguerites pizza, and Mac and cheese. Our waitress, Denise, never asked us how our food was. We wish she would have because the burger was so over-cooked and bone dry. The pizza was sub par and soggy. The only positives- the bacon on the burger was delicious and my drinks were never empty. Everything else was a let down. There's easily 999+ places we would have rather eaten at. Patrons, avoid The Hexx- you can do much better in Vegas, the Mecca of great food!!

Had to leave off the potatos because they are fried with breaded items and leave the toast. I told the server why I couldn't have the potatoes and toast. The server said unable to substitute but I can have a banana for $2. I spent nearly $15 for 3 eggs and 3 strips of bacon. Not happy or pleased. I won't go back. Total rip off. I should have stuck with the $5 coffee.

I am planning to return here upon my next visit and will never hesitate to suggest it to my friends. Wonderful place.

Since the waitress was we went back. Our second time the waitress could not be anymore less engaged. She did not get our drink order. We had to call her over to place the order. My pepperoni pizza arrived and crab cakes and she never showed up again. After we finished our meal we were ready to order dessert but after 30 minutes of waiting and had to ask someone else to find our waitress we decided not to spend another dime there. They at least comped my drink. The manager was nice and apologetic and did her best to smooth the situation.

UrfQF8C5zJUxmJt_XsJOqA.text: Amazing Food & Service! I came here before when it was Sugar Factory. Def a toned down atmosphere but still super chic and modern.  I sat on the outdoor patio and had great view of the Bellagio fountains! We started off with the Spinach Dip. So cheesy and fresh, tender artichoke. It was served with home made pita and tortilla chips. I had chicken tortilla soup that was on the creamy side, great! Chunks of tender chicken & nice blend of spices. For my entree I had the scallops. OMG! Must order. They are huge and buttery and topped with I think pancetta. We complimented our meal with a wine flight which was really nice and included a cabernet, rose, port, and chardonnay. For desert we had chocolate cheesecake. Another amazing menu item! Decadent with oreo crust, peanut butter caramel sauce, topped with caramel popcorn. This is def a place to try! Sit on the patio and people watch !

hmnCVjemNLXueJ-AXHfX0w.text: Formally The Sugar Factory at Paris Hotel. The was good then and it's still very good now. Portions are good and comparable to the prices. Menu is simple but a good variety to choose from. The gift shop has been changed to restaurant and bar with live music at night. We were lucky to have been seated in the new section since it only opened on New Year's Eve. The only negative was the tables. The tables are bar tables which is fine for a bar but for eating? Nope. 4 plates with 2 waters put the table st full capacity. No room for anything else. There are larger tables for bigger groups. Check this place out. You will enjoy your visit.

_NqvIa3ZfzRBqypgWEBbaA.text: Taking advantage of two visitors and a pair of holiday weekends to revisit several of 2017's best meals it was as a party of five that Brunch was enjoyed at HEXX Kitchen + Bar inside Paris Las Vegas, the city's best 24/7 Restaurant now a three-year tradition at Christmas and this year doubling as a 21st Birthday celebration for one guest at the table.   Always a Restaurant testing the limitations of its space and clientele, the appointment of Due Forni's Carlos Buscaglia to top Toque earlier this year ushering in the complete overhaul of a Dinner menu that now holds its own against any Restaurant of its ilk while surpassing many 'fine dining' spaces in terms of creativity, it was just past 11:00am on Sunday morning that hostesses led patrons to a lengthy indoor banquet reserved earlier that week, a pleasant young woman stopping by within moments to take drink orders of Coffee for most, plus one Potion for the guest of honor.   Once again featuring shockingly efficient service for a place that does so much volume, Mr. Stotland keeping a watchful eye over the expansive space and coordination of servers with bussers seamlessly filling drinks and clearing plates without ever feeling late or intrusive, it was in three courses that Brunch was consumed beginning with HEXX's famous Fruit Plate, the collection this time highlighted by Papaya and Pineapple best dipped in Coconut Whip while the Dragon Fruit was far sweeter than usual, both on the plate and as incorporated into the "Magick Dragon" that billowed smoke upon service with a flavor not dissimilar to the Red Icee's served at the movie theater.  Investing in both old and new favorites throughout a two-hour meal, the portions seemingly larger than past visits as relates to both sweets and savories, it was with many focused on the fluffy Brioche Sticky Bun that regulars reveled in the return of Chef Matt Piekarski's Carrot Cake Pancakes, the item now back on the Brunch Menu every bit as good as memory serves with lightly spiced Batter fluffy and moist beneath a mound of Cream Cheese Frosting.  Sharing all plates family-style, the carbohydrate-heavy first course taking its toll on lighter appetites despite several plates to follow, it was to wide eyes that servers next delivered HEXX's Benny replacing English Muffins with cheesy Potatoes alongside a stacked Breakfast Croissant and Chilaquiles with a lot of spice and several still-crisp Tortilla Chips, plus an oversized order of the typically Dinner-only fried Broccolini.  Admittedly a lot of Food, the Parmesan Potatoes particularly dangerous when accounting for portion and likelihood of going back for seconds, it was after a brief respite with one guest already waving the white flag that four all-new Desserts were delivered, Pastry Chef Mirada proving a worthy successor to Carol Garcia with thick Pumpkin Brulee that eats like Pot de Creme with a caramelized top plus a boozy Shake served next creamy confetti Cheesecake and equally rich Marshmallow Semifreddo beneath crumbled Graham Crackers and Fudge made from HEXX's bean-to-bar Chocolate.  Not quite finished yet, a tableside Tiramisu still in-process as the last drops of Amaretto trickled through Coffee Beans to Almond Cake below, it was by way of advanced order that Brunch finished with a custom White Cake filled with Strawberries and Cream, @cakegirl702 living up to her name in terms of both design and taste even though most were too full to enjoy it until later.

IHs3dDkxJCxiOE23dWf5aw.text: Considering this place was open late, we decided to eat here after walking around the strip. We ordered a couple apps and a burger to share. The guacamole was a little bland but I enjoyed the pork rinds that came with it. The charcuterie board was amazing. Fresh baked pretzel, with meats and cheeses alongside stone ground mustard was awesome. The bun served with our burger was made with white chocolate. Which sounds weird but it was really really good as well. The only thing that offset all this was the service. It was a little busy on the patio, and the server forgot about us a couple times.

Service was awesome - they refilled my water glass (which tasted so good) at least ten times.  Really enjoyed eating at the HEXX kitchen.

5a8YKabEhSuqyiLB0M8lew.text: Pretty good food, service isn't bad, but the price is a lot for what you're getting! The menu has a couple vegetarian options which is great.

vfd01hfR-tgFslDa9bUHIg.text: Excellent patio views of the Bellagio fountain. The food is okay, and the service is great, so overall it's a great experience.

jh02-4qvcaHlINOAyTySZg.text: I was really excited to try this place. The atmosphere here is very modern and casual, and the servers were very nice. Unfortunately, all of our food came out cold. We waited about 45 minutes for our food, so we think it was sitting in the kitchen. We also ordered a bunch bowl, which tasted great though was made very weak. That said, the costumer service was great and they discounted the bill. Overall, loved the atmosphere and service, but not so much the food.

5H0H_4sCh-ljOc7UjX3dYA.text: Great breakfast and drinks! Nice ambiance. Good service. We were there around 10:00 am on a Tuesday and got a great table next to the patio. Waiter was pleasant. Would definitely eat here again. Ordered the Cinnamon roll waffle and had them add fresh berries. Berries were delicious and lots of them! Bloody Mary was too spicy even though I ordered it with just a little spice, but the flavor and strips of bacon made up for it. Hubs had chiliquilles and enjoyed it. His strawberry jalapeno margarita was amazing!

jYCL_Rwp9D6f14GjmAerBw.text: We came again a few months ago. This time for lunch. After having set the bar sooo high the first time we were hoping for a duplicate experience. The funny thing is we were really looking forward to breakfast here again and came at the exact same time as before but they were not serving breakfast anymore. we must of just missed it.  We had to get the purple haze drink again and at $38.00 it did not disappoint. Again this may seem like a lot of money but it is enough for 2-3 people so it is well worth it and gathers attention :)  I had the prime beef dip and my wife had the turkey club. Both were very good. Fries were excellent. You can also taste the quality of food.   A little pricey for lunch but it's Las Vegas and has a beautiful view if you sit outside. We recommend you try this place at least once :)

Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best corn beef hash I ever had! From first trip.

8OIfhogKHvYCaGWav53WxQ.text: Good atmosphere  Nice outside seating Live entertainment   - i ordered the clam chowder and it was too thick. So thick that it did not move. The waitress agreed and took it off the bill  - the monkey bread that comes with the soup can be shared by two to three ppl. It taste great!  - the cheesy bread is amazing but u have to ask for mariner to go with it  - the tomato salad was good. But they dot the balsamic all over the plate that is pointless. Lots of tomato and very little mozzarella   - the crispy chicken skewers were good

qgYol495GNhhSRDZhVi5sg.text: We visited HEXX to celebrate a friend's birthday. The servers were very attentive and helpful. The food is fresh and flavorful, and we really enjoyed the ambience!  Can't go wrong with the bottomless mimosas!

muq56nL1JCx5G48tTNEjfg.text: Our server was Apollo... He was amazing. With the help of his recommendations we had a wonderful breakfast of vegetarian omelettes and hash browns. We're also able to enjoy the scrambled eggs with crispy bacon and home fries that are simply Delicious. they make their English muffins in house and have a delicious strawberry jam that is made right in their kitchen. this is a definite must return as there were so many other items on the menu we would love to try. Thank you Apollo for helping us start our day with a great meal.

iyJIvW4a3dKaAw62n1bH0Q.text: Wow! JUST WOW! My friends and I happened upon this place by a Paris employee's recommendation. This place didn't disappoint. The ambiance was so cool. The beats were going and the wait staff were all so friendly as we walked in.   Ok the food.....We started off with the garlic cheese bread as an appetizer - OMG! It was so to die for! I also had a turkey bacon sandwich w/ fries. It was good. Not over the top amazing, but good. My friend loved her bottomless mimosas. In fact, the whole restaurant did. lol They were always close by to refill, so everyone loved that. Lots of "happy" people in our section.  But, the service, can I say was out of this world! We had Tracy as our server and man, she seriously is the best. She was so friendly, attentive, gave good recommendations and full of laughs. She had our whole section cheering her name. No seriously we chanted it all afternoon long. Lol Every employee who passed by our table always kept us laughing & smiling the whole time we were there. We seriously sang to hits from Aaliyah, Backstreet Boys & more.  I'll be back in Vegas 2 more times in the next 7 weeks and yeah, I'll definitely be stopping in again and again. Thanks for a fun Sunday afternoon, guys!   PS Tracy deserves a raise! I'm just sayin'!

H08Klyx8Ml2WZasx8JjztQ.text: Mmmmmmmm BRUNCH! Cinnamon bun waffles! So so good. Also, this place was almost smoke free (during the day) which was a HUGE PLUS after realizing there is almost no place to escape the clouds of cigarette (and other) smoke in this town.   Highly recommend Hexx for brunch!

sew8IYoIT32V7_i_VPBduQ.text: This is my favorite breakfast in Vegas! Tolu was an incredible server!! He was so attentive and courteous! The view of the bellagio fountains and the bottomless mimosas changed my life! 100% recommend this place!!

sHd0HR6n-k1MpGWSQ6U9IQ.text: I've had better service and food. However, the views were great.  Ask for in door seating if you are not a fan of the water mister. Lastly, be ready for the CNF tax.

zFpp00n2DcjFsSDzrIpGbg.text: The food is good here but our waiter was very rude! I'm giving 3 stars for the good food but we actually didn't enjoyed the food because of the attitude of our waiter! We decided to seat outside. By the time we placed our order it gets cold and windy so we ask the waiter if it is possible to turn on the heater!? He laughed and say no! We assumed he is joking and he's gonna turn it on anytime soon. After about 30 minutes he came back and we politely asked him if it is possible to turn the heater on! He just gave us an attitude and said " you are sitting outside"!!!!! SERIOUSLY!!!!?? Then why do you have heaters outside?!?!?!? Why is it hard for people to give a little explanation?! What kind of customer service is that???

P05tkvIqwM10XvM-FjsK9w.text: Phil's shrimp salad was really lovely. The shrimps were beautifully cooked and seasoned, and the sauce on the salad was awesome. My croissant was a little dry, but filled to bursting with ham. I asked for some aioli, which fixed the dryness.  The reason for my 5 stars here is the service. Watching the staff, It was obvious who was in charge. The "manager" was like a hawk. He discreetly managed all of the staff, as well as working hard himself to make sure that customers were looked after. Very good to see, well done.

3BDXcb1bWoP__-rUTaB4Yg.text: Pricey ...Good food, good service.... BUT (and this is a huge but) BEWARE! There is an extra charge they put on your receipt it says "cnf"...  I paid my bill and wondered the whole way to the car what cnf meant and why I paid an extra around 5% for our food. Thinking it was a tax I just paid it. Come to find out it is like a resort fee! According to a website I found about it, "it is like a resort fee, but unlike resort fees, you get absolutely nothing for your money. At all. Whatsoever." What a rip! Not coming back here again. The greediness for money left a bad taste in my mouth.

WOnJVCFa1MipzxgU4C1X4w.text: Absolutely amazing! JJ our service was fantastic, best service we have ever had in Vegas to date. I highly recommend you make reservations in advance. I recommend doing the shares drinks as I attached a pic. Try to go around 12:00 so you can also catch the best view of the Bellagio show! This place is a Vegas MUST!!!

2lhtLPtCTTePruABj-DOXg.text: Ari, the "manager" is the only reason why I'm giving this place 1 star, if it weren't for him I'd give them 5. This place is 1 of my favorite brunch/breakfast spots. Great great food! But when it comes to service with "Ari" the so called manager HORRIBLE. He is not OK with service animals. Basically discrimination with the way he looks at you and your Animal. I was here last night and back today. Had a great time last night, great food. But Mr Ari def made today's experience horrible.

vkGmdDdrP3UrTu9IegUWVw.text: What a beautiful place to enjoy a meal on the strip.  You can sit inside where it is cool and enjoy a stylish atmosphere or sit outside and watch people as they drunkenly pass by while singing songs and laughing.  We had a party of 6 and sat outside.  The drinks were phenomenal and the food was also equally outstanding.  What really made them stand out was that they knew we were celebrating anniversaries, birthdays and an engagement so they brought over cupcakes with candles in them.  Nice touch. Our waitress was very kind and always made sure we had everything we needed and quickly. Reservations were made easily and we were seated very quickly.  If you are looking for something to fill you up, while you people watch, this is the place to go.

uBPEmFHC_dYLVJRZj9DHtg.text: A must! This place was so awesome. I enjoyed the decor here.  It was so inviting. You'll want to hang out all day. It was packed and just a 20 minute wait for two! The bar top was open so we sat there. I ordered the Carrot Cake Pancakes lol. I know what your thinking what!!!! They were Fantastic. They had shredded carrots cooked in and came with a Cream cheese topping and a special kind of syrup! My taste buds were having a dance partyyyyyyy! I didn't use much of the syrup. It wasn't  needed. The pancakes were huge and came in a stack of four! (Totally Sharable)! The service could of been better but they were busy and he was nice just overwhelmed. The food totally made up for that. See you next time crew! I'll be back soon.

BQZqpme0YQrYbNpurzXlEA.text: We visited here back at the beginning of May. What a great experience! The wait that was told to us would be 30min only took about 3. We were seated on the patio right by the rail so we could watch all the free entertainment of people watching vegas has to offer. The food was delicious and the restaurant was very clean and very elegant without being overdone or making you feel unwelcome wearing you shorts in the vegas heat!  The wait staff was on it! Normally when you get unlimited mimosa's they are either watered down or you can never find your waiter to get a refill. Not the case here, the glass would hardly even hit bottom before someone was refilling it. The mix was great too, not just all orange juice like some places. We did have an issue with my Bloody Mary not coming out but they were prompt to fix it and make good on it.  My favorite thing was our waitress Tracee. She was truly amazing. If you have read some of my reviews I always try and point wait staff that do an exceptional job because no matter how good the food is your waiter or waitress can make or break a visit. She was fantastic, funny, well educated and just made us all feel like we were regulars on our fist visit.  I made it a point to save the receipt just so I have her name.  I will request her on my next visit and be happy to wait the whole 30min if I had to just to sit in her section! Thank you Tracee you truly made our visit special and memorable.  Also, side note, she is not afraid to shoo away the panhandlers trying to sell bead or whatnot over the rail! Haha!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some sort of cinnamon roll deliciousness

092_0_OXHWpmHBkO-VrX2Q.text: Go to spot when in Vegas.  Everything Ive tried is delicious and great service.  Well def keep coming back.

lSz-AzkBwnCHq-75ffENrQ.text: Great food and delicious drinks. I loved the ambiance and atmosphere of this place it had a laid back chill vibe to it. I enjoyed the person they had sing live he had some chill laid back music. Our waiter was cool and quick with the service. If your every in Vegas check this place out.

y-VWZjPJhFhNrgwXOFrOyA.text: An amazing dinner! First,  they were able to take us (2) as walk ins on Saturday night.  The wait staff was so kind. I asked for a non alcoholic beverage and the bartender created a concoction for me.  My friend had the Hexx Fusion,  and she recommends it.  We ended up ordering steaks,  filet mignon.  Cooked to our exact preferences. Delicious.  The seasoning wasn't overwhelming.  We ordered two sides,  brussel sprouts and mashed potatoes.  Oh man,  they were divine.  We also ordered dessert. The Blueberry Corn Crisp. Unique - it was really good!  My favorite thing was sitting on the patio.  Watching the water show.  And we weren't rushed.  We spent almost 2 hours there.  It rejuvenated us.  Courteous staff.  I recommend the patio seating if possible.

QBIIzBBeCbzTMmuyb2TLbw.text: So good !!!!! Let the picture speak for its self. Best chilaquiles :) Iv been wanted them ever since ! The chicken and waffle were yummy also

EtuvDBOtJWXZvQn5yGAQEQ.text: Loved this place ! Very interesting but amazing food! We had a great time with a beautiful view. We had a dish off the menu, that was so delicious and very refreshing!

Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Off the menu, lychee granita.

_DMuo62wRTh1Vzl42V6jCw.text: The absolute best eggs benedict ever!!!  Every time we visit Las Vegas, we have breakfast here (sometimes more than once in the same trip) and always order the HEXX BENEDICT: poached eggs, scalloped potatoes, canadian bacon asparagus, and hollandaise.  Staff is friendly and it has views of the Bellagio fountains.  Hexx kitchen + bar is a hidden little gem in a city full of glitz and glamor!

zynNdNxXtue56CNNb6yZFw.text: Had an amazing dining experience at Hexx! Would love to go back when we make a trip to Vegas again. We didn't make any prior reservations but got seated pretty quickly. We got a nice spot from where we could see the Bellagio fountain every 15 minutes.  Our server Jessica was super cool and was very nice to us. We wanted to try one of the Hexx Potions since it looked very interesting and asked her to suggest something from that list. She suggested us the Purple Haze and that was absolutely amazing!! The whole experience from the way she poured the drink into the pitcher to the point we tasted it was memorable(See video). We couldn't finish the drink but in Las Vegas, it is okay to carry alcohol in a to-go glass and that is exactly what we did. The Desert Smash from the Speciality Cocktails was nice too.  In the food, we had the Baked Spinach dip with bagel chips. The dip was very creamy and yummy. Bagel chips were something different and were nice and crisp and were a perfect accompaniment to the dip. Gnocchi Pomodoro was for my husband and he enjoyed it with additions of more veggies which cost 2 bucks/serving. I had a Halibut which came alongside tomato risotto, lime coconut broth & herb salad. The risotto and the broth were so yummy that I kept wanting more. The fish was poached beautifully to perfection! Absolutely delicious. To end our dinner which rather turned into a feast at this point, we had a Red Velvet Cake which was such a beautiful sight and super classy. It was just the perfect quantity for two.  Rating the following out of 5:  AMBIANCE - 5 Loved the ambiance. Quiet and beautiful.   FOOD- 5 Everything deserves a 5!!  CUSTOMER SERVICE - 5 Jessica was amazing!! :)  WAIT TIME - 5 No wait time.  HYGIENE - 5  PARKING -  We walked down from our hotel. Parking in Vegas, especially the strip is a bit cumbersome so it is better to take Uber/Lyft.  Also, this restaurant is 24/7 which is awesome!

ArHeF-iXNsudOkkGNSVlmQ.text: Fantastic butter lettuce salad, perfectly fresh with a fine balance of flavors. Delighful staff.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour menu

z0tRbSL6MV8D-E8K8K3tkg.text: The brunch here was quite delicious! We were looking for a classy low key spot on the Vegas strip and this place hit the spot. We had the hash and it was absolutely delicious take on a fairly common recipe.

z6nj7GdlukYzlgbC7MDBLQ.text: the food was great. I had the hexx burger. it looks strange when you see the white chocolate bun but it's actually pretty good. the sweetness is not too strong but it balances the salty of the burger. the choice of beers though it's not that great.

4tSoQtSoT3WqLvZO0YOC2A.text: We had an amazing experience! The restaurant is beautiful. Food was delicious. Best of all our server Sean was great! Such a great experience. We could have had lunch anywhere but I'm glad we chose here as the service was amazing!!!!

1VfTl5PnXDmlIj1knnqbeg.text: I was sad to see Sugar Factory go, but I have one a half hour away at home so all is good there... this is the NEW Sugar Factory located across the street from the Bellagio Fountains right outside Paris.  They are also open 24 hours.  Their breakfast menu appealed to me, but we stopped in for lunch on our last day in Vegas before heading to the airport.  2 chicken sandwiches, one turkey club, 2 glasses of sangria = $98!!!  Yes, the food was good however being in Vegas and all, it's pricey.  My friends ordered the chicken sandwich and I got the turkey club which was actually too big for most people's mouths...I had to remove the inner piece of bread.  I was debating getting chicken & waffles but I ended up with the sandwich paired with the white sangria which was delicious!  I asked our server for a recommendation, she gave us the white.  Good location...good service.  Next door you can find ice cream, cookies, chocolate, all kinds of neat gifts - none which I bought, but this place is absolutely worth a visit while browsing the Vegas strip!

7f9LptAGhHiBOAe8NfyFPA.text: Bottomless mimosas for brunch, a good people watching view & competent menu top off this kinda tepid hotel/casino restaurant. It & the bar above have good views of the fountains @ the Bellagio.

oaAoUbTnZo71cYYV5c24Bw.text: My wife and I have walked past this place several time, but thought it was just a snack place with lots of sweets and ice cream.  We tried their restaurant.  The prices were fair for Vegas.  I had the rib eye, which was made to my liking and my wife had the jambalaya.  Her plate was spicy with a great taste.  The waiter asked if we would like some garlic bread.  The bread was also good, but it was charged separately, which we didn't know.    For dessert, we shared a brownie and ice cream, which wasn't on the menu.  The brownie was delicious and it was complemented nicely with the coffee ice cream.  We use a groupon we found without any hassle.  Great service from our waiter and staff.  It was a place I would try again.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib Eye steak, medium charred with asparagus.

LrFEHP6gWCysaHte5hmpjQ.text: Do. Not. Get. The. Tiramisu. At least if you do order it, don't put the amaretto sauce on it or else it ends up a mushy river of sauce. All I was craving was some dessert and a nice piece of tiramisu sounded amazing, but this tiramisu was truly horrible. I give 2 stars because the service was nice and the "fried mozzarella" was yummy. We were just so disappointed that all we could do was laugh at the money we wasted on the worst tiramisu I've ever had. This is not classic tiramisu at all, this is another Vegas restaurant overcharging in attempts to be different. You're better off walking down to Cheesecake Factory for a nice dessert.

ggbTDfGacEvYdZVkONb_EQ.text: Delicious! Drinks were great, apps amazing and dinner was all perfect..all 6 of us lived it! Deff recommend!

Eo8R9Qio8AI7ymwYlW1R6g.text: OK I might be biased because I came here off of a Foodie Tour (do it!) and we had an exclusive experience. We were ushered in like royalty into the back kitchen where they proceeded to show us the entire process of how they make chocolate! We got to ask questions and film everything and taste the differences. It was incredible! Then were were escorted out to their balcony outside which is under the Eiffel Tower with a view of the Bellagio Fountains to try a few AMAZING desserts.   We had the chef bring out the following:  E S P R E SS O TO R T E tanzania chocolate, espresso foam, cookie crumble C H O CO L AT E P U D D I N G tanzania chocolate, cocoa nib infused cream, banana bread crumble  There was one fore that i'm forgetting... but i don't think you can go wrong!

lKHQJqd3No45L9hb2X5tqQ.text: We went on a packed Sunday afternoon for late brunch. The service was a little slow however our waiter Sean did the best he could.  He was very polite and apologized for the wait and took his time to explain/suggest everything.  He kept running back and forth to check in on us.  I appreciate that because even though I understand you are busy, standards should be met.  I could see he was working hard.  He and Abram took good care of us under the circumstances.  The food was great too.  I ordered the chilaquiles and my husband ordered the steak and eggs.  We both enjoyed our meals very much.  Portion was good as well.  Overall this place was great.  I don't really love the price but...it's Vegas, it's expected.  :)

FCHojMpy2eIW4xFazxf0MQ.text: Best corned beef hash that I've ever had in my life & bottomless mimosas $23.. I'm in love.

DQsVVQSOW9MfhP_ZLHPMsA.text: Fun atmosphere, not too crowded, bottomless mimosas!! Right across from bellagio fountains!! Taylor is the BEST server, I will be back here next time I'm in Vegas because of her! We never found the bottoms of our mimosas, and felt welcome all 3 hours we were here!!

KmLEVPfZbeAy_UdSIgMlFA.text: Make sure to get a table on the patio over looking the Bellaggio fountains! They have umbrella outside that cover most of the table depending on time of day. We had a groupon and went there for happy hour and midday snack. Happy hour is only at the bar inside. We did the cheese & meat plate with wine and a dessert. Would go again for appetizers since the entree items were not that impressive. Service was great and the view is worth it.

Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizers with wine

wUrH4QVYP9YSHBv6O51JwA.text: Great place for brunch! The service was great, delicious food and everyone kept making sure our mimosa glasses stayed FULL! Will definitely be returning here for brunch.

796mGAQzvxksOd4LdC5jKQ.text: I was here 2 times during my stay and was not disappointed. I had the chilaquiles the first day and they were amazing! They were crunchy and spicy just how they are supposed to be! The next day I had the brioche French toast, super yummy!! I just wish they served the chocolate pancakes in weekends too because I really wanted to try them!

kbw3JRKVS5aYto9TQpqmRQ.text: This place is good every time we come to Vegas! Service was great, my mimosa was never empty! Sean and Alex we're great - highly recommend this restaurant !

Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon sausage pizza - great with red hot sauce!

_qH938I6O_x8LRArO-a6zA.text: Food is great! Try egg Benedicts and chicken flat bread; it was delicious. If you come for breakfast or brunch this is the place for you. Over looking the strip, with bottoms up mimosa.

dJF2DW33yKFDOXrWbNW8TQ.text: The service, food, and vibe are so great! i was waiting for over 30 minutes on a slow friday, but it was all worth it! The prime rib was my fav & the chocolate cheesecake!

d2ny7UM_RnMFPNdKSJOy9A.text: Very good food. Great patio for people watching on the strip. Chicken and waffles were so yummy! Our server Sean was friendly and checked on us several times. Thanks Sean!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super yummy chicken and waffles!

_x-PjmYMt2bTiSv2FGS3jA.text: Came back again and had their spicy jambalaya....omg, delicious and spicy!  i loved it, came with shrimp, chicken and sausage

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Jambalaya

oFkypwz0cmAl_j80cqemxQ.text: Extremely disappointed! Being locals we wanted a night out just to watch the tourists, we heard this was a good place since they have outside seating so we came here. Well it took our server 20 mins to greet us. She then took an extra 15 mins to grab our drinks and forgot one of them. The food presentation was nice but the food did lack flavor. We got the salmon, cauliflower and the hexx salad. Any who the busser was very attentive he always cleared out our table and was the one who ended up getting the rest of our drink order.   It definitely wasn't busy so there is no reason for this.   Ps: it would have also been nice if they would have offered us a cocktAil or dessert menu.

WToqRgt6-sQr-X85ZRhbog.text: Came here for my best friends 21st! Great place and fun atmosphere. Ask for Tolu, he was awesome!

2uXd6Acn51Scn0D9kywFcA.text: We went to Hexx for brunch on a Saturday morning and had a great experience. The atmosphere is classy and fun, with good lighting. The food was very sweet and very good. The cappuccinos and hot chocolate are both very tasty.   I shared the apple cinnamon pancakes and protein omelet with my sister. Both tasted great and the dishes were HUGE. So so much food, we couldn't finish it all. My boyfriend ordered chicken and waffles which were amazing! I'd order that next time!! All dishes were very good and very filling!   The service at Hexx was exceptional - Tracee was the BEST waitress we've had on our whole Las Vegas trip! It was my boyfriend's birthday and she brought out his chicken and waffles with candles and got the entire restaurant singing happy birthday, cheering and celebrating with us! It was so special and fun!!   Overall, one of the better restaurant experiences in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon waffle
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon apple pancakes

laWW0AZ90b6dQmqg7Xj0QA.text: This place is great, the food was delicious and the bottomless mimosas were truly bottomless. The staff was very friendly also. We will definitely be back.

eL_S92UgoKzclBis7hvH_w.text: Our waiter was super attentive and polite. The food was great! Everything that Brunch with the girls should be! Bottomless Mimosas and amazing food what more do you want! A definitely stop when in Vegas.

P-bP2khly1ybBay5VDZ-9Q.text: This place is great for breakfast and brunch.  Service was good and the prices were ok by Vegas standards.  We went on our last day in LV and by the time we were done chatting with our server and drinking bottomless mimosas, we ended up extending our trip by a day.  If you are in the area I'd definitely recommend trying this place.

smBR5r-cQyV9xbMQ6hclSw.text: Although you're in Sin City, there's nothing sinful about eating chocolate! Well, unless you eat too much and then you're a glutton... Or maybe you have too much pride and skip eating chocolate because you're too concerned about your figure... Or if you bypass the chocolate, and as a result you get angry and it invokes your wrath... Or if you decide to eat chocolate, but eat too much and people think you're greedy...  ...Ok, well I guess you're damned if you do and you're damned if you don't, but hey, it's Vegas so go indulge at Hexx!  We were lured in with the promise of a build-your-own ice cream sandwich, but before we could partake in that very serious business we were sidetracked by a chocolate tasting. That's right, we sat down at a bar and sampled several bits of chocolate and real hot coccoa for free! Each bit was better than the last, and when I announced my favorite, they hit me with a sample of that kind of chocolate made into hot chocolate. It was awesome. Moreover, we watched the staff hand pick coccoa beans for quality control while we ate all that chocolate.  We made an ice cream sandwich made out of (1) peanut butter and Reese Pieces cookie, (1) snicker doodle cookie and stracciatella ice cream. It seemed to make sense at the time and it certainly satisfied.  Two thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Handcrafted ice cream sandwich

3mgk72WgzyROxEZt8gG5Fg.text: Hexx is a bit of a Vegas tradition for me, I always go there the day I leave. Well, mostly for one specific menu item: the chicken and waffles, available for breakfast and dinner (!), are very probably the best I have ever had. The waffle is.golden and perfect, the chicken is fried but not so heavily breaded that it's more greasy skin than chicken. It all goes together perfectly into my favorite food for any time of day.   Well, that's the upside. The chicken and waffles are perfect. Get them. Now for the downside: like most strip restaurants, Hexx is definitely too expensive for what it is. It is a pretty nicely decorated and kept restaurant right off the Paris and with Las Vegas Blvd frontage, but for the price I'd expect good service, but the service at Hexx always seems a little scattered and disorganized. I mean the classic two people trying to take your drink order and then the waiter not being sure they put in your food order right.

sLn2wqkWndy2HP1u-baQXA.text: Sooo, I finally made it to Hexx Kitchen, after passing by dozens of times.  I was NOT disappointed!! We were greeted by friendly hostesses, and seated promptly, even though our group was fairly large. Ordered the smothered fries (huge portions), and they came out hot & delicious.  The chicken & waffles were really good as well.   The menu is very diverse, with something for everyone. One thing I would like to see -- better beverage options. No fresh lemonade, specialty teas etc....only coke (fountain) products. Overall, the service, atmosphere, and food were great!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smothered Fries

jmXWFqVfoxmk62T3I74aCw.text: The pros: great location for people watching, friendly enough staff, best breakfast potatoes EVER  The cons: the music was INSANELY loud both inside and outside. It was ridiculous. The eggs and omelettes were flat and tasteless. My server and his bussers spent their time dancing to the music, rather than attending to tableS.  This was a very disappointing experience, to say the least.

rm-4TBqJVd1-85u9UPpJew.text: Apolo and billy provided the best table service ive had so far during my stay in vegas, and the brunch was delicious- each plate cooked perfectly with careful consideration to building flavors.

JaSAGK5HpVF6NKnS4jaIsw.text: Service : 5 stars ! Ambience : 5 stars ! Menu Choices : 5 stars ! Taste of food : 5 stars ! Presentation: 5 stars ! Prices : very reasonable!! Drinks : absolutely delicious  Final Verdict : Highly recommended !!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aFgM2OUUCHDcnCrec3GQyg.text: Just ate here and let me tell you the food is amazing. I got the tomato bisque and garlic bread and it was the best tomato bisque ive ever had. I wanted to try the crab cakes but was too full i highly recommend it though. My cousin got the waffles and said it was light and airy. Thomas H was out waiter and he was beyond attentive got us everything told us about the menu and told us his favorite things on it. He was superb and by far the best waiter ive met on this trip. I hope management recognizes him for it!  Atmosphere great modern and cool vibe! Great for brunch! And music is great

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato bisque

XnXJte2wtxQLKzAbgycAWQ.text: Being locals we don't hang out on the strip much, but I'm glad we did! We went to Hexx for brunch this last weekend and we were pleasantly surprised. The view and atmosphere were great, as well as the food. My niece is vegan and although the menu didn't have vegan options,our server went above and beyond to explain the vegan options that were available. The service was fantastic, Raphael was funny and knowledgeable in regards to the menu.. top notch service! Management had a strong presence on the floor, being in the service industry myself I really appreciated that. Allison and Andrew were very helpful and attentive. Overall, we had an awesome time and we will be back.

O990UzsTrJyIjfiAQcQSmA.text: Sean has taken great care of us! He was very attentive and gave us great suggestions on everything. We were celebrating a birthday and he made sure that we had everything we needed and more i highly recommend it! great service will definitely come back !

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QtN6kwQq_uA_WZe4BFmxLA.text: We had an excellent experience here.  The food was very good and reasonably priced.  We also had expedient service.  The colossal bloody mary may be best shared as it was...well, colossal.

ADwvIhXqhiwpo5WALiNsjw.text: Hype......long wait even after seating. Food was bland. Had the chicken and waffles. Chicken had no flavor. Waffle was good though. Ordered the veggie omelet for my wife. She said it was okay.  I'm writing this review while I wait for my check which will take a while for them to bring anyway. The atmosphere is nice though, the service kind of kills it. They are nice, just not sufficient. I asked for hot sauce, God knows where that is now.  Prob nice to try atleast once. Paris doesn't have any other nicer place anyway.

yVSux_FSme_eihyTGTjdyQ.text: Although I still miss the Sugar Factory (the menu was better as far as I am concerned); this is still one of my 'go-to' restaurants when in Vegas. You can not beat the great view of the fountains (and the people watching - just wait for a patio table, it is worth it). Highly suggest this for brunch, but a late night bite is also great (their charcuterie plate is top notch).  The ambience inside is also pretty good, but they could turn the music down a little so you can actually have conversations at your table without having to almost yell at each other.  This time around there was a True shining star, which is why I am finally writing a review for this spot... Raphael. ASK FOR HIM; you will not be sorry! What an AWESOME waiter; fun, friendly, jovial, prompt, quality-driven and all-around just good at his job.

X23jO7nGOrxx8VPc5MC0aw.text: Bottomless mimosas were good and always full! Carrot cake pancakes and potatoes were fantastic and the omelette was pretty average. Service was great and food came out quickly. Overall was a great spot to sit outdoors and spend a morning eating breakfast, drinking and people watching on the strip.

yoA_Z1wS6AY8xuee3ecNsw.text: Service was awesome. Lupe gave us great recommendations and was very excited about the food here! I had the short ribs with Brussel sprouts and I have to say I've never had better brussels in my life. They were perfection. My husband had the scallops and he really enjoyed them. For dessert we had the cake and shake and it was the perfect light dessert to end an amazing meal.

c0BhmkfnixUnFXLRBgYyyA.text: I planned a family vacation to Las Vegas and wanted a special dinner for our first night. There are hundreds of excellent restaurants to choose from and Hexx is at the top of the list.  Great view, amazing food and service that was attentive to all our needs.  Michael Main, the GM, went out of this way to make this a special night for our family.  The wait staff was attentive and perfectly timed the delivery of the appetizers and food.  On a night that was 105 degrees, the waiters made sure our water glasses were always filled.  As for the food...the fennel sausage pizza was amazing as was the Margherita pizza.  The Chicken and Waffles was the best my son has ever had (and he has had that dish many times) and the two pasta dishes were magnificent.  There are a lot of great restaurants in Vegas, but is a MUST visit restaurant.  By the way, the Banana Sundae is a must. Get multiple spoons if you must, but this is Vegas, so treat yourself to a great dessert.

3RpP6RzmF79FswID6AMI-w.text: Breakfast is excellent! Esp the crossiant and brioche French toast! Amazing! The waitress was extremely nice!

NO3zA_PIE7Rm2QEceVfBug.text: I had the same experience as Debbie B.   Horrible service and way overpriced.   The only good thing about this place is that you can sit outside by the strip, but not worth it.   Never again!

DixCtHL0i3VjSQHdpNPP7w.text: Simple salad.. 8 uncut pieces of butter lettuce with almost invisible cheese shreds and some chocolate shavings. The anti-pasto on the other hand for the same price was enough to split wi th 6 people as a generous side. I did not eat the simple salad - cheese was called snow white cheddar and it tasted like goat... ugh...  Service was strange. We had a party of 16 and 6 people's food came out over a half hour before the rest. Jambalaya, 27 bucks. The two ladies who ordered it could not eat more than a third due to the spice. Burger looked great but at 20 bucks you had to pay extra for fries. Marguerita Pizza ok. Wish it was fresh basil instead of pesto drizzle but I understand the twist.  I didn't care for it all in all. Service a bit funny - never had my water glass so well attended in my life to the point of annoyance.  Waiter brought out dessert forks for all so we thought there was comp dessert as it was a wedding reception and then he brought out one scoop of icecream and a brownie  then told the bride and groom they could pass it around the table... to 16 people... oy vey awkward. So overpriced.

mtLmOiGvEGWjN8Dguck8Og.text: We saw $20 bottomless mimosas on the street in front of the restaurant, so we decided to try it out. We came in 10 minutes after the breakfast and mimosa special had ended, but they let us order the mimosas anyway, which was great, but then it all went downhill. The restaurant appeared higher class, but looks can be deceiving. Our server did not get to us for 10 minutes, even though they weren't busy. We ordered the mimosas and food together since we had ample time to decide, and our server was very friendly, just extremely slow. Each mimosa took at least 15 minutes, and when the food came out, one dish was forgotten, and we had to wait an additional 20 minutes for my friend's order. The turkey club was good and a large serving, but the pasta dishes (pappardelle) were lacking flavor (hamburger helper has more). Aside from the food, I am a young woman with tattoos, but that doesn't make me a lower priority customer. The manager went around to every table except ours, for reasons why, I know not. Before ordering, I noticed they charged a 3.5% concession fee, which I had not encountered before. I asked our server, upon which she replied that she was new, so the manager would come over to explain. I had tried to flag him down before, but he seemed to avoid walking by our table. He finally came over, upon which I inquired about the fee (which was in small fine print in the menu, and on the receipt was labeled "cnf"). I wonder if only a few people had noticed this before, but when I asked, he responded that it was a fee associated as their position as a tenant in the casino as opposed to a free standing business.  I replied, "So, rent?" He curtly said "oh, um, yes," as he walked away. I wasn't allowed any follow up questions or comments before he fled, nor did he ask how our experience was at any point. Server was nice and new, so she was fine, I understand, I'm in the service industry, but the manager was incompetent, unprofessional, and completely lacked friendly people skills. Food was overpriced and bland. Will not return.

dJUM78Mr7zII-HPiqCXvQA.text: I recently went to Hexx kitchen and bar after doing some sight seeing we decided to stop here and have one more drink before going to our room the staff was outstanding. Our servers name was Jen and by far the best server I've had while dining on the strip. she was so educated on all the questions we had about the menu she told us to get the Hexx potion because it's great for sharing so we got the passion fruit margarita and ohemmgeee it was to die for!! I recommend it to everyone, it tasted delicious and so awesome to see the presentation on it as well. After getting our drink we ordered a quick snack. We got the crab cakes which were amazing as well we sat on the patio which overlooks the bellagio fountains even tho the fountains weren't running at the time it was still a great view to people watch. As we were finishing up Juan the manager stopped by and asked how our experience was going and gave us great ideas about sights to go see while in town he was so radiant and professional but making us feel like friends. I recommend this place to everyone! Thank you again Juan and Jen!

iGhCoaO--6J1Q3nDfvDU6A.text: HEXX is located in the front of Paris Hotel and Casino. It's open 24 hours, and that includes the bar and alcohol! They have entrances both on the Strip, and from inside the Paris casino. We were staying at the Paris, so stumbled onto this place when we saw the entrance from inside the casino, and glad that we did. We sat inside at the bar, and our bartender (Scott) was great!! We picked a couple things off of the menu, and they were both great. We really liked the selections to choose from. We got the smothered fries (awesome!), shrimp cocktail, soft pretzels with an amazing cheese dip, beef tartare. Everything was excellent. Prices seemed reasonable (as Vegas goes anyway). We planned on going back a couple days later, but that never happened. But we would return here anytime. Oh, and they are making their own chocolate in their candy store (attached to the restaurant via the street entrance). Great exotic chocolates to try at their "chocolate bar" with samples so you know which one you like. Plus a ton of other candies. So whether you stay at Paris or Planet Hollywood, which is close next door, stop in for a drink and food.

HN3Im_26RWZ7DOWBe4VtBQ.text: Very disappointed in the courtesy of staff. I can't comment on the food as I never had the opportunity to make it that far. I put my name in with my whole group and was told I would receive a text and must arrive within 10 minutes. The staff was already very curt demanding to count off the members of my party before I could put my name in. I received a text at 12:44 and arrived at the restaurant front desk at 12:53 with my party just behind me. The hostess, who's name I wish I got but was an older woman with dark hair, barely acknowledged me and when I inquired about my reservation stayed I would have to go to the bottom of the list for not arriving in 10 minutes, after showing her my phone that documented I received the text 9 minutes ago, she stated that she was sure she sent it 15 minutes ago. This is the equivalent of making up a rule that you can only drive 5 mph on a road and then pulling someone over for going 4 mph. If you are going to have your own insane rules at least follow them. I understand it is on a busy location in Vegas but maybe stop and think about what you are trying to do (i.e. Providing and experience for people) as opposed to trying to churn people through your restaurant.

4NOSOPgHrFg0okD71i1hbA.text: This place took over the Sugar Factory, although the majority of their food items remain the same. The biggest change comes to the drink menu, where the goblets with dry ice are no longer available. They've been replaced by giant martinis though and they still pack quite the punch-definitely good enough for 2 people. The food was still great-I got the burger on the white chocolate brioche which was AMAZING. Buffalo chicken croquettes were pretty good too, as well as the pasta my girlfriend ordered. Service was top notch-I cannot think of one complaint. Fast and friendly from being seated to paying our check and they gave me half off the beer I ordered because the one I originally wanted was out. Only knock on this place is that it's a little overpriced for what it is. Overall if you're looking for some tasty, imaginative American food this is the place to go. Just remember-no more goblets with the dry ice! It seemed like everyone came in confused that they were no longer available.

GdE-5w1MkfD4lOMUhZnmHQ.text: great service and I had the greatest time. the food was great and my server Daniel was so attentive and had a great personality! definitely coming back again

Z8VLGQGOrKwg3TqYPj-5Zg.text: Loved this cute ass restaurant off the strip! Went for brunch, the ambiance was great and they had some great selection for food. Indoor and cute outdoor patio seating! Prices were slightly high but expected for a great place like this on the strip.

P-l4-PLac5Se2vHdPbf-7A.text: Sean and Patrick was amazing , it was great service !! They are amazing ! First time to Vegas , made me Feel like I was at home!!! Great great service

hs6RvhuETXh5ztZvu7S1yg.text: I loved this place! Great food, service, location, views, etc. Hexx had it all! We had the tomato burrata salad (super yum!), short ribs (delish!), ribeye (so good!)

ynDxtMrXiSS89pLdn3vX2A.text: was not impressed by the food or service. My cup of water was empty and no refills. Service was slow, food was meh for the price. Will not return.

94Oursg4kyExE89ovOMOtw.text: We had a wonderful experience! Great spot for brunch and people watching. Food was fantastic. We ordered the French dip which was amazing. Bottomless mimosa was a great addition. Our server Brittany was fantastic. We will be back next time in Vegas!

1LRkWcjATDFCaKqf23UuLw.text: We arrived at our reservation for 7:45pm thinking that we had plenty of time before our theatre show at 9:30pm.  We were seated promptly and offered water.  We then had to remind someone to get our waiter so we could order after we had been waiting 15 minutes.  Another 10 minutes we get our drinks - glass of wine and a beer.  Another 25 minutes still no food.  We had ordered the Wagyu steaks ($60 steaks) - one fillet and one ribeye - both cooked medium rare with some side veggies.  We got the waiter's attention asked him about the food and told him we had a theatre show to make.  He said he would check.  Still no food.  Finally the steaks arrive at 9pm - 75 minutes after we arrived at the restaurant - all that for medium rare steaks.    The food was good - steaks were decent and veggies were tasty.  We didn't have enough time to finish the food and had to leave some of the meal - also no hope of dessert, we never even finished our meal.  We had to track down the waiter to get the check.  We finally got out of the restaurant but missed the first 10 minutes of our theatre show.  We complained to the manager while we waited on the check but he didn't do anything.  This was really poor performance and I will probably never go back to this restaurant again.  Also the fact that they did nothing to correct the problem makes me feel obligated to write this review and warn others - when things go wrong, restaurants need to fix it.

szJxtV9TxUUh8BuFTHyUHQ.text: Stopped in for some two for one drinks (courtesy of MyVegas Slots) and snacks to check out the place that was once The Sugar Factory Bar. All was good in my opinion and besides decor, an outside patio and a different cocktail menu...there were no other noticeable changes from the last time I stepped into this building.  Ordered some spinach artichoke dip, a Barrel-Aged Chocolate Manhattan and a Mandarin Mule. The dip brought nothing new to the table in terms of flavor from other spinach artichoke dips I've had but was good nonetheless.   The Barrel-Aged Chocolate Manhattan is where the party was. This cocktail was awesome! The chocolate infused Bourbon was strong and gave a nice aroma of chocolate and a hint of chocolate flavor. I'm not sure what role the sweet Vermouth might have played in this cocktail besides its inclusion of more alcohol. The more the better. This wasn't a drink you'd take back fast and move on. This was to be enjoyed slowly and I most definitely enjoyed it with every sip. The Manderin Mule was the opposite as it was good but a drink I consumed faster. This was on the more tangier and sweet side with a ginger flavor.   There was hungry friends back at the hotel so we ordered a custom topping pizza to go. A pepperoni, jalapeno and mushroom pizza that was delicious. There was also the Classic burger ordered by a friend who said it was delicious as well. I didn't get to try it for myself but this friend hasn't steered me wrong with good food so I'll take his word for it.   A pizza and that Manhattan is most definitely on my list to be ordered again at Hexx. I'll be making my way through the cocktail menu for others to try but you better believe the Barrel-Aged Chocolate Manhattan is being ordered right by its side or free if Myvegas Slots Loyalty Points are used again.  Snack 4/2/2016

8Z6Nxqvy_YjsdVe7U3E7Rw.text: Highly recommend for brunch! The restaurant set up is super cute! They have an outdoor/indoor concept with a large bar area. Brunch menu was great and features large drinks for groups! I ordered the pancakes and the syrup was infused with vanilla that gave them an amazing flavor! They offered healthy menu options and also some that were more indulgent like the cinnamon roll waffles! Great spot for a birthday brunch or bachelorette!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RDkoQlK4I2zuOGNS82gGjA.text: Ordered the Branzino only to find out that it changed to the Sea bass. Definitely not what I was looking for. Ended up with the Wagu burger, which was good but didn't live up to some of my expectations. One positive is my server was very accommodating. Will definitely go back to try a few more options.

E2zSXjc6L7DTDERpTWPp7g.text: My reservation somehow got lost, but the hostess work hard to make sure we got a seat around our original time! And of course food was amazing!

Tm7aYfrNBtsd4sTy78kHkw.text: Overall it was a very good breakfast. Food prices were great for Vegas but the coffee and drinks make it quite pricey. Boyfriend had the eggs benedict and loved it. I had the protein omelette which was very hearty just the spices were a bit much for breakfast.

0KLX9A6lXHnIKJun2DYqbQ.text: Sat outside and enjoyed the evening. Meal was very good. Heat lamps were an added pleasure.

wvD__QizJJAmOgZRpN2Tag.text: Worse service ever. Didn't get our appetizer and wait d a half hour to get our ticket.

03TyMdnc6XEUA3rU1wwFKg.text: Very good, and would definitely go back! The sweet roll is incredible, a bit heavy on the icing but that's how I like the anyway.  The variety of sangria is awesome, and very good, although our drinks take a bit long to get delivered.  Food was also good portioned and not overly expensive. We went for brunch.

1VaNeyOrdoFOhoM7Rv1sfg.text: Always come for bottomless mimosas, food is good and great atmosphere. Perfect location also!

PlOFUYe8C0GDYViNtaapOA.text: I arrived with my friends in Las Vegas and checked into our hotel around 11pm. We decided to check this place out. We ate at the bar and ordered the Margarita Pizza, Candied Bacon and Spinach & Artichoke dip. All of which were DELICIOUS (especially the bacon). I do not remember what my friends ordered for drinks but they did enjoy them. I ordered the Blackberry Bramble which was VERY strong and I could only handle a few sips. Regardless, the service was extremely friendly and I would be back!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Candied Bacon
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackberry Bramble drink

TQLQxxCfsLRe8gle6AdkXQ.text: Excellent service! Steven was our waiter and he was so friendly, funny and informative. I ordered the Chicken and Waffles which was topped with their specialty pickles. I had removed the pickles from my dish and Steven came back to our table and encouraged us to try the pickles with the meal as a whole. He continued to explain how the pickles were house-made and really complimented the dish. He was definitely right! To anyone ordering the chicken and waffles, LEAVE THE PICKLES ON!!   Thank you for giving us such a great experience, Steven! Your service was definitely top notch!   (I hear he makes the best iced latte too! Lol)

OPE4aoXJzApjnrTDIjpVhQ.text: The server was good but the food was cold and came out an hour and half after the order. The chef Lex had a horrible attitude with the servers and did not make the food correctly. The poor attitudes in the kitchen poured out into the service and made for a horrible experience for more than just us. Some people left. Adrian the manager attempted to please us but the food came back out, still incorrect. All we wanted was warm food and cheese on our eggs. Poor service overall stemming from the kitchen.

ERQYBZbuDEg3JMN2gASnJQ.text: Amazing food. Amazing view. Open 24 Hours. What more could you ask for?   Get the chicken and waffles. Trust me.   Went for brunch on my last day in Vegas. We sat outside because the weather was perfect. We were able to look directly at the Bellagio fountain. The most amazing view, it really is gorgeous. Our server walked us through the menu and provided us his recommendations.   Of course because it was brunch we had to get the bottomless mimosas. They were divine and just enough kick for that last day in Vegas buzz.   All in all one of the best places we ate it while in Vegas. I highly suggest you put this on your list even if it's 3 AM and you're just leaving the club. Shoot, I'm sure it's even better then.

JKp_vP3bh3xG7Y6tOy0Lrg.text: My husband and I came in yesterday and was pleasantly surprised by the level of service provided   Not only was everyone helpful , everyone was accommodating. Our waiter was a gentleman by the name of Sean , Sean was very kind , personable and made us feel as if we were at home. Promote him :)   The food was delicious also!! We came in too late for breakfast so we left but came back and tried the chicken and waffles delectable! Will be back

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A picture we took of a family waiting for their food at Hexx
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sitting waiting for our lunch at hexx

pBNJ_9UpYha4ySpr7OsCQA.text: This was soooooo much fun.  We got the Mega     Magick Dragon potion drink.  We had omletes and French toast.   Our server was fun and delightful.  Can't  wait to come back. Steven was a great server. What a great start to the day.  The food and service were spectacular.

wT4E0a1KU1JSR-q0RMCSaA.text: The food was amazing. The endless mimosas were awesome and service was great. Great location on the strip and an awesome first breakfast for my first time in Vegas on a girls trip

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LQjMxrsYe6eNM8LHCqNzzQ.text: We came in to be greeted quickly. There was no wait for a table.  We choose the outside patio, as it quieter and quite lovely. The waiter greeted us and they offered three types of water: Pellegrino, Fiji and tap. The water show in Vegas goes on right a crossed from the outside dinning. Nice entertainment while you wait for your meal.   We order the gravy and fries, aka poutine, chicken and waffles and I ordered the shrimp scampi.   You have to wait for your food, so don't be in a rush. It's upper class and the average meal is $25.00 bucks, apps around $10.00   The people next to us got a really cool looking drink. Bubbling blue monstrosity.   The fries came out quickly and my brother said they were really good. Crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside. The gravy was hot and toasty and the curd were stringy. The ranch is defiantly made in house and vey creamy but it's a little more sour than your average ranch, sour cream based.   The scampi was very good, the sauce wasn't too thick and very buttery. The chili was a nice note. And bread was my favorite part soft and buttery nicely toasted.   The chicken and waffles my brother said it was juicy, the breeding could have been a little crispier, the pickles/onion slaw were really good and the waffle was crisp and pretty standard Belgium waffle, real maple syrup. The bite all together was quite delicious.  Definitely a place to try on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patio
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu with prices

mHi7FmgFt_lWuXQ_17D0mw.text: I had Hexx for dinner a couple years ago and it was great (highly recommend the spaghetti). Recently, I had them for brunch and it was EVEN better. I get very annoyed when restaurants stop serving breakfast after 10 am-- especially in places like Las Vegas where you're usually up pretty late and then sleep in. Thankfully Hexx had it all day so we chose to eat there one day when we slept in some -- and glad we did.   The location is great -- next time I'll sit outside so I can have an across-the-street view of the Bellagio Fountain show. The price is pretty standard for Vegas -- about $20/person.  I had this meat omelette that was amazing and quite filling. Their coffee was delicious also. Great Ambiance and there's an even a candy store attached if you need a little something afterwards

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table inside the restaurant. Across the street is the Bellagio.
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The meat omelette with potatoes and an English muffin. Mm mm good.

Xb5ZF3g86aS4uF-YiR4E1A.text: The place is actually a lot nicer than images on Yelp. The place has a very cool design and is very popular. We had dinner here and our server was Brandon. We couldn't have been happier with his service when he told us about the menus items he did in such detail we wanted to try everything. The short rib was amazing and the burger was great. As locals, we don't go to the strip a lot to eat, but I will make an exception for this place. Overall great experience.

5ZFnMYVtccBejkUN5Vqylg.text: The carrot cake pancakes are amazing! I tried to make my own but they didn't come out as good. The environment is great and you can't go wrong with being right on the strip in front of the Bellagio fountains.

-HsgjS7CU1-2pEUU2VwmBA.text: Really great location inside Paris Hotel. Has a patio view of the strip & Bellagio Fountains, really open spacious modern interior. $24 dollars for bottomless mimosas but they keep your glass filled to the rim. The HEXX Benedict was delicious. Typically served on an English McMuffin, but they serve theirs on scalloped potatoes. YUM. Pricey, but definitely worth it! Will definitely come back

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HEXX Benedict

trsaUyTKtBhhvGLuUvdz0A.text: We stopped in for happy hour. Bartenders we friendly and knowledgeable about the various scotches that were offered. Enjoy hearing a bit about their backgrounds and how they came to be in Vegas. Didn't eat but was intrigued by menu. And other patrons seemed to enjoying their meals.

x5WP3LUyZRkKbySJKuY7jA.text: Kevin is amazing and has an infectious laugh . Good food we are all full and heading over to the Bellagio for the water show before we escort the in laws back to the hotel. Prime rib was huge !  Scallops were filling ! Halibut was tasty!  Rib bone was really good melted in your mouth . Kevin enjoys life ! Great guy!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mxMZWnGQ-GT1o_z87Yx0Vw.text: I was very impressed with this place.  The seafood sampler was unbelievably delicious.  Highly recommend that for the table to share as an appetizer.  Braised Short ribs - my mouth is watering just thinking about them.  The meat just fell off the bone.  Pairing of the potatoes and Brussels sprouts were perfect.  AND the Prime Rib......oh the prime rib.  Cooked to perfection, lots of red (the way we asked), didn't have to send it back like you do most places because most places over cook.  The meat just melted in our mouths. There's a lot more I need to go back and try.  I saw drunk that was served out of a large swan.  It's on my to do list.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s1Gj266bRURJgwkTLeJErw.text: Started with the friendly hostess seating us inside with a great view of the strip and the fountains across the street.  Our server, Jessica, was super sweet!  We got some waters to start from friendly Abel then ordered an amazingly good cocktail (must try the bowls)!  We ordered the Jumbo lump crab cake, Pan seared scallops and Roasted cauliflower to share.  Everything was delicious.  Toward the end of the meal, the manager, Andrew stopped by and checked to make sure everything went well.... it did!  We will be back again.  Yum!
