_Oz1wVzL1tWN7COv6ZPkeQ.text: such an amazing experience for my friends bachelorette party!!! Apolo is AMAZING! couldn't have asked for a better server. He went above and beyond to make our experience worth while. He pulled out our chairs for us to sit down, responded quickly to food and drink requests, and was very personable. definitely will be back!

vi5w3QFavQwaNUq3VWSqlQ.text: Bad start showing us the absolute worst table on the outdoor patio.  In a corner next to the server station with no view at all. How about showing us the second table first?  Our server Natalie was very pleasant but the food was very mediocre.  My Caesar Salad was pretty tasteless and the specks of what looked like freeze dried bacon detracted from an already so-so dish.  My wife said her Chicken BLT Sandwich was good.    I guess if they didn't try to screw us over with the poor table I might have given a 3, or maybe not.  I really did not like my dish.

hZ1ACKbuMN4mOJKP-aNBSA.text: I wanted to like this place but unfortunately I can't. Chose to do a birthday brunch there on a Friday morning. Had a reservation for 11, didn't get seated until 11:20. Ordered drinks and fairly soon after that, ordered food. Forty five minutes before the food came. We'd had three refills of bottomless mimosas and no food. Finally asked where our food was and was told it'd be 5-10 more minutes, then it came right out, and it was cold. One person had a warm plate, the rest, room temperature at best. Our food had clearly been sitting out for awhile. No apologies. One member sent hers back because it was so salty she couldn't eat it. Her replacement meal came out quickly and I enjoyed what she shared with me which is why I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1.

lw-fwqNFYuQO7hBCfUrWug.text: Absolutely absurd to charge their customers a CNF fee or a franchise fee (as it was described to us by their employees) for eating at their restaurant.  None of the 4-5 star restaurants next to them charge this fee; to take advantage of "tourists" this way is ridiculous.  As a local to Vegas, I will not be returning.

HG766-TmuuV110yZM2aYsg.text: We waited for 30 minutes at our table and got no service. I had to ask a different waiter for out drinks and after we got them, we waited another 30 minutes untill we all decided to pay the check and give out business to someplace else

5t-aAciGieoocv9ZMtBHAA.text: Just go. Everything from the food to the bottomless mimosas during brunch is amazing. Treat yourself to HEXX you won't regret it

B123j2cN0-Lx9Je_DO2zfw.text: This place had good reviews but I was surprised cause we didnt have a great experience at all... and it was my wife's birthday too and they knew it. Our server was Sara who was very pretentious especially when we presented our groupon! Not sure if it was the groupon or our partie's color? Micheal (Bolton cause he was singing a micheal Bolton song) was another server (we don't know his name) and he was very kind to his tables we would have wanted him. It was 4 pm and te place was empty so it's not like the tables were all filled and Sara couldn't get to us. She didn't even have the audacity to further come by our table to check on us, or give us napkins... she had the guy who filled up our glasses come and ask us if we wanted dessert. I told her from the beginning of our meal that it was a birthday but I guess that's why we didnt get a napkin. She was attentive to other tables just not ours after we got the expensive good wine she never came back...maybe we looked like the help to her or maybe the groupon. Anyway our filet mignon and steak, and calamari was average but the cesear and salad was very delicious hence the 3 stars but as for belittling your guests you get zero. Fyi...we also tipped very well but it should have gone to Micheal and the guy who gave us water...we saw Micheal (bolton) more and even heard him sing great voice...nice job!

jdtYmt2AcNmqJRqjx8BnIg.text: If ambiance is the first thing you look for when you're deciding where to eat, this place is for you. I came here for brunch and ordered the steak and eggs. The steak was very underwhelming. It tasted like your average Denny's/Norms type of steak. It had no flavor, was not cooked to my liking, and it was very chewy. The highlight of the meal were the potatoes. They had a good crunch and flavor to them. The ambiance was great. I sat outside and felt a nice breeze while I people watched. The timing of them bringing out my meal took a little long, but I was with a group of ten. The service was alright. I had to wait a bit until I would be served some water. Overall, you're paying to eat on the strip. I would not come back unless I came here for a birthday and was forced.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y9KVkrLKi7snTS823jfqdA.text: Amazingggg brunch! Got the basic breakfast with fruit instead of meat and the fruit was so fresh and good. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the home fries were crispy and amazing. We sat outside which had a view of the Bellagio and the strip (nice for people watching!) the bottomless mimosas were pretty affordable and the bartender and server were both great. Quick service and my mimosa was filled every time it got even halfway empty. Would highly reccommend.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vH7KqxILGgKl5tBNM72uog.text: Melissa was awesome! She gave the best service, was so sweet, and made our last brunch in Vegas super memorable. Get the colossal bloody mary!

et17l9laqPM7wGVBmZ0UFg.text: This past weekend my friends and I decided to try out Hexx Kitchen + Bar. The inside was what really drew us in, the restaurant was so cute and they had these little sections on the side that consisted of booth/lounge seating with pillows and curtains around the area that gave the illusion of a private eating, which made us excited to sit back and enjoy the bottomless mimosas we were about to order. As we waited for a server to help us out we were being missed due to the area not being in sight. We asked the host/bar a few times for help, but no-one seemed to come and take our order. The server Sean noticed us and how we had not been attended to, he took on our table and turned our experience completely upside down! The food was amazing and our mimosas were always filled, but what made the overall expierence even better, was the service provided by Sean and the help of Patrick. Sean was very welcoming, honest, friendly, and likable. We were in such awe of how great his customer service was, we believed he was too over qualified for the job but he was that good! If you decide to eat here the food is tasteful, but Sean's service is was made the dining an exceptional one!

bdyoEuFM3x0ntpYgHk1CSw.text: Went here for breakfast and had the cinnamon roll waffle and iced mocha. Both awesome. Cool view of the from the table, friendly staff. Going back for dessert tonight and can't wait.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon roll waffle and iced mocha. Both awesome. Cool view of the from the table, friendly staff. I&#39;ll see this waffle in my dreams.

M8y94QJgxyh8Xy1e7TWQ1Q.text: Cheese and charcuterie plate was acceptable. Drinks also standard. Service below par for wait staff to cistomer ratio.

J_tMtziEcm10ACH_Ai_ysQ.text: Sean was great! Friendly and attentive, always had a mimosa refill before we even had to ask.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DGUlc7IUgWMo5hDlGL6Ktw.text: Just okay the prices are pretty high!! Service was minimal and the good was marginal at best

arZhyW8hCxjKPBzR5oplxQ.text: This was awesome. Went here for brunch. Make a reservation.  Our bottomless mimosas were on point. And our server Taylor made the experience.

sOg-pWRVu7IC6a0k-iCt2Q.text: All around good meal....lots of options....we ordered a variety from pasta carbonara to steak and burgers. All were delicious and not overly priced. Service really needs some work though!

KLss14jiGUVfn7Y8de48lQ.text: We came here for my girlfriend's birthday lunch this afternoon and the food was amazing, the drinks were great! The service we got from our server Stephanie C. was fantastic can't wait to come back!  Oh and we weren't going to order dessert until she mentioned the bourbon caramel drizzle on the  panna cotta which was a great way to finish off the delicious meal!

bnCL_DMzQarV-5kHCsM_yg.text: If you're hungry dont go here unless youre willing to wait! We came on a tuesday brunch and waited 40 minutes till our orders came in . We were just drinking our coffee and tea so by the time our food came we lost our appetite. Not worth for a pricey brunch

NEUpFnYqhrZxxkZkQX-_hw.text: Hexx kitchen really reminds me a lot of the Sugar Factory in the sense that they have these $36 signature drinks that are or were equivalent to the Goblets that were sold before. The ambiance of the place is definitely LUSH! I enjoyed that for sure. Now onto the food.. After looking at the previous customer's pictures they ordered on yelp I really saw nothing appealing other than the deserts and things that they normally serve during breakfast. I ended up going with the $20 Hexx burger. It was good.. Worth $20? No... The  $28 jambalaya was good very spicy, my bf liked it so that's all that mattered. Service was just okay.. Nothing that was over the top or exceptionally great. Our waitress was.. Different... I have to check out the breakfast before I completely rule out never returning. Oh and the Bellagio water show that goes on across the street is awesome so make it a priority to get some dining on the patio! Remember most of the high price you are paying is for the location so you may as well enjoy it fully with the scenery right?

0GYhLObjwlSnG8mkjrILTQ.text: Had breakfast here this morning. Service poor, food just as bad.  Nice venue, bright and sunny but the service was awful, food pricey and disappointing. Would not return

mMDHyE276rMKG2cwzjz9RA.text: The staff here is amazing ! I always get great service.  Kristal is awesome ! She is one of the reasons why ill keep going back !  She made me feel at home! i recommend her!

_kGplbwVF-3VT_521dvNtg.text: THE brunch spot of vegas. Hexx is our go to brunch/recovery restaurant we go to when we are in town. The service is amazing and the location is perfect. It's across the street from the belagio so I recommend the patio dining. And you have to try the carnitas hash.  A mixture of carnitas, home fries potatoes, and some over easy eggs. Delicioso!!!! Add some bottomless mimosas....perfection.  Service is great. Stephanie was awesome. Second time she's served us and both times she was sweet and very attentive.  Hexx is a must eat, drink, relaxed place to visit in LV!!!!!

7LFsNrbpdS5Vg4OPR2P9mA.text: NOTE: This place used to be called the Sugar factory and the waiter said the owner changed the name and interior design in February.  The menu looked different too, but they still have the candy shop.    Sat here for 6 hours Saturday morning with a huge group of hung over friends.  We probably wouldn't have stayed so long, but they put us on a couch type booth with pillows and it was SO comfortable.    Portions are HUGE.  Like to big for one person.    The all you can drink Mimosa's are great.    Service was little bit slow, but then again we were there for six hours.....all in all.  I would come here again.

po4QB0lneoYE0WAOmU2bNA.text: It's hard to find a decent place to eat on the strip - I struggle to find a place that's proportionately priced to the quality. You mostly pay exorbitant prices for average food in a fancy setting or exorbitant prices for average food in an average setting. Either way, tastebuds and wallet are not in sync. Except for Hexx!!  I saw Hexx from across the strip and suggested we check it out for lunch instead of one of the mainstream (and not very good) chain restaurants we were passing. Checked out the menu and were able to grab seats at the bar in time for happy hour pricing on food and drinks - it was great! We split the spinach artichoke dip (very tasty) and I got the tomato and burrata bruschetta. I don't see the bruschetta listed on their menu online, so I hope it's still available - it was delicious! And both appetizers were especially generous in portion, for pretty reasonable prices (and not just Vegas-reasonable, I mean actual reasonable). It was a really perfect lunch (kind of lunch turned linner) stop for us, and I highly recommend it. I was so impressed with the quality, quantity, and price point of the food I actually sought out the manager and complimented/thanked him for running such a great find - and right on the strip!  Some would say it was by chance we landed here, others might say fate...my friend was obsessed with going to the "candy restaurant, where they serve candy for dinner!" (which we all immediately shut down) but, as it turns out, that very same restaurant is Hexx. They have an attached candy shop and apparently went through a revamp a year or so ago - so the rumor of a candy restaurant had been True (or at least as True as rumors tend to be) but we all also enjoyed a great meal.

_0aFEkUn6vN77XQE6kNb7A.text: Literally everything we ordered was very flavorful. Their menu may not have exotic options but I was very satisfied with the quality of each plate. On top of that, service was phenomenal. Our waitress would come and check up on us and she would switch out our plates as well in between entrees. Very unexpected considering this wasn't a white tablecloth restaurant.

oFeJIc7A79BU29oU6rb5vA.text: Bad service takes forever food was pretty good but bad service. Makes us wait 20 minutes to get change back.

teY_EJGEvx2PN3KDOe8JBg.text: Excellent!  Had a New York steak and it was perfect.  Fair price for what you get.  Vegas steaks aren't cheap but this was reasonable for the quality.

w7CoPxrGJ5JOtsChD78tLQ.text: Great Brunch vibe today at Hexx. The colossal bloody mary has crab legs, shrimp, sausage, cheese... We all enjoyed our meals on the best patio in Vegas! Chef CB checked on us which made the experience even better!

wYx0BQN_yDCPHy_X5Z97eg.text: I was looking for a new brunch spot on the Vegas strip and HEXX totally exceeded my expectations. This place has great service, great food and a really cool ambiance. The front desk was super accommodating, I had made a reservation through open table and walked in 5 min late and was told my reservation didn't exist. I showed them my reservation on my phone, turns out another group had taken my reservation! I was shocked! But the hostess had our back and seated us right away. We ordered our own food each; I got the farm fresh eggs over easy with sausages. It was a great brunch. My friends had gotten the chicken and waffles which looked amazing and we had gotten a stack of pancakes to share. Drinks were great too! They make a good spicy Bloody Mary! Definitely somewhere I'll return to when I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CPltxd3YTdKTkSLiYrML5Q.text: The stars are for the service, view, people, cinnamon rolls to share, and the double smashed potatoes!  Alright so why were we all in vegas? For a bachelorette party of course. What was the bride to be craving...bottomless mimosas lol. So we found this place where you can drink unlimited bottomless mimosas for 2 hours. 3 of the 5 girls chose this option and were very happy!  Definitely check out this place since it had an open bright restaurant style where you can watch the Bellagio Fountains dance, you know where they filmed 'Oceans 11' lol.   I got the burger which was ok, I wish they had a brioche bun. I did love the doubled cooked potatoes! So good. The cinnamon roll to share was on point for flavor.   Overall check it out yet try to make reservations if you're going during the prime time weekends.

X4JbHezP3FHeK6N2MUhrBQ.text: Came here for the first time not too long ago and it was a wonderful experience. The patio seating is ideal for brunch with views of the beautiful blue sky along with the Belagio water show right across the street. Seems to me that the bar is perfect for night time drinking. Everything from the decor to the great customer service is what's going to bring me back here time and time again. Had the steak & eggs and it was scrumptious! A must visit if you ask me

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Eggs...Yummy

Xt9-rILr4viV76LjPj_KgQ.text: Went for their brunch menu and had their croissant sandwich with a side of carrot cake pancakes. They had the French style doors open so you could see the beautiful Vegas strip. Staff was beyond friendly and our breakfast was top notch. Can't wait to be back next time I'm in Vegas and will definitely recommend to all my friends

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of the outside from inside dining area
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham &amp; Cheese Croissant
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot Cake Pancakes

_UZOzG8lpgEUbf7vGapbdg.text: The only reason I am leaving 4 stars instead of 5 is because the service was a litttttttle slow and we told them we had a show to be at. Everything else though was amazing. We loved it so much at brunch we went back for dinner the same day! Both times we sat on patio which had amazing view of Bellagio fountains. The food was delicious and the servings are huge so SHARE if you can. At brunch we had the Hexx cauldron drink which came served in a fancy disco ball. It was $40 which I thought was a little pricey until it arrived. We got SO many drinks out of it! And it tasted amazing. There were 4 people in our group and everyone loved their food at both meals. Definitely recommend. Also we sat outside and even in the evening in 105 degree heat it did not really feel hot outside. Definitely go!

Yl1WDLfUV86awzeQHebDzA.text: If you like Bloody Mary's try them here!!!!! I would go back just for that! I had French toast and they were delicious! Of course it's Vegas so your paying more for everything! But overall it's a nice place to go have breakfast or brunch. They do have unlimited mimosas that are worth it. Our server was awesome with those quick refills.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Mary! F***ing amazing

bRaRyPk5Mf57b-qbp9fO3A.text: We had an amazing brunch at Hexx! Apolo is an amazing server! The food and the drinks were well worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles and Bottomless Mimosas

MhiFbVPzuLzwgMQiqB7liA.text: If you go to Vegas, you must go here. The food is amazing, service is always great, and bottomless mimosas--need I say more?! Also the view is nuts. Sit outside, and get ready to get sloshed.

sGyOrKHRP5NU2UMFYleu1w.text: Clean restaurant,  great food, and the server (Vanessa) was awesome. She offered several recommendations that were spot on, made sure we were happy and taken care of, and was very friendly. Will definitely be back!

5PPejLLWrWp3V4UaD2PiLg.text: Although the wait was a little long, it was totally worth it! I ordered the French toast with a side of bacon and a mimosa of course :-)  The butter was a little sweet which paired well the French toast and the syrup was served warm. My husband ordered the corn beef hash which he enjoyed. Overall had a really great experience and loved the fact that we sat outside which added to the ambiance. Would definitely dine here again.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast, side of bacon and mimosa

BnifLRv5Md11S5FErYyeKQ.text: Wow!   Unbelievable scrumptious!   This place totally is worth the visit!    We were able to get in without a reservation! No wait at all!    Seats out front allowed us to people watch!  The waitress, Olivia, was nice & informative!  If you decide after your one mimosa you like bottomless, you can!   The Hexx Benedict was cooked to Perfection, the eggs just popped in my mouth!  The potatoes in the Benedict were oh so light & perfectly seasoned!  Spouse had the custom omelet, all Veggies & add on of ham with oh Lord, the perfect golden brown yellow potatoes seasoned with right amount of kosher salt.  Yah, I ate off of his plate too!  Tip!    I wanted the infamous carrot pancake, however not a full order.  The waitress was kind enough to do a single la carte!  Definitely no complaints here!  Olivia was the best waitress, patient & thoroughly explained options!  Mind you, we were outside, loud people & boom boxes walking by.  A definite must!

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aYB5R44h4DwVsvvP-cm7wQ.text: HEXX kitchen is a really great brunch spot. However, it can take a while to even get seated. My friends and I had reservations (highly recommended because this place gets PACKED), but it took a while to for us to get our table.   I ordered the Eggs Benedict and also got a chance to try the Chicken and Waffles. The Eggs Benedict were made to perfection. The chicken and waffles plate was HUGE - the chicken was seasoned well, and the entire plate was super filling. It's a bit pricey, but I'd say it's pretty worth it.   Service was a bit slow - it took a while for our food to come out. However, I will definitely come back again if I'm ever in Vegas!

QlDPqIe0XeEPJ2okSF7F9Q.text: Amazing!!! Great food... great service ... WoW!  Apolo was amazing! He was sweet, attentive, polite and very professional. I would, with no doubt, come back. Don't hesitate to come and try this place and hopefully u get lucky and Apolo is your waiter ..   P.S. try the HeXx Benedict and the carrot PANCAKES!!!

_Dgy6j9-oFdpgDvcvmj8YQ.text: Hexx charges a CNF tax. Fuck that shit. That's some pompous ass shit. Service was slow, food was as mediocre as a person from the Midwest. But the CNF tax was some real bullshit.

GSwLlyxngwAr7v4Akurmxw.text: My friend Jamie and I enjoyed an amazing Sunday brunch at Hexx for a very nice price thanks to Groupon. We had reservations for 10:30, and we were seated at a table right in the border of the patio but technically inside, with a lovely view of the Bellagio fountains across the street.   We started out with some iced coffee and the Fresh Fruit Plate ($14). The papaya tasted a little off but otherwise this was wonderful. A large serving of numerous different fruits as well as a few small muffins.   We were going to split a pizza next but they were already out (at 11am!) so we decided to share the Surf and Turf Sliders ($22) instead. These were heavy on the short rib and a little light on the lobster, which was mixed with with the aioli slaw. I expected more lobster so I don't think this is a dish I would order again.  We also shared the Hexx Benedict ($16) which includes delicious scalloped potatoes rather than the typical English muffin. Perfectly poached egg, not too heavy on the hollandaise, and the asparagus was a nice addition.   We ended up with the Twisted Sticky Bun ($8) which was the star of the day in my opinion, especially for the price. Listed as a starter, it is super sweet and made the perfect shared dessert. A large, gooey bun with caramel drizzle, decadent cream cheese frosting and pecans. A must get.   If I had any complaints it would be that service was a bit slow, but it was a rather busy Sunday morning and our server was very friendly.   Note: the current menu was slightly different than the menu online,  instead of a lobster roll they have a scallop roll as of September 2018.  Yelp Reviews 2018 37/100

dtN_8tBvCftXDcLktDIdJQ.text: Amazing brunch - and we met a celebrity!   My friend Jessie and I previously attended a yelp event here earlier this year. She found a $50 Groupon for this spot, so we decided to check it out one Sunday for brunch. She did make reservations so we were seated right away. Not sure if they are recommended, but it was pretty full inside the restaurant.   We were seated at the perfect table that was half inside and half outside. We had a good spot for people watching, as well as a sweet view of the Bellagio fountains. Temperature wise, it wasn't too hot or too cold, it was just right.   We orderd: Iced coffees Fresh fruit plate  Sticky bun  Surf n turf sliders  Hexx Benedict  We originally ordered a pizza but were told shortly after we ordered they were out. A little disappointing, but we decided to try the sliders instead. The sliders were really good! The meat was a yummy short rib and came topped with lobster slaw. The combo worked well together! The fresh fruit plate was almost too pretty to eat. It had a bunch of yummy fruits including papaya, and little mini muffins! The hexx benedict was amazing. You can't really go wrong with a benedict, but this one was even better because instead of bread they used au gratin potatoes as the base. So yum! We saved the sticky bun for last and it was out of this world good. Besides being huge, it was served hot with warm cream cheese icing and candied pecans. It was the best sticky bun I've ever had.   So after the groupon the balance was still almost $40 with tax and tip. Not a cheap brunch at all, but it was so good I can't complain. I would definitely come back for brunch and also they have this huge bloody mary with king crab legs in them. I'd come back for that alone! On our way out we passed by Shaquille O' Neal who was eating lunch there, and he was making faces at my son. We ended up getting a pic with him and he was super cool! That's one thing I love about eating on the strip, you never know who you will run into!!

Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh fruit plate

wB7oTN3kDXD66vShWDTqbA.text: HEXX was the first Vegas foodie destination that my friend and I experienced on this trip. I made a reservation a couple of days in advance for a table for 2 at 10:30 a.m. After reading about how busy this place gets on Sunday, I was glad we did. We entered through the casino and received assistance in locating the hostess who was located near the front main entrance off the strip. The casino entrance looks legit but the official entrance is actually from the exterior.   This restaurant is HUGE! There are several rooms, each with its own unique feel - some airy and sunlit - others more dim, ensuring a more intimate mood. With a plethora of seating options inside, and a highly sought patio-arrangement, HEXX is Modernly decorated, ultra trendy, and THE hotspot for Sunday brunch. 'Nuff said about the venue itself...on to the rest: The reason you are spending money!   SERVICE: 4/5 Stars Our server was friendly and helpful enough, but she managed to disappear for upwards of 15 minutes toward the end of our meal experience. I was desperate for one last mimosa and my friend just wanted to obtain our check - so we had to ask a nearby busser to come to our rescue.  BRUNCH FOOD: 5/5 Stars YES TO ALL THINGS FOOD.  We were sold on the Carrot Cake pancakes after seeing the pictures on Yelp. Our Carrot Cake pancakes didn't quite resemble the modelesque photos, as they seemed to be missing some of the topping ingredients...either way, the pancakes were LEGIT. You could literally see the shredded carrots on the bottom of each pancake. Basically if you want dessert for breakfast, this dish is for you. We shared them and could barely finish the plate.   Steak and Eggs - I ordered my New York Strip medium rare, eggs scrambled. Just do it and don't look back. This dish is also accompanied by yummy skillet potatoes and a fluffy English muffin.  My friend had the Farm Fresh Eggs and she reports that this dish was just what the doctor ordered. She ordered her eggs cooked over-medium and that they were cooked perfectly - a hard task to achieve apparently. And the bacon was perfectly crispy...YES!  BRUNCH BEVERAGES: 3/5 I had better mimosas when I gambled at Planet Hollywood. For $23 per person, you can add bottomless mimosas to your meal, or you can just skip the meal and pay the $23 for unlimited mimosas. They come pre-mixed with O.J.  Meaning, each glass consists mostly of OJ, which you have to guzzle through in order to the next one.   They do not have any other flavors, but when I inquired about changing up the flavor, our server said she could add Peach Puree for an extra $6.00 and basically give me the bottle to make my own mimosas. I upgraded to the $29 but I never got to make my own mimosas. She brought me a glass of potent peach puree already pre-mixed with champagne. I poured most of it out and ask for a top-off of just champagne. We never had the bottle on our table and we barely got them to approach the table with it.    If you are looking for awesome food at a trendy Vegas-central location, choose HEXX (but be sure to make a reservation). If you are looking for delicious mimosas and decent food, hit up the Bellagio Buffet. You'll spend a bit more money, but you'll enjoy unlimited food and potentially have 100% access to the champagne (so long as nothing has changed since I was last there in 2013).

CUoxRSXpMbPNruIK6JZmrA.text: Okay, this was an amazing breakfast!  Quiet morning alone, so after a lazy start to my day I headed down to HEXX. My breakfast was fantastic, the brioche French toast was perfectly cooked (I hate mushy French toast), the berries were super fresh. My server Tracee was just as good as the meal. Funny, poor service can ruin a good meal...l got lucky with someone who clearly loves what she does. She interacted with everyone around me with such joy. I need more Tracee's in my world :)

VfKwTADu5n8Yd_d6OzXOJA.text: Went here on a recent bachelorette trip and loved the experience! The place is huge, they have lots and lots of seating. They took my number down and we took some pictures with the Bellagio fountain and walked on the strip for about 40 mins before we got the text. I had requested a table facing the street and we got a great view of the strip.  The servers were quick and attentive. I got the egg Benedict with hollandaise sauce which was rich and tasty , I also got a glass of guava mimosa which was delish! They only list the bottomless mimosa's on the menu but you can order by the glass :)  Definitely a place worth checking out. I also liked the fact that we were waiting outside in the sun after being inside in the dark and stuffy casinos for so long.

eGqWudlr8fqpYZnyuM9e-Q.text: Came here for Friday brunch and we were seated in 15 minutes. Their brunch selection is great, and I couldn't choose between the delicious looking stacks of carrot cake pancakes, cinnamon roll waffle, or chicken and waffles. I ultimately got the chicken and waffles, and it came with two generous pieces of chicken thighs and breast. The chicken was juicy and paired well with the cheddar waffle and syrup. So delicious!  Service was a little slow, but the manager was great about visiting our table to apologize for a hair in my friend's cappuccino. I definitely will be coming back the next time I'm in Vegas!

muKRj4MYKMSvPseuM6bz3w.text: Iv been coming to hexx for years with my business partners friendly staff awesome steaks but this visit was horrible the front staff was very rude new faces iv never seen before she was more interested talking to her coworkers laughing then talking to me about this new menu for some reason they where no longer serving steaks and she just put a menu on the table said this all we have and turned around kept talking to her coworker  Very unprofessional I suggest managers take action asap

5XlZFcIM5RpXRevBZbFAww.text: My 2 girlfriends and I came to Vegas for a girls weekend.  One of our goals was to eat at some of the best restaurants here.  Our first night we ate at Hexx.    We had the filet minion, mussels and scallops dish, and one of all but 2 of the side dishes.  The filet was melt in your mouth tender.  It was delicious.  All of the side dishes were amazing!!  The mussels and scallops dish was a disappointment.  The sauce broke and separated so it left the seafood in a puddle of oil.  It was sent back and taken off our bill.  Our server Kevin was awesome!!  Very attentive and helpful.  Knowledgeable about wines and the menu.  Was very friendly and laughed with us.    There is indoor and outdoor seating.  There is a bar area.  Our experience here was amazing except for that one dish.  They were very nice about it though and took it off the bill.  I highly recommend this place if your into great food and a fun atmosphere.

DkaYD5mLvXmuFNelv58mFA.text: Yes- YO-YO-, great place to start out your stay in Vegas- order a mimosa or the bottomless mimosa, sit on the patio if you can and people watch. This place is really large-inside and out.  Eggs Benedict and Chilaquiles were very good. (Our server Stephanie C. seemed a bit off and not very friendly-but maybe not her day)

-b_4SxVR4N00W731tBL1gA.text: Yes definitely a four star or more restaurant! My husband had the carrot cake pancakes.... oh my gotta try!!! I've been dying all week to try the peanut butter cheese cake and it was so worth the wait. Plus to to it off Jessica was a excellent server. Thanks Jes!

AYszd6dEyL-IcoLzQdS5aA.text: Carrot cake pancakes brought me here. The pictures on Yelp looked out of this world. I had to try them for myself.  Spoiler: They looked exactly like the Yelp photos (no Yelpfishing here) and they tasted amazing- more to come.  Since it was breakfast, there was a tiny wait. They take your telephone number and send you two texts: one alerting you that you're on the list and the second when you're table is ready. After less than 10 minutes it was our time to be seated.  We sat near the outdoor portion giving us an indoor/outdoor vibe  Tip- bottomless mimosas are $24 and a single mimosa is $12 so choose wisely.  Service from both our waitress and bus staff were great. Our cups were never empty, which always is a great thing for me.  I ordered the standard eggs, bacon and English muffin breakfast because I forced my friend to split those pancakes with me. My breakfast came with three eggs, cooked to my liking with potatoes, that muffin and bacon. Everything was good and tasty. I loved the potatoes the most. The English Muffin was really thick and chewy- not like what I'm used to but nothing butter and jelly didn't cure.  Then the pancakes. Oh my God. A huge stack of five thick pancakes topped with cream and side of syrup. Initially I was surprised about the size (it was small) of syrup, but these pancakes are so rich you don't need the syrup at all, just smear that icing on them. It's like eating a cake for breakfast and don't we all need more cake in our lives?  Honestly the pancakes made the meal. Worth $14. Totally worth it. I'd pay more and be happy, honestly. Now that I know these are so good I'll be back next time I'm in town and this time I don't think I'll plan on sharing them with anyone!

daNQz5QtTl_hiQZmu392BQ.text: This is probably my #1 go-to breakfast spot when I'm in Las Vegas. Depending on the day though, it can get busy. I have come here on multiple occasions: by myself and with other people. The attentiveness of the service is really a hit or miss.   I had first come here on a day where my flight to Las Vegas landed earlier than my friends'. I figured I'd try out some French Toast and berries and have a date by myself.  I was immediately greeted by the front staff and seated by a host. Throughout my meal, multiple servers had constantly checked on how my experience was, even engaging in conversation about my trip to Vegas. I even came back the next day with a friend and was greeted by the manager with a 'Welcome back!'  The food was also delicious, but it can get a little pricey. I definitely wouldn't come here on a budget- but luckily I WAS in Vegas after all so I decided to do a little more spending.  French toast with berries, a side of potatoes, orange juice, and a side of bacon totaled to around $40-$45. It was delicious though so I can't complain too much.   The staff were really the reason that made it an experience to have me coming back!  On another occasion, I ordered the same dish and sat with 3 other people in my group. We were seated in the back on a Sunday morning (but it surprisingly wasn't busy).  Unfortunately, the service wasn't as great this time around but I get that things happen and it may be difficult to be on top of all of your tables.  The food was great (but pricey as usual) and we waited a while to receive our checks. The kitchen was also out of a few items that came as a surprise to me.  Overall, I do love this place and the kindness I have received from the management. I try to bring every person who comes to Vegas with me to this restaurant, and I hope that every time I do, they are able to have the same experience that I had the first time I dined in.

I preferred the patio but as I walked through the restaurant either would've been fine honestly since the inside is beautiful and bright. Can't wait to be back in Vegas for more fun and a delicious brunch + drinks at Hexx!

ahel-riN7pU4jbbHijO0kA.text: This was my second time coming to HEXX. The first time was back in 2016. Excellent service and food at 1:00am! I decided to come back for brunch. Be expected to wait or you can find bar seating which is first come first served. Luckily, my friends and I found a table in the bar area. The servers seemed rushed. We had to to ask for silverware and to get our waters refilled.   I ordered the waffle since I had a run later in the evening. It was a plain waffle with bananas. One of the best I've had. It wasn't soggy or over cooked. It was fluffy and light. My friend had the French toast which was also good.   There was a miscommunication with the waiter at the end. I had asked to use my Total Rewards points for the bill, but the waiter quickly said they don't allow it. I spoke to the manager and they do accept Total Reward points, but they don't give.   There are no diamond/seven star line here.   It is right next to Paris Hotel.

AlKxqZIyhcN6of_nWT9cJA.text: I came here with a Groupon thinking the place would be just okay. I was wrong, the food was actually delicious! I came here for dinner and ordered the Branzino, which was very crispy on the outside and nicely prepared inside. The service seemed a little slow considering the restaurant was kind of empty, but people watching outside made the time go by.   This place is across the street from the Bellagio fountains. The next time I'm in Vegas, I will definitely have to come back for their breakfast.

0EL-Wqmsq5azXzNx8OwVSA.text: SO MUCH YES! My friends and I were in Vegas for our fall break and my birthday, and we decided to have brunch here one day because we heard they had bottomless mimosas. We had so much fun at HEXX! You can only have the bottomless mimosas for two hours, but the waiters were so on top of filling up our glasses that this wasn't a problem at all. Literally we would take a sip and set the glass down, and they'd already be filling it up again. The food was delicious as well! I got their breakfast pizza, and I kid you not, I'm still thinking about it. It was so good, I want to learn how to make breakfast pizza myself!  Besides the great service and food, the restaurant was also extremely fun! Maybe just because we're crazy college kids and the people there were fun, but everyone was having a great time singing happy birthday throughout the whole restaurant, and mingling with each other. My friend and I were dying to watch the Vikings game, and they were happy to put it on for us (thank god)! Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll definitely remember this place and will recommend it to friends!

KUz5hTDkKTN6l-7t7pOLqw.text: We stayed in the Paris hotel for the weekend and visited this place twice, once for just desserts and other day for brunch. Packed during brunch hours on Sunday and we waited for 20 Mins to get a table. The food was good and you don't need to pay a bomb unlike other places on the middle of the strip. We got the cheesy garlic bread that was very disappointing only cheese and no garlic . The bean burger, veggie omelet and chilaquiles were good. Our desserts were also very good. Definitely recommend this place.

t84rV7MBes1_FbdtC8Rsfg.text: Amazing food. Steak was juicy, and extremely tasty. Great Customer Service. Our waitress was knowledgeable of the menu and very efficient. Her recommendations made all the difference. Allexia made this a five star review and experience.

yfEjmIyE9HCOoISuuhb93Q.text: (Brunch) Food was great. The husband & I each had the 2 different versions of the benedicts. I also had the bottomless mimosas. The server assistants were phenomenal. Our actual waitress however, not so much...She seemingly didn't do much, was hard to track down when it was time to pay, a bit cold on the surface & unfriendly, & didn't seem happy that we were paying with a groupon (even though we tip 20-25% before discount & still spent & additional $80). The assistants never let my glass become empty & they were super-friendly & funny. The assistants derved the tip, our waitress did not. I would go back, however...but, only w/ a groupon.

GfbKbyfdF79kqoY1HPCOPQ.text: Ok, aside from the fact that this place has outdoor seating on the strip completely across from the Bellagio, this place has amazing food! While it was a little noisy at night due to a loud over-excited party, I will not fault the restaurant for the noise. It is certainly a happening place with delicous food. We split the wedge salad - crisp lettuce, bacon, gorgonzola, candied pecans - which was a delicious beginning to the meal. I had the short ribs - which were completely tender - and my husband had the prime rib. It was not only a beautiful cut of prime rib, but perfectly cooked. We split the creme brulee for dessert - we were scrapimg the bottom of the dish!  A little pricey, but for Vegas on the strip it's what you're going to get. Well worth it. And the waitstaff were great!

xiiKU88Iv-JKvINdXv7KiQ.text: The food was good, and the gigantic cocktail was ok. I found it wasn't that strong and I'd have done better with a single serve cocktail vs. sharing with a few folks.

Wcczr4pMzAgYpsN6UBCtKA.text: What a fantastic little brunch spot on the strip! We found the prices here to be *extremely* reasonable including egg dishes for $14-19 and bottomless mimosas for $24 every day! You also MUST try the cinnamon bun appetizer, it was to die for. Our waitress was great, and they were able to swap out the meat on my egg dish for a fruit cup which I really appreciated. The only reason I couldn't give it 5 stars was that I did not get the English muffin that was supposed to come with my dish. Luckily there was plenty of food and I wasn't even able to finish the delicious breakfast potatoes, so it wasn't a big deal. We will definitely be back here for brunch on future Vegas trips!

X3WYsPkak80JJS48TbwgQw.text: First time coming to HEXX. The service was great, the food was just okay. The decor is sooo cute. Reminds me of being in a Williams Sonoma haha. Great view of the bellagio fountains. We arrived on a Sunday afternoon, there was no wait and the hostess asked if we wanted to sit inside or outside. The outside has heat lamps and a wrap around patio of great views of the strip. When our sever came, i was disappointed after asking him if they had a vegan menu and he said "no" (without making any recommendations). I noticed there was a veggie pizza i could try with a butternut squash puree that sounded delicious. However, when i got the pizza... it was very underwhelming and there was no flavor. My boyfriend got the French dip and said it was good but he didn't like how the sandwich was split in half instead of in a roll (which makes French dips easier to dip for him).   Pros: great service, amazing city view, decor   Cons: flavorless pizza, no vegan menu   Tips** if you're trying to get a reservation on a busy weekend night or brunch, try doing OpenTable beforehand. They also sometimes have Groupons as specials for dining here.

Eevc5TtChE5dkXHfqTFKsg.text: It was Waffle-Fest time for brunch this Sunday. No wait at 10:00am. Grabbed a strip view table inside. Claire our server was awesome.   My wife and I shared each other's dishes: the CinnaRoll Waffle & the Chicken and Waffles. What a great combo. They were both outstanding. The cream cheese frosting on the cinnamon waffle was a perfect complement to the lightness of the waffle. Our fav was the chicken & waffles though. The massive sized apple cheddar waffle paired perfectly with the sweet and spicy pickles and the syrup. And the 2 pieces of fried chicken were huge, crispy, and fresh out of the fryer. Ask for extra pickles.   This place came close to dethroning my Bkft King in LV (Hash House). It would have if it wouldn't have been almost double the cost of HH. Ask for Claire...

Just 3 stars because of the price of their potion drink!

9PxRbmdaKp21uf8wuado0Q.text: We went for brunch and bottomless mimosas. We had a wonderful experience and were seated immediately due to our reservation. We got a table outside. The entire experience was beautiful and the food was delicious. Our waitress Natalie was wonderful- if you go I'd definitely recommend requesting her if possible. She was very kind and attentive and even helped give us recommendations on where to go while in town! Overall wonderful experience, thanks Natalie!!

Qa19_lXQtoHWJy2onayAqg.text: This place is awesome in terms of location-- it's located right along the strip with a full on view of the Bellagio Fountain. However, that's pretty much the extent of it for me. The prices, as expected, were high, and it blew my mind that the burgers and steaks didn't come with sides. I ordered the New York steak, but was handed a prime rib instead. I didn't feel like complaining, so I just accepted it with a smile. However, the first bite was RIDICULOUSLY salty. Like, 5-days-worth-of-sodium-in-that-single-bite salty. My manager and I (who also ordered a steak) both sent our steaks back because this girl had size zero slacks to fit into the next day, and I couldn't afford any unnecessary bloating.  Our steaks came back *much* better in terms of seasoning. Definitely more edible, which is good! Unfortunately, the steak was very fatty (don't necessarily blame the restaurant for this, as I know most prime ribs are), and extremely greasy. I wish I could have dabbed it with a napkin but I didn't want my coworkers to judge me! The small side of balsamic glazed onions were extremely greasy as well; I'm sure they drench their food in oil while cooking. Some people love that, but I, however, am not a fan.  We also ordered a dessert platter, and while good, it wasn't super memorable. Service was good, as our waiter was very personable and our food came our within a reasonable amount of time.  If I were to come back to Vegas, I don't think I'd visit this place again. However, it is conveniently located on the strip, and is a good place if you don't mind a high price tag with slightly above average food.

799MuA6GnY0ZHhKvRbc36g.text: So....... Every City we visit we just have to try a brunch spot. When i looked up endless Mimosas on yelp HEXX was the first restaurant to show. I ordered the meat omelet, and the meal was great! Guess What was even better? TAYLOR!!!!!! We ordered bottomless mimosas and she didn't let the glass get half way empty before coming to fill us up. She had other large parties, but was still very attentive to all of her Parties. That's something that doesn't happen at restaurants often. Taylor offered premier Customer service.

uFgvu2HOZdL_7rY58v2hmg.text: Sitting outside on a relatively cool August night in Las Vegas watching the Bellagio Fountains while enjoying some good whiskey, some great appetizers and some fantastic jambalaya, well it doesn't get much better. Considering it's probably one of the most touristy spots on Earth, the prices aren't that crazy. Of course you're going to spend more than norm, however it is well worth it with Bocelli playing in the background watching the magical fountains shoot a couple of hundred feet up in the air. Great people watching. Excellent service. I didn't have to ask to have my water refilled once. Highly recommended.

iEzT7elcmaBuux7Ex4WMjg.text: Probably the fanciest place i went to during my weekend stay for edc. I was craving some chicken and waffles and some southern food. The dining area was huge and they accommodate for outside and inside seating. The food was great and service was top notch. I recommend the chicken and waffles and the jambalaya soooo goood

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine cellar
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken n waffles

z5D5wTP7KZcU1Va9sMK-_Q.text: Great location on the strip, not extremely expensive.  Portions to price is not too bad but still does warrant a $$ rating.  Two sides to sit in, unsure what the real difference between the two is except at night sometimes there is a DJ on one side.  Menu is cafe sized, so not a lot of options but they still have a great variety of options.  I had gotten the mashed potatoes side for $10 but the portion was underwhelming for the price.  I had also gotten a wedge salad for $12, and that was perfect for the price.  For dessert, the cake and shake (21 y/o+) and that was incredibly worth the $9.  Did not purchase any alcoholic drinks so bill ran me $31 before taxes.  Service is great; waitress and delivery folks all moved with haste, checked in with our group's satisfaction, and refilled drinks without us asking.  Even though restaurant was moderately busy, they acted as if we were the only ones there.  The Bellagio fountain "sneak peak" view is nice, just remember you have Las Vegas BLVD traffic blaring by, as well as Bellagio property line trees that prevent you from getting a full view of them.  Overall a very pleasant and classy dining experience.  Next time, will have to try the red meats on the menu.

A1yc8Ci48an57m7lY0n7eA.text: Sunday Brunch @ Hexx!! Sean was our waiter and it was fabulous .. the service was over the top and our food exceeded every breakfast/brunch expectation!! Thank you Sean!! See you again soon!!

xLwmQUSbazr4qM4JhZ8R1Q.text: First time dine @this place. Ordered 2 prime rib, but only one available. So, we changed 1 order to rib eye. But the prime rib came out too thick & doesn't taste right. We asked the waiter& he said that's how  prime rib suppose to be. The beef was too thick that was hard for to cut with the knife. For sure we not return to this place, not worth of $

SfI8Es10zpCMVdkp0363bA.text: The food at this place is pretty good, but I believe they use a cheap alcohol for the bottomless mimosas, We had them and Got sick for two days

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_mfBPEq5445PPTYozCwV0w.text: I came here just 3 weeks ago and had the most amazing time with a huge group of friends--there was a live DJ, bottomless mimosas, fast service, and delicious food. Today was a completely opposite and overwhelmingly disappointing experience. I booked our bachelorette party for brunch at 12:30, which we arrived promptly for, and despite checking with the front desk multiple times, we were not seated until 1:20. I had raved about the croissants here, assuring my group the wait would be worth it for the flaky butteriness alone. To my dismay, the server told us they had sold out of croissants just 5 minutes earlier...I could actually hear the hearts breaking in our group. Then to top it all off, the server told us bottomless ended at 2 (it was 1:30 by the time our orders were taken), which considering our reservation had been for 12:30 felt like we had been cheated. Hugely disappointing and I will not be recommending this to my friends in the future.

qM-NLAmySEJMrxEI6evrhg.text: Enjoyed dinner and brunch at this location. Service was impeccable.  My only complaint was that a couple of our dishes were a bit bland (halibut itself had minimal flavor but sauce made up for it; chilaquiles we ordered for brunch were average).  However, the hummus we ordered as an appetizer was AMAZING. The pita bread was fresh and warm. The hummus itself, white bean, was perfect!  As the waitress said, "we made hummus sexy".  100% agree.  A must try.  Dessert was a pumpkin brulee and as I described it, Thanksgiving in a ramekin. I literally felt like I was home eating all the home cooked-deliciousness of my grandmothers pumpkin pie. Bottomless mimosas for brunch were a nice add.  Definitely will stay on my list of places to eat in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SF0PEksiAghXGjkx0jECmA.text: My wife, friend and I ate breakfast at Hexx kitchen this morning.  The restaurant is nice and clean and the food is outstanding.  I had the breakfast pizza (Sausage and egg/$11.95) which was awesome.  My wife had the chilaquiles ($16.95) which were one of the best I've ever had.  My friend had the banana French toast ($13.95) and he said it was delicious.    To top things off, our waiter Sean was really attentive and checked on us often.  He was very friendly and polite and made an attempt to get to know us.  As we all know, customer service is really what makes a business thrive and Sean is a good interpretation of that.  This is what really makes customers return as I will when I come back to Las Vegas.

8hx7O1onx8j8NLWnbEG9zA.text: This place was great! The food was delicious, and the Bloody Mary really hit the spot. They serve them in small pitchers. The best part of our visit was the service. We were told we had to wait, which is expected on a morning in Vegas but the wait ended up being much shorter than anticipated. Our server (I wish I remembered his name!) was AWESOME! Seriously! He was fun, suggested food for us, and just took great care of us. He saw me scraping sauce off of my sandwich and insisted they make a new one, which I declined. Well he insisted, and the sandwich came out in record time. He even took some money off of our bill. He was a tall and bulky African American man. If you are a manager reading this, that guy is the best! I'll definitely be back when I'm in Vegas again later this year.

cCH_jYquWUdjFOLNdDdvbA.text: Good service right next to the Eiffel Tower Hotel Turkey Club Sandwich it is good except would like to see a different kind of bread a little dry.  Very good thin style pizza. Ask for patio sitting and get a kick of watching everybody stared at your food. The only draw back because of the location is the price and sort of small menu.  You must try the Chocolate candies a killer.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eguo--N2MLAAJBsY9JS3Rw.text: As a local, any time someone from out of town wants to do a nice-ish dinner on the strip, this is usually my first recommendation. I feel like you could come here dressed up or more casual and either would be acceptable. It used to be The Sugar Factory restaurant, which was my first favorite but I believe HEXX is still owned by the same parent company so the menu is still kind of similar, food-wise. The space is very clean, sleek, and modern. Cushy, loungey seating and good service. My favorite part of this restaurant, is the location. I love that it's right across from the Bellagio fountains, it makes for such a nice view so sit outside if the weather permits! As for food, I always get the HEXX burger - it has a white chocolate bun! I was told the white chocolate is baked into the bun's batter which gives it that sweet and savory taste next to the bacon and the rest of the burger. I also got one of the goblet drinks once and it was magical. I forget exactly which one, but it was bright blue, it "smoked" and had the most enticingly fruity aroma. It was also beyond delicious.

dYJfq98-PzQVrO9c5DbDeA.text: Tracee was our server at Hexx. The service was outstanding. She gave us great suggestions, was extremely friendly, and showed an interest in us as a group as we were celebrating a 35 year retirement. Hillary, the manager congratulated us on the event we were celebrating as well. The chicken BLT and lobster sandwiches were excellent. The table was in a perfect location outside with a view of the Bellagio Fountains.  Thank you for making our dining experience so memorable and fun. We will definitely be back in the near future.

S8mSNBFWmp-E1dGvebJrzA.text: Amazing!!! Great service!! Melissa was awesome - best service you can get! She was great and so nice, she deserves an award!

cdKWQkD3PoxFh1L16amO1Q.text: This place was amazing! First off, the place looks like something out of a magazine. It's beautiful inside! Next, the food was not only super delicious, but beautiful! We had the overlooked bacon with maple aioli which was mouth watering to say the least. Then we shared the fried calamari that contain calamari, rock shrimp, jalapenos, lemon and lime and it had this sex-in-your-mouth sauce drizzled all over it. My husband had a Bloody Mary that had bacon, jerky, chunk of cheese and celery in it. I had the bottomless mimosas which was so awesome. The waitress never let me cup go more than half empty. Speaking of waitress, she was super awesome. So personable and sweet. I think we clicked well with hers and my husbands experience of tattoos. I would totally recommend this place and can't wait to go back!

h1U0_6tdRQw7VKKfWbYXDg.text: So we are locals who HATE the strip, this experience may just change our minds! Came for my husbands 50th birthday, and we were not disappointed.starting with the hostess, and on to our amazing server Tracee, they gave my hubby the royal treatment for his day,and comped him his giant sticky bun for his birthday! Iwould definitely recommend this place in service and ambiance  alone, but I have to say the food was fabulous as well!

37SUEavEYrUqmNmSHrsLvA.text: This place is really beautiful and the food is decent but the service was terrible. The Host/Hostess were the rudest I have ever encountered at a restaurant! Our server was okay but she didn't seem thrilled to be serving myself, my husband, and our 2 year old son. He was just playing with my phone and not causing a scene, and my husband and I were not being disrespectful or making unreasonable demands so I don't know why we were treated so poorly. I would never recommend this place to anyone. Save your money, time, emotional and mental well being and go to any other restaurant but here!!!

BryfuiV-I-xTOsJj7aRg6A.text: #stevenisthebestserverever He recommended several dishes for us to share and the serving was just right. We had two kids with us as well and he made sure to recommend food for them as well since they did not have a kids menu. This is my second time here and would definitely come back... And hope that Steven is our server again.

q_ZTkQ0pGPHZts-FVqTlYg.text: Staying at the Paris Hotel for a couple of nights, we went to Hexx for breakfast the first morning just because it was convenient -- and then the second morning because the first experience had been  so positive. It is an open, airy room with very comfortable seating; the food was good to excellent, especially the delicious (and sorta decadent) home fries, crispy on the outside and melting inside; and the service was excellent both days. A special shoutout for Sean, our waiter the second morning, who was efficient, accommodating, and very personable -- plus, as my daughter correctly pointed out, it doesn't hurt that he looks a lot like The Rock.

creazBSRUW_D9To0Y-yO8w.text: First time at Hex... Was definitely blown away by the service Steven provided us. He was very informative and friendly. The food was absolutely delicious, artichoke dip and short rib dinner, amazing! Oh yes how could I forget the Aztec cake was to die for! Will definitely have to come back for other amazing dishes.

-NEEcy9vEGOdDD1jfam2wA.text: We had a fabulous breakfast!  The ambience is beautiful and the service impeccable!  Julia was so personable and fabulous in informing us about all the specialties Hexx has to offer!  We will be back before we leave!

7yg8ytbYFQy68BS2Gg1few.text: I'd say this place is average at best. We went for breakfast and got the chilaquiles. they were rather spicy despite being told they only had a "kick". Also they charge a random concession fee on top of your order.  it's also rather expensive for what you get. I'd say there are probably better places to get food in vegas

4bVgYKkEvElSrTwnI_KVxg.text: Great place, great food, great view. The restaurant is located in the middle of the strip right in front of the Bellagio fountain. They have excellent food and their cocktails and fresh, unique, and tasteful.

Ar-_PCdljnbBOQOjQF7P4g.text: The front desk is very rude and has bad attitude. Food is fair but the people were not nice.

1nDW874RX_Cdb6En7A0-sQ.text: Tracee was the best!! Bottomless mimosas and so much fun. The food was awesome, the staff was so much fun tol

n1fsAZ2WbTQOZ9LWJtcQZA.text: This restaurant was delicious! Had the French toast and bottomless mimosas. We had a great view from the restaurant sat outside on the strip. The waitress Terri made the experience a whole lot better, no one wants to deal with hungover people... She greeted us with a smile and great customer service. I will be coming here on my next trip to Vegas.

sjFs_ucO06ywLU2jjNBkkA.text: I had the French toast, yum! We were 11 people and were seated very quickly. We all enjoyed our dishes! Also visit the chocolate store, worth a look!

jI8gdVUcD92ePzx8PiUQWg.text: My husband really wanted desert last night and it was after midnight- everything else was closed but so glad we were walking by the Paris hotel and found Hexxx! They sat us at great seats on their patio overlooking the strip with he best people watching. Everything sounded so good! Thankfully Denise our wonderful server told us all about her favorite deserts and explained that they specialize in chocolate which they make in house- they have so many different types too! We ordered the chocolate peanut butter cheesecake which was amazing and coupled it with the Aztec cake and a scoop of ice cream per Denise's suggestion!   Juan who is one of the managers came over half way through our meal to check on us and we ended up chatting and he told us more about the restaurant and how they're trying to offer a 5 star restaurant experience and quality, while keeping it casual - that is exactly how I would describe it!! Juan was so fun and we can't wait to bring our friends and family back to try Hexxx and possibly go to Chateau which he so kindly offered to take us to. Service was awesome, fantastic atmosphere, our desert was amazing! Looking forward to going back to try all the food and drinks we saw everyone around us enjoying! So happy there is finally a late night (better yet 24 hr) restaurant in Vegas that has this quality!!

X2Tq9sCHavK4wOv05m9rxA.text: Worst coffee ever.! There is no coffee in the cappuccino, they charged 5$ more for an extra espresso shot.

YcfvyPbddgfKThz7n-PVMw.text: I've always been a fan of the drinks that come smoking to your table and Hexx definitely has some fun flavors to offer. Their chicken and waffles have been the best to me, even after living in LA and having Roscoe's, I'd still say Hexx is better! Service is good, location is really nice especially with the view of Bellagio's fountain!

iADp81zvo5ico0w6IydQvA.text: Having breakfast with Melissa at Hexx Kitchen + Bar was the most pleasant experience I have had my whole time in Vegas! She's an all around wonderful server and lady ! Cheers to Vegas!

ddIutGGKpfrrSGdeWXFzAA.text: Very nice atmosphere.  Tortilla soup was really good.  Our server Shawn was .  The Cesar salad was okay.  Definitely come back for drinks and vibe.

WKmMhcVdVxwsNqz3Kiaw8g.text: Taylor and Ivan were amazing!! They really kept up with our table as we were a large group. Always made sure our table was clean and we were okay! Taylor gave us amazing costumer service making us feel like she was our friend and wanted us to have A great experience. The brunch was delicious. 10/10

lBqbsoyeu7jMmwrhCXhl0A.text: Stopped in for appetizers but was disappointed with the selections. Ordered the Poutine fries (they may have been described as gravy instead) but the look was unappetizing. The fries were soggy.

photos.caption: Photo of HEXX kitchen + bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loaded fries - gravy, cheese curds, fries

UVvuVdEr0qgYGPrWUeXFXg.text: I had a wonderful dining experience here. Food was excellent and service was beyond our expectations. Our server, Sean, refilled our bottomless mimosas promptly and made us feel welcome. Did I mention we were celebrating a birthday? Well, Sean went above and beyond to make the birthday special. Will definitely come back to this restaurant when I'm back in town!

2k6zaHStyEFgc7NFB-QYpQ.text: Sean and Alec made our bachelorette brunch FABULOUS! Great service and food. Highly recommend.

9Ebgs1zced1f5OXBfcVTbA.text: Got the Special on Travel Zoo able to try the carrot cake and the signature dry iced Smokey drink excuse me for not remembering the name

f6VNsavcuIx9vd4ZwCvM-w.text: I had the eggs Benedict and it was delicious!! Our server Tracee was very attentive and friendly! This place is a must visit in Vegas!

LbaFmo8lRD5D59IhjaPTEw.text: I will make this short and sweet.  We were at Hexx last Saturday night (party of 10).  We were able to make a reservation in advance, which is always nice.  Our table was lovely, our server (Dave) was on top of everything! The drinks from the bar were EXCELLENT!  Service and food was top notch.  Honestly, 10 out of 10 people totally enjoyed the experience.  The steak I had was beautifully prepared and melted in my mouth.  The desserts were SO good!  All in all, fantastico!

MnB3pYW5_oXfVeL9hcjEcA.text: Good reasonably priced brunch spot on the strip. The open dining room and patio seating are great. Staff was nice and everything we ate was tasty. Would definitely o to HEXX again on our next trip to Vegas.

1Aol_uvotoX0_WpDQROwzQ.text: Came here twice for dinner this year. We loved the food! The waiter and waitress are really nice! I bought coupon for Travelzoo . It was easy to use. We will definitely come back again even there's no coupon!
